Surprisingly, my favorite dish there is the wonton soup - it's just so good. While the food is average, the service is always friendly and it's a reasonably priced spot for Chinese food.

source: Take it from me; avoid this place at all cost.  The only time I go is when I am starved and don't have the energy to cook or get edible food.  And then after I have been kicking myself.
target: Trust me, stay away from this place. I only step foot inside when I'm completely famished and too tired to make my own meal. But every time, I end up regretting my decision.

source: Far away from real Chinese food. Doesn't even taste good as American style Chinese food.
target: Not quite authentic Chinese cuisine. Lacks the deliciousness of Americanized Chinese dishes.

source:
I used to order takeout here once every month or so. The food tastes average and the price is good. It's your typical low-end Chinese place. 

The last (and final) time I ordered here I just so happened to be picking up my order while a health inspector from allegheny county health department was making his rounds. While I was waiting on my food (which took much longer than usual) the inspector was pointing out violations. He also requested a copy of a certificate that the man behind the register was unable to produce. The inspector looked at me like I was crazy for waiting on my food despite the obvious poor conditions.  

As for the rest of the place - it's always been kind of dirty inside. The carpets are just FILTHY and the walls match. There are always children's toys scattered about the floor because the owners children are always there, so be careful not to trip. 

The workers do seem like nice people just trying to make a living but when it comes to cleanliness Don Don is lacking.
target: In the past, I used to order takeout from Don Don about once a month. The taste was average, but the pricing was reasonable, and it had the typical feel of a low-end Chinese place. However, during my last visit, I noticed that the place was not very hygienic, with dirty carpets, and walls that seemed to match its floors. Moreover, there were scattered children's toys all over the place, which made it risky to walk. While I was waiting for my order, I witnessed a health inspector from the Allegheny County Health Department reprimanding the staff for their violations. Though the workers seemed nice, the restaurant seemed to lack the basic cleanliness standards required to run a restaurant.

source: We went on a weeknight.  Place was not busy waited over 20 minutes for drinks and to have our order taken.  We ordered an app and it came out with the meals and that was another 20 minutes or so.  Food was luke warm at best.  I would not go back.
target: We visited on a weeknight but unfortunately the place wasn't crowded. We had to wait for more than 20 minutes just to order our drinks and food. Surprisingly, our appetizer arrived with the main course which itself took around 20 minutes to be served. The food was just okay and not hot enough. I wouldn't plan to visit again.

source: This location never disappoints!! Food is always consistently great, and if you come at the right time, (witching hours) you may see the cook singing and dancing along with the music in the back. And it is awesome! ! Love this place!!
target: I can always count on this spot for an exceptional experience! The food never fails to impress, and if you catch it during the right time of day (happy hour, perhaps?), you might even get to witness the chef jamming out in the kitchen. It's truly a fantastic atmosphere - I absolutely adore this place!

source: I belong to this gym...  I live in the South section of Pittsburgh, and I find that this gym is not too far from me.  The staff is friendly, the equipment is quite good.  You get two free personal training sessions when you join.  They have lots of weights (which my boyfriend uses) and a decent cardio room.  The only thing I would say is to increase some of the cardio equipment.  Water is only $1 a bottle!
target: This gym is where I go for my workout routine. Its location is conveniently near my home in the South part of Pittsburgh. The personnel is amiable, and the facilities are impressive, especially the equipment. Upon joining, you can take advantage of the two complimentary personal training sessions. The place has abundant sets of weights, which my partner finds useful, and a satisfactory cardio room, although I think they can improve it by adding more equipment. Another plus is that they only charge a dollar for their bottled water.

source: I bought a three month membership last year, mainly to attend the Silver Sneakers classes. I was in my early sixties and hadn't exercised in a while. I tried the evening classes but they were very crowded and difficult, so I tried a morning class for seniors. I like to stretch out before my class actually starts, so I went to the tail end of a yoga class. The women in this class were very nasty to me and told me that I wasn't welcome to stretch out in their class. I never went back thanks to the attitude of the other members. I didn't feel welcome here. I complained to the manager, who said that I was welcome to stretch out in whatever class I wanted to, but the hostility of these yoga students was very evident. Do they think that this is their private gym?
target: Last year, I purchased a three month membership to attend Silver Sneakers classes. Though I hadn't exercised regularly in a while, I was eager to get back into a fitness routine. I initially tried the packed evening classes, but found them too difficult to navigate. Instead, I opted for a morning class geared towards seniors. Before the class began, I attempted to stretch in the tail end of a yoga class. However, the women in the class were unwelcoming and even hostile towards me. Their behavior made me feel unwelcome at the gym and I never returned. Even though the gym manager reassured me that I was allowed to stretch in any class I wanted, I couldn't shake off the rudeness of the yoga students. It made me wonder if they believed they owned the gym exclusively.

source: If you like being greeted in the morning by a gym worker slopping down eggs from a frying pany instead of working....this is your gym....complain to the manager and she gets nasty....try getting in touch with the owner....impossible!  Most unprofessional gym ever!!!!
target: This gym has unprofessional staff who prefer cooking eggs instead of doing their job, and the manager is unhelpful and unapproachable. Contacting the owner is also impossible. If you value a proper gym experience, this may not be the place for you.

source:
I brought my husband and my parents all to Papa J's last time my husband and I were in Pittsburgh. My parents are really picky about their italian food, usually they drive places in east bumf*@ (tarentum, ligonier...) to get their capital I-talian.

My pop is kinda grumbly, and getting him to try something new is like pulling teeth. The only reason I got him here was becuase they were on their way to drop us at the airport.

Well, my dad goes back now regularly and that says a lot, considering he lives in Murrysville. 

The first good sign Dad was happy was that he seemed impressed when it was open- it was noon a few days after Christmas. Second good sign was that Dad ordered wine, at it was only 1 pm. Dad, while not a teetotaler, rarely has a drink before 5 pm so I know he was anticipating a good meal. The kicker was that he was so happy he left our waitress a $20 tip on a $50 meal. 

Can I say, I live in Texas now and I still relive this afternoon back in December? I had chicken picatta...it was perfect. My dad had eggplant rollatini, my mom had a pizza, and my hubby had basic pasta and marinara. It all was amazing, delicous, and inexpensive. In Austin, you can't get a decent italian meal, much less a decent italian meal for under $50 for four people.

I know there are so many good Italian places in Pittsburgh but I just think back so fondly on this day...when me Dad liked someplace I took him :)
target: During our last trip to Pittsburgh, I took my family to Papa J's. My parents are extremely particular about their Italian food, so much so that they usually drive to faraway places like Tarentum or Ligonier to get their I-talian fix. Convincing my dad to try something new is like trying to move a mountain, so it was quite a feat to have him come along with us. However, he seemed impressed by the restaurant being open at noon a few days after Christmas, and even ordered wine with his meal (which is rare for him before 5 pm). My dad was so pleased with the food that he left our waitress a sizeable tip! I still think about that day fondly, especially since Italian food in Austin is quite expensive and not as good. I had some amazing chicken picatta, while my family enjoyed their eggplant rollatini, pizza, and basic pasta with marinara. Although there are many good Italian restaurants in Pittsburgh, Papa J's will always have a special place in my heart because of the memory I share with my dad.

source:
I've been to Papa J's twice and had mixed experiences.

Both times I had the banana pepper appetizer, which is great and goes really well with the FRESH and delicious bread and cheese they give you at the start of your meal.

For entrees, me and my girlfriend have had mixed experience.  I've had the fish sandwich (very good) and the eggplant parm sandwich (okay).  My girlfriend got the salad with bread and basil on it, but the basil was over powering and the bread was soggy with the dressing. 

The service is also a mixed bag.  The first time our server went out of her way to take care of us and even MADE me cocktail sauce for my fish sandwich.  The second time, the server was lackluster, didn't know anything about the menu and wasn't able to take proper care of us.  

I would return to Papa J's, but I my terrible experience last time isn't enough to say it would be my first pick of places to eat around Carnegie/Robinson.
target: I visited Papa J's twice and had varied experiences. The banana pepper appetizer was great and paired well with the bread and cheese, which were delightful and FRESH. However, the entrees were inconsistent. I enjoyed the fish sandwich, but the eggplant parm sandwich was just okay, while my girlfriend was disappointed with the salad due to the overpowering basil and soggy bread with dressing. The service was also hit or miss. The first time we received great service with the server going out of their way to ensure we were well taken care of, while the second time the service was lackluster, with the server showing no knowledge of the menu and being unable to offer proper service. Despite this, I would still consider returning to Papa J's, but it may not be my first choice in the Carnegie/Robinson area due to my mixed experiences.

source:
What a wonderful surprise found in Carnegie PA, just south of Pittsburgh.  I was in town on business with a couple co-workers and after having a not so great meal the night before, we asked one of the locals for a recomendation.  They told us to try this little Italian place called Papa J's and boy did they send us to a great place.

First off, when you walk up to the place, the front and side windows give you a fantastic open view into the kitchen from the outside.  You can stand outside and watch the chef making all the wonderful food and you can smell the fresh bread before you even walk in the door.

I am not sure how long this place has been around but the kitchen looked well used, while the dining area as well as the bar looked very clean and modern, almost as if it had been freshly updated.  

The server was quick to welcome us and suggested several different items off the menu as his favorites when asked.  The three of us were very hungry and wanting to try a few different things, so we began with a Margherita pizza which was absolutely perfect.  They obviously make their own breads and dough for the pizza and I don't think this pizza could have tasted any better.  Then came bowls of Italian wedding soup which was pretty good.  Of everything there, this was the one item I probably could have done without.  Not that it was bad, but there was nothing particularly special about it.  

We also ordered the Garlic Rolls (not that the bread they already give you and the pizza was not enough carbs for 1 meal) and they were to die for.  Crunchy on the outside and warm and chewy inside, these things were a meal by themselves.  One of the guys with me said the pizza sauce would be good on them so he ordered a cup of the pizza sauce (which is fresh made there, not out of some can) and he was right.  As if these little killer bread balls with garlic were not good enough, dipped in the pizza sauce they were even that much better.  

By the time our meals came, we were all pretty full, but we pushed on and continued to eat.  I had the Veal Parmigiano which was tender and very good.  It came with a side of pasta which I tasted just to try and it was excelent as well.  Had I not been eating a weeks worth of carbs in one sitting with all the pre-meal stuff, I certainly would have finished it.  As it was, I ate most but not all of the generous portion of veal.  

One of my co-workers had the Chicken Picatta which he said was one of the best he had ever had and the other guy tried a pasta dish which he said was very good as well.  

They had a great wine selection as well at reasonable prices by the glass or bottle.

Overall a fantastic experience with great food and atmosphere.  I don't really know how expensive the area is for food, but coming from the Chicagoland area, I fouknd this place to be pretty reasonable.  The three of us ate very very well for an average of aproximately $30 each not including alcahol.  Fantastic fresh food at a reasonable price, who could ask for more.

My only complaint is that I had to return to Chicago and I am now craving to return to Papa J's.  I hope work sends me out here again sometime soon!!!
target:
I recently had a wonderful surprise dining experience at a small Italian restaurant called Mama Mia's in downtown Seattle. My friend and I were looking for a good meal and stumbled upon this hidden gem. Upon walking up to the restaurant, we were immediately drawn to the large windows that allowed us to peek into the kitchen where we saw the chef preparing fresh, homemade pasta. The aroma of garlic bread and tomato sauce wafted out onto the street, signaling that we were in for a treat. 

The interior of the restaurant was cozy and inviting, with modern decor and a warm, welcoming atmosphere. The server greeted us promptly and recommended several dishes from the menu. We started off with the antipasto platter, which was overflowing with cured meats, cheeses, and olives. It was the perfect starter to share between the two of us. 

For our entrees, my friend ordered the classic spaghetti and meatballs, while I opted for the chicken parmesan. Both dishes were beautifully presented and tasted even better than they looked. The chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside, and the pasta was cooked to perfection. As if we weren't full enough, the server convinced us to try the tiramisu for dessert, which was absolutely heavenly. 

All in all, Mama Mia's exceeded our expectations in every way. The food was delicious, the service was impeccable, and the atmosphere was charming. And to top it all off, the prices were very reasonable. We left feeling satisfied and content, already planning our next visit to this wonderful restaurant.

source:
Yay, I'm a fan but sometimes service is a little slow, it was very good for us this visit.  Go to Papa j's every once in a while but mostly for the White Pizza.  It is the best white pizza I have ever had.  Order the white pizza on our visit this  weekend... it has garlic, spinach, feta cheese and we usually add some veggie on top.  It was delicious!  Order fried calamari and it was OK...note to self next time try the calamari roman style.

Like the dinning room with the hardwood floors and bright lighting.  

The bar was jumping thou never go to the bar.
target: I really enjoy visiting Papa J's as a fan, even though the service can be slow at times. However, on our most recent visit, the service was excellent! I usually go for their White Pizza, which is truly unbeatable- it has to be the best white pizza I've ever had. This time we ordered one with garlic, spinach, feta cheese, and some added veggies on top - it was absolutely delicious. While the fried calamari we ordered was only okay, I made a mental note to try their calamari roman style the next time I visit. I personally love the dining room atmosphere, especially the hardwood floors and bright lighting. Although, I've never been to the bar, it looked like a happening place.

source: Terrible service.  Food unremarkable.  Waiter disappeared for 45 minutes to serve larger group due to staffing mismanagement.  Saved his tip by discounting meal after I complained.  All and all, a very crude and unpleasant dining experience for me and my guests.  Not to be repeated, never again!
target: The dining experience was disappointing. The food was average and the service was poor. The waiter was absent for a significant amount of time to serve a bigger group of people. The only saving grace was the waiter offering a discount after receiving a complaint. Overall, the experience was unsatisfactory and I do not plan on returning.

source:
Yay, I'm a fan of the white pizza.  Had take out.  

The bar was jumping when I picked up our order.

The white pizza is so delicious...with garlic, spinach, feta, and added some veggies.  Tried the Roman Style calamari, very good better than the fried calamari we had last time.
target: I absolutely love the white pizza! We ordered takeout and when I went to pick it up, the bar was buzzing with activity. The white pizza is just so tasty, especially with the garlic, spinach, feta, and extra veggies. We also tried the Roman Style calamari and it was really good, even better than the fried calamari we had before.

source:
OK, its Friday night and have about 70 minutes to eat. Driving by Papa J's and W says, lets stop in and get a quick dinner. 

Advice host that we are in a hurry.  The host advised us it is a 90 minute service. The place was crowded, we were seated at the last open table. However our waiter, Jason, said he will do his best to get as out on time. We ordered our dinner immediately, with a salad and a glass of wine. In a few minutes we had our wine, then in a few more seconds we had our salads and some great homemade Italian bread with some olive oil and balsamic ving. for dipping.  Yum!

Just as we were finishing our salads our dinners were delivered. Great job Jason! The Fettuccine Carbanara was very good; a thick cream sauce with bacon and ricotta.  In and out in 60 minutes.  Now that is some good service.
target: It's a Friday night and we have only 70 minutes to grab a quick bite. We decide to stop at Papa J's and inform the host about our time constraint. Though the host lets us know that the wait time is 90 minutes, we are seated at the only table available. Our server, Jason, assures us that he'll do his best to serve us quickly. We order our meals, accompanied by a salad and a glass of wine. The wine arrives shortly, followed by the salads and some delicious Italian bread with balsamic vinegar and olive oil for dipping. As we finish our salads, our main dishes are served. Jason has done an excellent job! The Fettuccine Carbanara is a creamy delight with bacon and ricotta. We are in and out within an hour, thanks to Jason's efficiency. That's what I call great service!

source: Great little gem! The food was fantastic was very food and just the right price. The Italian food was amazing, but you can not leave without a dessert and be prepared for giant serving. I had the carrot cake yummy!! Def a place everyone should try.
target: Fabulous find! The cuisine was superb and reasonably priced. The Italian dishes were exceptional, however, make sure to leave room for their generous dessert portions. I indulged in the delicious carrot cake! Definitely a restaurant worth experiencing.

source:
I have to say that I write this review with much regret, because I have always loved PaPa J's. But my recent experience there has changed my mind a bit. 

From the minute we were seated, we were greeted by a server that was clearly inexperienced and didn't know the menu. As I said before, I've been to PaPa J's a good handful of times so I know the menu decently well, but the server couldn't explain any of the questions I had about a couple new dishes I was thinking about trying. I swear this guy must have just looked at the menu for the first time a few minutes ago.

But it wasn't just the knowledge of the menu. It was one thing after another with our server. My wife asked for a glass of water 4 times until she finally got it (at which point the meal was over, so we didn't care at that point).  I mean come on, for a restaurant of this calibre and price is it too much to ask for a glass of water? There was no one filling up water.

My biggest complaint, however, is what happened with our meals. My dad and I both ordered the trout special (trout with roasted red peppers and lump crabmeat). Instead, the meal that was delivered to both of us was trout with a heaping pile of spinach and mushrooms. Not what the special was at all.  And by the way, that item is on the menu as a regular item so whether or not the mistake was made by the server (which, we are sure it was) or the chef, who knows for certain. Not to mention, though, that a good server wouldn't have served us that regardless. 

But before you think we had an unusal experience that was all due to a poor server, let me continue. When we informed our server of the mistake, he didn't really believe us until he checked his order sheet, and then he blamed the error on the chef. At this point, the meal had been sitting (because it took us forever to flag this guy down again) so the trout was basically cold. The server then said he would have the meals re-made. So, he took the meals back to the kitchen. Meanwhile, of course, my wife and mom are eating their meals and my dad and I are sitting there with no meals. Also keep in mind that my wife still had not gotten the water she had been asking for, and my iced tea had been refilled with a soda (yes, believe that or not). All the kitchen did was scrape their "mistake" off of our fish! They didn't remake anything. Our fish was served to us again with little pieces of spinach and mushrooms sticking all over it. Quite frankly, the fish wasn't good at all. I honestly would have rather had a fish sandwich from McDonald's that night. The server never did anything to try to make our experience better - he knew we weren't happy, but never offered anything such as dessert on the house. I'm not looking for a handout, but our experience was just plain awful that night. The guy never really even apologized for the mistake. Normally, I may have asked for a manager, but at this point I was ready to just get out of there (plus, we had to be somewhere else that night).

My opinion... for the money, there are many other restaurants I would rather eat at.
target: It is with regret that I write this review, as I have always held high regards for PaPa J's. However, my recent visit wasn't up to par. Our server was inexperienced and had little knowledge of the menu, making it difficult for me to decide on a dish I wanted to try. On top of that, our drinks were not being refilled and my wife had to ask for water four times before finally receiving it. When our meals arrived, my father and I received something completely different from what we had ordered. When we brought this to the server's attention, he didn't believe us at first and blamed the mistake on the chef. Instead of remaking the dish, the kitchen just scraped off the unwanted items and served it to us again. The entire experience was disappointing and the server didn't try to make it better. For the price, there are other restaurants I would rather dine at.

source: san francisco california visitor liked the food and the local is great. I am thinking about relocating to pttsbrgh area. I liked Carnegie because u can stroll down Main street and hit a couple places for lunch. I imagine this place would be crazy busy on friday or saturday night. we ate a lunchtime and it was nice.
target: A traveler enjoyed the delicious cuisine and vibrant atmosphere of San Francisco, California. However, they are considering moving to the Pittsburgh area. Their favorite part of Carnegie was leisurely strolling down Main Street and enjoying a few lunch spots. They anticipate the town being packed on weekends, but nevertheless had a pleasant lunch experience.

source:
Coming here you get the feeling they haven't changed much.  The tables, the decorations, the menu.  All the same.  Does that make you a little worried?  Yes.

I ordered the mushroom ravioli and it was... oily.  Very very oily.  The actual ravioli was okay, enough mushrooms.  but it was oily.  Did I mention that?  

Ambiance, like I said, left much to be desired.  I don't think I'd have this place on my list of "musts" for downtown.  Much better restaurants to visit!
target: Upon arrival, the restaurant appears to have remained stagnant. The dcor, tables, and menu have not seemed to undergo any significant changes. This lack of transformation may give rise to disconcerting thoughts. I opted for the mushroom ravioli and was disappointed to find it incredibly greasy. While the ravioli itself possessed an adequate amount of mushrooms, the oily residue detracted from the dish's enjoyment. The ambiance of the establishment was also lackluster, and I would not consider it a priority destination in downtown. There exist numerous superior dining options to explore instead.

source:
Had dinner at Papa J's with a group of 6.  I loved how the restaurant is in a old brick building with large windows. It felt like a neighborhood restaurant. On a Saturday night, the restaurant was full but not crowded.  We were seated in a room with poor acoustics.  It was difficult to hear people at our table and the waitress.  While she tried, I can see the asperation in her face when she had to repeat the specials to both sides of the table.

People ordered bourbon on the rocks before dinner which seemed watered down, while my lemon drop was made nice.  The bread was delicious!  Can you describe it to be creamy?  The fried zucchini was lightly breaded and not too oily.  It was a large portion made up of 2 sliced zucchinis.

We ordered a variety of dishes.  The pasta dish was dry with more pasta than sauce or meat.  Those who ordered the fish special thought it was delicious.  The shrimp dish was enjoyed as well.  I had the chicken marsala which was pretty good.  The marsala sauce wasn't too thick, and the chicken moist.

Hard to tell if the deserts were "homemade."  The tiramisu and spumoni were small in portion and meant for one. 

On the whole, I was on the fence with my overall impression of Papa J's.  "A-ok" probably is the best way to describe it.
target: Went out to eat at Papa J's with a group of six and enjoyed the atmosphere of the restaurant being in an old brick building with large windows. The restaurant was busy on a Saturday night, but not overly crowded. However, the room we were seated in had poor acoustics, making it difficult to hear each other and the waitress. Bourbon on the rocks seemed watered down, but the lemon drop was delicious. The bread was creamy and the fried zucchini was lightly breaded and not too oily. The pasta dish was dry, but the fish and shrimp specials were enjoyed by those who ordered them. The chicken marsala was pretty good with a moist chicken and not too thick marsala sauce. The tiramisu and spumoni desserts were small portions, and it was hard to tell if they were homemade. Overall, my impression of Papa J's was "A-ok."

source: Service in this place is poor because of lack of acknowledgment since people working there are \"just\" working . They have nice decor,nice bar and good bread. Consider where this place is ,the prices are really really high . Nothing is served on the side with main dishes ....
target: The service in this establishment leaves something to be desired, possibly due to the lack of recognition for the employees who are simply doing their jobs. Despite the attractive decor, well-stocked bar, and quality bread, the prices are surprisingly steep considering the location. Additionally, it's worth noting that main dishes are not accompanied by any side dishes.

source: Terrible service...terrible food...this place smells like rotten wet wood
target: This place has an unpleasant smell and the food and service are both disappointing.

source: Although the first impression through the door is charming and the aroma enticing  as you enter this restaurant- much can be improved upon for the prices asked for the dining experience. Our group of 7 had called a week ahead and were seated in the back of the far dining room, right by a door where clinking pots /pans and  dishes were heard throughout our meal, as well as a Darth Vader type noise coming from the ceiling vent. Our waitress was not knowledgable of all menu items, and three of our  very simple requests did not come out as ordered. ( dressing on the side of a salad,  less feta on an entree and no oil on another entree) The waitress blamed it on the cook, but did offer to get one entree changed. Also we were asked if we wanted pine nuts, feta or Gorgonzola on our salad and then were charged 2.00 extra per item in addition to the salad price (6.99) which brought the salad up to 10.99 ! Outrageous !\nThere is so much possibility for ambiance in this restaurant , but they miss the mark on service and atmosphere. I will most likely not return. Very overpriced for the quality and service.
target: The restaurant had a charming initial impression with an enticing aroma as we walked through the door. However, our dining experience was not worth the prices charged. Despite making a reservation for our group of seven a week in advance, we were seated in the far dining room by a door where we could hear clinking pots and pans, dishes and a constant noise from the ceiling vent. Our waitress was not well-informed about the menu, and three of our straightforward requests were incorrect. Although she put the blame on the cook, she offered to fix one of them. Additionally, we were asked if we wanted pine nuts, feta, or Gorgonzola on our salad and then charged an extra $2.00 per item, bringing the salad's cost to $10.99, far too expensive. Although the restaurant could have great ambiance, the poor service and lackluster environment left much to be desired, and I will not be returning. The price for the quality and service was excessive.

source: Papa J's is expensive and inconsistent.  The ambiance is nice but it doesn't justify the prices.  There are better restaurants in Carnegie.
target: Papa J's prices are high and their quality is not always consistent. Although the atmosphere is pleasant, it is not worth the high prices. There are superior dining options available in Carnegie.

source:
I was pleasantly surprised by this restaurant.  Came here with no expectations.  

I was greeted by a large open (garage style) window, that opened the whole lounge bar area to the street.  It had modern furnishings and the staff were quite friendly.

Ordered the quattro formaggi pizza.  Quite good!!!  Great balance of cheeses.  Not too rich at all.  Crust was excellent too.  Can't wait to come back.
target: I had little to no expectations when I arrived at this restaurant, but I ended up being pleasantly surprised. The lounge bar area was connected to the street with a large open window, which was modernly furnished and had a very friendly staff. The quattro formaggi pizza was especially enjoyable with its perfect balance of cheese that wasn't too rich, and the crust was excellent as well. I definitely look forward to making another visit.

source: Absolutely Awful Service.  Went to Papa J's awhile ago and the service was bad - the waiter was surly, rude and unhelpful..  Decided to try it again since it is close to Stage 62.  Big mistake.  Greeted by a dour manager that seemed mad that we had a reservation. 30 minutes to get a glass of wine.  At one hour and 45 minutes complained to the manager that we still had not received out entrees.  He said 'What do you want me to do about it?\" and said they had a busy night.  This is when tables around us sat empty. I then had to go back to the manager to give us our bill so we could get away from this ruined evening.  The bill was prepared incorrectly. If you want average food and terrible service, this is your place.  We will never go back.
target: The service at Papa J's was beyond disappointing. During our first visit, the waiter was unpleasant and unaccommodating. We decided to give it another try, but it only got worse. The manager greeted us with a scowl despite having made a reservation, and our drinks took a painfully long time to arrive. After 1 hour and 45 minutes of waiting for our entrees, we decided to complain to the manager, who showed no concern for our dissatisfaction and blamed their busy night. Meanwhile, empty tables sat around us. We finally had to request our bill before leaving this disappointing evening behind. The bill was even prepared incorrectly. This place is only suitable for those who don't mind subpar food and terrible service. Needless to say, we will not be returning.

source: Service was great. Apps delish, specifically the stuffed banana peppers & lentil with ham soup. I think I chose the wrong entree though because I ordered a cod with crabmeat special. The cod was completely tasteless with some crabmeat layed across the top. It all reminded me of boiled fish. Yuck! Note to self. Order the pasta!
target: The food at the restaurant was delicious, especially the stuffed banana peppers and lentil with ham soup. However, I regretted ordering the cod with crabmeat as it lacked flavor and was reminiscent of boiled fish. Next time, I'll remember to go for the pasta. Nonetheless, the service was excellent.

source: I love this place! The food is always so fresh and delicious. The staff is always friendly, as well.
target: This place is amazing! The cuisine is consistently delectable and made from fresh ingredients. Additionally, the staff is always welcoming and kind.

source:
spinach/feta cheese salad:  B-
pesto alfredo penne :  :A+
Coconut Cake huge piece:  A+
bread small portions:  B
Service B 
host seemed grumpy, waitress good, but then she got busy .
PRICE: Pasta was $15 and the portion smallish more like a $12.99 dish 
ARRIVE EARLY ON SATURDAY NIGHT THIS PLACE PACKED after 6pm
target: The pesto alfredo penne dish was a winner with an A+ rating, while the spinach and feta cheese salad only received a B-. The Coconut Cake slice was huge and delicious, also earning an A+. However, the bread servings were small and received a B rating. The overall service was also given a B rating, with the host appearing grumpy, but the waitress being good, albeit busy. The pasta dish was a bit pricey at $15 for the smallish portion, more fitting of a $12.99 dish. It's recommended to arrive early on Saturday night as the place gets packed after 6pm.

source: It was just what we were looking for. The service was great. My husband had the veal sausage on green pepper appetizer in the larger size. It was great (spicy) and enough for a meal. I had the stuffed eggplant. That was very good but the sauce could have been a bit heartier. I would definitely go back. Really nice atmosphere and free parking in the back.
target: Exactly what we needed! The service was excellent. I ordered the larger size of veal sausage on green pepper appetizer for my husband and he loved it (spicy) and it was filling enough for a complete meal. I opted for the stuffed eggplant which was very tasty, although, the sauce could have had a little more substance. I would definitely return; the ambiance is lovely and there's free parking available at the back.

source:
We stopped at Papa J's last Friday night (8/1) for a round of drinks. There were 7 of us altogether and we had eaten at another restaurant earlier in the evening.  One member of our party walked up to the bar to let them know we were sitting on the couches along the wall, as it was fairly busy that night. In the short time that he was there, a man who was behind the bar looked at him and then turn away without saying a word or notifying anyone else. He then turned to a waitress who had approached the service area of the bar and asked her if  we could have a server take our drink order. She said "yep" and then abruptly turned and walked away. At that point, he asked to see the manager  who came a few minutes later. When my friend told him of what had occurred, the manager said "What do you want me to do"?

My friend said "An apology would be a good start" whereupon the manager looked back at him and said "Get out and don't come back" ???????? Are you kidding????

My friend is well traveled and frequently stays at higher end hotels and dines at quality restaurants. He was not screaming or belligerent in any way, shape, or form; simply informing the manager of what had occurred. 

That being said, we left and went back to 131 East, where we had previously eaten. The service there was fabulous, as was the meal and the drinks creative and exquisite.

There are new restaurants that have opened in Carnegie as of late. Papa J's is no longer the only game in town.  Obviously this is the way a simple complaint is handled by management. Appalling!!  Do yourself a favor and frequent any of the other restaurants that are within walking distance of Papa J's. They understand the concept of  customer service.
target: Last Friday night, a group of seven of us stopped at Papa J's for drinks after we had eaten at another restaurant earlier in the evening. As it was a busy night, one member of our party went up to the bar to inform them we were sitting on the couches along the wall. However, the man behind the bar ignored him and turned away without saying a word. After asking a nearby waitress if we could order drinks, we requested to speak with the manager to inform him of the incident. However, the manager's response was inappropriate, telling us to leave and not come back. As a result, we went to another restaurant, 131 East, where we received excellent service and had a delicious meal with creative drinks. If you're in Carnegie, we would recommend going to any of the other restaurants that understand the importance of customer service.

source: Some of the best chow around--love this place. The bread and salads and soups are great.
target: This place serves delicious food. The bread, salads, and soups are all excellent.

source:
Finally, great Tuscan-style Italian food in Pittsburgh, not that tasteless stuff that locals think is Italian.

The bread was warm and fresh. The bolognese sauce was creamy and rich, and unlike most restaurants was made with veal. I love the fresh smell of baking bread throughout the restaurant.

I'm looking forward to working my way through the menu of chicken options, and next time, I'm saving room for dessert! The display of cakes and pastries at the door was amazing.
target: At last, Pittsburgh has authentic Tuscan-style Italian cuisine that locals will appreciate instead of the bland offerings they mistake for Italian food. The bread is served warm and freshly baked while the bolognese sauce is rich, velvety and unique, made with veal not often found at other establishments. The aroma of baking bread wafts throughout the restaurant, a sensory delight. There are numerous chicken dishes on the menu that I cannot wait to try, and I have resolved to leave enough room for sweets next time. The cakes and pastries on display near the entrance were truly impressive.

source: Man has this place gone down hill.  My husband and I went a couple of weeks ago.  We had salads and pasta.  Both were on the verge of inedible.  With a single glass of wine, I felt downright robbed at the $50 price tag.  Seriously, I could have easily made what we had with jarred sauce and boxed pasta at home. Classico is better.  And the service was pretty absent to make it even worse... seemed she knew it was terrible and didn't want to deal with it.  Seriously, I'd rather eat at the OG.
target: This restaurant has really declined in quality. My spouse and I dined there a few weeks back and ordered salads and pasta dishes. Unfortunately, the food was nearly inedible and overpriced, leaving us feeling ripped off even after just one glass of wine. The service was also lacking, making our experience even more unpleasant. It's a shame because we could have easily made better meals at home with store-bought ingredients. We would have preferred eating at a chain restaurant instead.

source: Talk about overpriced. $18 for a fairly basic pasta with some obviously frozen chicken chopped up over it. The latter was terrible, thin and flabby and rather unappealing. The pasta itself was ok, as was the sauce. The desserts are pretty good. But honestly, that is a $10 dish whose price has been inflated.
target: Can you believe the price of this pasta?! It's a simple dish with frozen chicken on top and yet they charge $18 for it. The chicken was not enjoyable at all, with a thin and flabby texture. The pasta and sauce were decent, but not worth the high price tag. The desserts were the only highlight. It's a shame they've inflated the price so much for what should be a $10 meal.

source: I've decided where I stand with Emmert Dental. They are unprofessional, rude and have no clue what they're doing (behind the desk). I will not be going back nor will I have nice things to say about them.
target: My experience with Emmert Dental has led me to form a firm opinion. Their lack of professionalism, rudeness and incompetence (especially behind the desk) makes it clear that I won't be returning to their practice. Additionally, I won't be recommending them to others.

source: THE WORST DENTAL EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE.  THEY ARE BUTCHERS!  My husband and I went to Emmert Dental in Bethel Park for a routine cleaning and check up.  I had one tooth that I had a recent root canal on and a few small cavities that needed filled.  After the so called dentist - Dr Carnavali - did my exam, I needed 3 additional root canals and an extraction! An extraction on the tooth that just had a root canal. I was told that part of the tooth had broken off and that a crown was no longer possible.  I didn't know any better, so I agreed to schedule the extraction for a few weeks later. The \"dentist\" wanted to extract it that day, but I had plans for the weekend and was not about to be in pain. So, 2 weeks later, I went in for the extraction.  After they gave me novocaine they get me with \"you need a bone graft also in that area since we are extracting that tooth\". I have never had any issues with bone loss with previous extractions so I didn't feel it was necessary. I had 3 employees surrounding me, pressuring me for this bone graft. So, I reluctantly agreed. I had to pay $259.00 for this \"bone graft\". So, I signed everything. I wasn't even given enough time to read the document, so I should have known and got up and left right then and there. The \"dentist\" started the extraction. I have never been so uncomfortable in my life. He pulled on my tooth, used a metal instrument to pound on my tooth and was pulling so hard that my head was coming up and slamming back down against the head rest.  Finally, after a good 15 minutes of this torture, he ripped the tooth out of the side of my jaw. I was literally ganging from all the blood running down the back of my throat. He then stuck some pink powder up in the extraction area. I'm assuming this was the bone graft.  I ended up with many stitches. I was given an antibiotic and instructed to schedule an appointment for the following Saturday so they could start the bridge. Then I was hit with a bill of $569.00! My insurance covers 100% of extractions.  I was in so much pain for 2 weeks following the extraction. Pain severe enough that I had to call off work and I couldn't sleep at night.  I refused to go back to Emmert Dental.  And after a visit to a very reputable dentist, an endodontist and an oral surgeon, I have to have oral surgery to try and repair the damage Emmert Dental has done to my mouth.  They caused a very large deformity in my jaw and I am at risk to lose additional teeth.  Save yourself a lot of time, money and pain.  Emmert dental only cares about the money, will over charge you and leave you less than happy with the dental work.  They are butchers and should not even call themselves dentist. And if you have an issue with their billing practices, don't expect to that resolved easily.  I have called numerous times and I am always told that the manager and or billing department is not in.  I have contacted the BBB and a lawyer.  I expect and want a full refund.  No one should have to go thru what I am currently going thru.  They do unnecessary extractions so they can do a more expensive procedure such as a bridge or an implant.  Now I have to go thru oral surgery, more pain and suffering and more time missed from work because of Emmert Dental.  And the root canals they said I needed, my current dentist and my endodontist both agreed that I do not need tooth canals.  In fact, the teeth are perfectly healthy.  They are crooks and butchers.
target: I had a terrible experience with a dental clinic called Emmert Dental in Bethel Park. My husband and I went for a routine cleaning and checkup. I already had a tooth that had a recent root canal and a few cavities that needed filling. However, after Dr. Carnavali examined me, he recommended three more root canals and even an extraction on the tooth with a recent root canal. The tooth had apparently broken off, and a crown was no longer possible. I reluctantly agreed to schedule the extraction for a later date, which cost me $259 for a "bone graft" that I didn't even need. During the extraction, the "dentist" was rough, and it was one of the most uncomfortable experiences of my life. I ended up with many stitches, took antibiotics, and was instructed to come back for a bridge, costing me $569. My insurance covers 100% of extractions, but Emmert Dental overcharged me. I was in so much pain for two weeks that I had to call off work and couldn't sleep at night. I later got a second opinion from reputable dentists and found out that I did not need the root canals and that my teeth were perfectly healthy. It turns out that Emmert Dental only cares about profit and will do unnecessary procedures to make more money. I have to undergo oral surgery now to repair the damage they've done, which has led to a deformity in my jaw and put me at risk of losing more teeth. They are crooks and butchers who should not be called dentists. I urge you to stay away from Emmert Dental and avoid the time, money, and pain I had to go through.

source: The worst dental office I ever been. No one can beat it!!! You should avoid it at any time.
target: This dental office is absolutely terrible. It's definitely one to avoid at all costs!

source: Eat at your own risk. The service is terrible, the staff seem to be generally clueless, the management is inclined to blame the staff for their own mistakes, and there's no sense of FAST in their fast food. When we came, half of the menu board was still on breakfast, and it was 4:30p. The only thing they have going for them is that the food is hot and tastes just like McDonald's should. \n\nThen again, the franchise is owned by Rice, and I've come to take terrible service is their MO.
target: Dine with caution. The quality of service is poor, the employees appear to be uninformed, the management tends to fault the staff for their own errors, and the fast food establishment lacks efficiency. On our visit, some items on the menu were still for breakfast, despite it being 4:30p. The only redeeming factor is that the food is hot and tastes akin to what one would expect from McDonald's. Nevertheless, Rice's management of the franchise seems to be consistent with their reputation of delivering subpar service.

source:
My expectations for McDonalds are t rarely high. But for one to still fail so spectacularly...that takes something special!
The cashier took my friends's order, then promptly ignored me. I had to force myself in front of a cashier who opened his register to wait on the person BEHIND me. I waited over five minutes for a gigantic order that included precisely one kid's meal. After watching two people who ordered after me be handed their food, I asked where mine was. The manager started yelling at the cashiers for "serving off their orders" when they didn't have their food. But neither cashier was anywhere near those controls, and the manager was the one serving food to customers and clearing the boards.
The manager was rude when giving me my order. She didn't make sure that I had everything ON MY RECEIPT, and never even had the decency to apologize that I felt I was getting poor service.
I've eaten at various McDonalds restaurants for over 30 years. I've worked at more than one location. I expect bad days, bad moods, and the occasional mistake. But I have yet to have a decent experience at this store. It will remain a place I avoid unless someone in my party needs to avoid illness from low blood sugar. Perhaps I should go back to the racially biased service of Steak n Shake instead!
target: Although I don't have lofty expectations when it comes to McDonald's, visiting one that fails so spectacularly is quite a feat! The cashier paid attention to my friend's order but chose to ignore me. I had to forcefully get in front of another cashier who opened his register to serve the person standing behind me. Despite waiting for five long minutes, my order which consisted of just one kid's meal was not ready. When I enquired about it, I saw two people who had ordered after me receiving their food. The manager started scolding the cashiers for passing orders when the customers hadn't received their food. However, neither of the cashiers had access to those controls, and the manager was the one serving food and clearing the boards.\nWhen I received my order, the manager was rude and hadn't ensured that everything on my receipt was there. Not even a word of apology was uttered about their poor service.\nI have been eating at McDonald's locations for over three decades, and I have worked at multiple locations. I'm aware that off days and mistakes happen, but I have never had a positive experience at this restaurant. Unless someone in my group has low blood sugar and needs sustenance, I won't be visiting this store again. Maybe I'll have to go back to the prejudiced service of Steak n Shake instead!

source:
I've tried to give this McDonalds a chance but my patience has run out. The only reason why I came here as much as I did is because I like the $1 iced coffees. But it's not even worth it. This McDonalds is poo and so is most of the staff. 

Whenever I want to go through the drive-thru I can't because there is a line of cars wrapped half away around the building. And even when the line is shorter there's always a hold up of some sort. So most of the time I just park and go inside the restaurant. 

Today was a horrible day. I ordered an iced coffee (no cream or sugar) and a chocolate chip cookie. It only takes 30 seconds to fill a cup with coffee and 30 seconds to take a cookie out of the case. I waited 10 minutes!! Sorry but that's too long just to get a coffee and a cookie! It's not like I ordered a meal! During that time I saw people come in after me and get their milkshakes and iced coffees within two minutes! WTH?! I told the petite sleepy eyed cashier I wanted my money back! Her eyes opened wide in surprise, like I really woke her up or something. She said,"Youre the one who ordered the iced coffee? I can get it for you!" For real? She was the one who took my order! I told her I waited too long and I just want my money back. The manager offered to make my iced coffee, but  I refused because I had just had enough.

There are *few* employees there who work hard but everyone else is dragging their feet. There is no organization or teamwork, everyone is scrabbling. It looks like none of them want to be there. I used to work in fast food and I know it sucks, but come on!

I'm sorry but I can't recommend this Mcdonalds. It's poo. I'm not coming back here anymore. Guess I'll be going to Starbucks- and their iced coffees taste better anyway!
target: I used to be a regular customer at this McDonald's, but my patience has worn thin. I only came here for their $1 iced coffees, but the quality has gone downhill. The drive-thru is always packed and even when it's not, there are delays. I prefer to park and go inside, but even that has become a frustrating experience. Recently, I had to wait 10 minutes for a simple order of an iced coffee and a chocolate chip cookie. I saw others get their orders quickly, which made me question the competency of the staff. While there are a few hard workers, the rest seem apathetic and disorganized. As someone who has worked in fast food before, I understand that it's not easy, but this situation is unacceptable. I asked for a refund and refused their offer to make me a new coffee. I cannot recommend this McDonald's and will be going to Starbucks instead, where their iced coffees are better.

source:
This McDonald's is so bad it's amazing.  

Order:  Big mac, large fries, diet coke.

The soda machine was broken.   No sodas.

Then I got to the window.  "We rang you up for medium fries."   (Not what I asked for)  "Well, if you want a large, you're gonna have to wait 4 minutes.  We just started a new batch."

Left with:  Big mac, medium fries, no coke.

Actually, now that I think about it, this was one of my better experiences there...
target: Despite encountering some issues with my order at this McDonald's restaurant, I strangely found myself enjoying the experience. I ordered a Big Mac, large fries and a diet Coke, but unfortunately the soda machine was out of order. Upon reaching the window, I was informed that I had been charged for medium fries instead of the large I had requested. When I requested the larger size, I was told that I would have to wait for four minutes for a fresh batch. Eventually, I left with a Big Mac, medium fries, and no Coke. Surprisingly, however, I found that this experience was actually one of my better ones at this particular establishment.

source:
We had the worst possible experience at the Eat N Park at Waterfront on 2/12/10 at around 10pm. Our waitress (Annemarie) was inattentive and got us the wrong order. We ended up with a dish we had not even ordered and still got charged for it on the check. 

One of my friends ordered a Buffalo Chicken Sandwich, which according to the menu description, should've had lettuce and tomato in it. But the sandwich that arrived on our table had none of those ingredients. When pointed out to the waitress, she just brought some lettuce and tomatoes in a plate! How crude! 

Spoke to the manager after paying the full check and first of all, she did not even offer to re-imburse for the item we did not even order, and that had been forcibly thrust upon us. 

When I asked the manager about the Buffalo Chicken sandwich not having any lettuce and tomato, she said they just got new menus and that description is not correct and that Buffalo Chicken Sandwich is supposed to be without lettuce and tomato! What a lame excuse! Even your online menu says under the description for a Buffalo Chicken sandwich that its supposed to have both those ingredients - "Served with lettuce and tomato on a fresh-baked Kaiser roll." - That's what the last line in the description of Buffalo Chicken Sandwich says. Shame on you Manager for lying! Instead of admitting her fault, she was blaming it to a new menu!

Not only did we have to pay for something that we didn't order or eat, but we got sub-standard food that was different from what was described in the menu, and had to deal with a really bad waitress and insensitive and deceitful manager to top off the whole experience. 

I am never going to come back to any Eat N Park location ever again, and will never recommend one to any of my friends either. What a waste of time and money! Plus dealing with callous and lying people - my goodness, I surely had my patience tested this evening!
target:
Our experience at the Eat N Park at Waterfront on 2/12/10 around 10pm was extremely disappointing. Our waitress, Annemarie, was not attentive and we received the wrong order. To make matters worse, we were charged for the dish we did not even order. 

One of my friends ordered a Buffalo Chicken Sandwich, but to our surprise, it came without the lettuce and tomato that were listed on the menu. When we brought this to the waitress's attention, she brought us a plate of lettuce and tomatoes instead of fixing the sandwich. 

When we spoke to the manager about our unsatisfactory experience, she did not offer to reimburse us for the incorrect order or address the issue with the sandwich. Instead, she claimed that the new menu did not include the lettuce and tomato in the description. 

We were disappointed not only with the substandard food and service, but also with the manager's lack of accountability. We will not be returning to Eat N Park and cannot recommend it to others. This experience has tested our patience and left us feeling ripped off.

source:
They burned my fish and they burned it bad.  Ordering fish at Eat'n Park is always a gamble.  I just never know how it's going to turn out.  I'm a risk taker so I ordered two pieces of baked lemon sole. 

Well it went terribly wrong.  My waiter came out and said, "They burned your fish, so I had them put two new pieces in the oven."  I was impressed by his honesty and didn't mind waiting for two new pieces.  

 I gladly helped myself to my boyfriend's french toast while I waited. 

Then out of no where another server comes to the table with the burnt fish and sets it down infront of me. With the burnt side down of course.  That just shows the kitchen is not in total coordination.  

Like I said getting fish from Eatn' Park is a toss up. In the end I got two nicely baked pieces of sole to replace the burnt ones, so I left satisfied.
target: My experience at Eat'n Park was not ideal as my order of baked lemon sole came out burnt. However, my waiter was kind enough to have two new pieces made for me. While waiting, I indulged in my boyfriend's french toast. Unfortunately, when my replacement order arrived, it was also in disarray as another server brought out the burnt fish first. Nonetheless, the kitchen was eventually able to prepare two well-baked pieces of sole, leaving me content in the end. Getting fish at Eat'n Park is always a gamble.

source:
Some how even though the food at this Eat'n Park is down right abominable, the smiles and laughter is always there.  How can I stay mad when the prices or so cheep? Myself my boyfriend and his nephew had lunch with milkshakes and me having a coffee it was $31.00

On this particular occasion the fire alarm went off and rang and rang and rang loud and long for over 15 minutes before the fire department got there realized they didn't have key to turn it off and than another 10 minutes later finally shut it off...only at Eatn' Park.

My baked potato was hard as a rock, I had ordered two pieces of baked cod and only received one. 

The waitress was very sweet and attentive and really attempted to build a rapport with our lil nephew which I thought was sweet.
target: Despite the subpar food at Eat'n Park, the atmosphere is always cheerful and welcoming. The prices are so affordable that it's hard to stay upset. During our most recent visit, the fire alarm blared for over 15 minutes until the fire department arrived, only to realize they didn't have the key to turn it off. Eventually, after another 10 minutes, the alarm was finally silenced... but only at Eat'n Park. While my baked potato was rock hard and I didn't receive both pieces of baked cod I ordered, our waitress was kind and attentive, particularly with our young nephew.

source: Mmm...peppermint mocha\n\nIn my quest to visit every Starbucks in the USA I have stopped at yet another location.  This one is located in the center of a circle road -- very cache and in a newer part of the area.
target: Mmm...peppermint latte\n\nContinuing my mission to visit all the Starbucks stores in America, I recently came across another one. It's positioned at the heart of a circular route which is quite charming, and it's situated in a more modern section of town.

source: If there was ever a \"get your coffee and go\" Starbucks, this is it. Right in the center of the Waterfront, this Starbucks has no sofa, comfy chairs, only table seating. I love the baristas here, But I don't like the location of the building.
target: This Starbucks at the Waterfront is perfect for grabbing a coffee to take on the go. There are no cozy chairs or sofas, just tables for seating. While I admire the friendly baristas, the building's positioning is not my favorite.

source:
I just realized they remodeled this one recently-ish. Well, in my world recently because it's been a while since I've been here.

They've added more seating which makes it way more conducive to having a meeting here. Which is my concern during the week. I imagine during the weekend it just fills up with tweens getting their sugar rush before hitting the movie theater. 

The coffee, or tea for me.. Is still same old same old. I don't imagine one single Starbucks will break the mold and make original drinks...
target: It's been a while since I last came here and I just realized that they remodeled this place recently. For starters, they've added more seating which makes it perfect for meetings. Although, I'm a little worried that during weekends, it might get filled up with tweens getting their sugar fix before hitting the movies. As for the drinks, it's still the same old menu for coffee or tea. I'm not expecting any Starbucks branch to break the mold and come up with a unique drink anyway.

source: Great location!  Close to shops and theatre.  Nice staff.
target: Awesome spot! Conveniently located near a variety of shops and a theater. The staff are exceptionally friendly.

source:
This Starbucks is teeny-tiny!

Seating inside is VERY limited.  This is a Starbucks to grab and go and continue your shopping at the Waterfront.

Baristas are friendly and fast.
target: This Starbucks location is incredibly small! The interior has very limited seating available, making it a perfect spot to grab your drink on the go as you shop around the Waterfront. The baristas are speedy and amicable.

source:
As far as Starbucks go, this is a pretty nice one.  The baristas are friendly and while I was here, a lot of regulars must have come in, because they bantered away with almost everyone.  The bathroom was clean and well maintained and the trash wasn't overflowing in the canisters around the store.  The pastries looked fresh, but I didn't partake.  The noise level was also at a nice working level - not too loud, music just barely audible.

I do wish there was more seating.  It is nice that this location has a counter at the end of the bar for sole workers, but it doesn't replace more tables.  I'm sure this isn't as much of a problem in the summer when there's the space outside.

There was a treat receipt promo going on, but the barista didn't tell me about it, which I found odd.  Usually when they have promos like that going on, they ask everyone if they want their receipt to come back later in the day to claim whatever the offer is.  Today it was one of their new pastries for $1, I know in the summer they do $2 grande iced drinks with that morning's receipt.

Overall, nice working or socializing environment.  Very friendly and inviting.  It's what I've come to expect from Starbucks, so points for consistency.
target:
This Starbucks is quite pleasant. The staff are friendly and there seems to be a lot of regular customers. The facilities were well-maintained and the store was tidy. While I didn't try any pastries, they looked fresh. The noise level was just right for a peaceful workspace.

The only downside was the seating. While there was a small area for solo work, it would have been nice to have more tables available. However, this may be less of an issue during warmer weather when outdoor seating is available.

While they did have a promotion on, the barista didn't mention it which I found strange. Normally they remind customers to come back and claim any offers. Nonetheless, overall it was a pleasant place to work or catch up with friends, with a friendly atmosphere that Starbucks is known for.

source: I'm not a huge fan of this location. I think that it was oddly built- the small, alley-like front makes it difficult to get past people on your way to/from the bathroom or tables when it's busy. And there's hardly any tables to sit at. Furthermore, people tend to clog the front on their way in, which makes things particularly difficult (especially in the winter weather). The staff were pretty impersonal to be, but maybe that was due to the high traffic of the place and the time I was there. And the coffee that I had was cold- I'm sure it was probably the bottom of the batch. I'd probably only walk in here again if someone else suggested it before or after a movie or while we were shopping in the area.
target: Although the location has its merits, I am not particularly fond of it. The entrance is narrow, like an alley, which can be inconvenient when the place is crowded, and there are few tables to sit at. In addition, the entrance tends to get congested, making it difficult, especially during the winter season. The staff was not particularly welcoming, but that may have been due to the busy period and my timing of my visit. Although the coffee was not impressive, it was possibly because it was the last of the batch. Unless it was recommended by someone or while shopping in the area, I would probably not visit again.

source: This Starbucks is 5-Star Friendly. The shift supervisor Lucious keeps the energy in there moving and light. He recently helped me with a merchandise return and embodied everything a good manager and all around mensch person should - patience, kindness, generosity and fairness. I left that afternoon loving Starbucks even more than when I went in. It's great that a company and their employees can be as loyal to their customers as their customers are to them.
target: The Starbucks at this location is incredibly customer-oriented. The shift supervisor, Lucious, maintains a lively and positive atmosphere. I had a pleasant experience when I came to return some merchandise, as Lucious exemplified all the traits of an exceptional manager and person, including patience, kindness, generosity, and fairness. I left feeling even more attached to Starbucks than before. It's truly impressive when a company and its staff display the same level of loyalty towards their customers as the customers have towards them.

source:
For someone who straddles the line between sometimes craft-er, this store can seem vast and confusing.  There's rows and rows of baskets and bedazzling jewels and paper and...oh my...scrap booking!  When I want to find boring old felt....it's like...where do I start?  

I'm in a hurry, as always, and I rush in and the first thing I look for is an employee.  No one to be found.  I could call out and my voice would come echoing back.  I run between rows of paper, wood and gosh darn scrap booking....no felt!  Where do I find felt!  Where do I find an employee!?

FINALLY, I find one after 15 minutes of wondering around.  She's incredibly nice and leads me to the felt.  This is not the first time I've been hard up to find help.  I tell her she was hard to find, and she tells me that they're "low on payroll" and can't have any one the floor BUT HER!  In that WHOLE store, JUST HER!  That's ridic!

Not a month ago I was, again, in a slight hurry and stood in line for about 15 minutes to check out, with 2 employees at the register and 6 people per line, I gave up and walked out.  

Hey Michael, do you pick up what I'm putting down?  You're not making any money because your costumer service SUCKS....in fact, there's no service to be found!
target: Navigating through this store can be daunting for someone who dabbles in crafting. The sheer volume of products, from baskets to bedazzling jewels to scrapbooking materials, can be overwhelming. I often find myself in a rush and looking for an employee to assist me with locating items. Unfortunately, this can be a challenge, as employees are scarce and difficult to find. On one occasion, it took me 15 minutes to find an employee who could help me locate the felt I needed. When I finally found her, she explained that they were understaffed and she was the only one available to assist customers. This is not the first time I've experienced poor customer service at this store; just last month, I gave up on checking out after waiting in a long line with only two employees working. If improvements aren't made to the store's customer service, it's no wonder they may not be making much profit.

source:
I have been frequently shopping at this Michaels store over the last couple months since I began taking a cake decorating class and hosted a large baby shower at my home. The store has typically had the supplies that I need from cake and cupcake baking and icing to scrap booking supplies. This location is pretty average compared to other Michaels - it's exactly what you would expect when going to this store. It's not a large store, but it's not a small store -- just average.

I do enjoy using the Michael's coupons when shopping. I definitely save a lot of money! Instead of toting around the paper versions, I actually have the iPhone app that has coupons available to use from the app. 

My only complaint is that sometimes it takes a while to check out at this location. I don't normally have a problem - usually only one or two people ahead of me - but sometimes it can be much slower. Today, for example, there were only two customers ahead of me, but one of them was having issues with a coupon. The line began to get longer and longer, and though a couple associates were lingering up front, they kept calling for someone else. From personal experience of being a manger in a retail store, do not linger or let your associates linger near the cashiers without jumping on register. Whatever the reason may be that you are not helping customers, it still appears rude and make everyone more impatient....
target: For the past few months, I have been frequenting the Michaels store to purchase all my cake decorating products and scrapbooking supplies. I recently threw a big baby shower and this store had everything I needed. This particular location is quite average, nothing too big or too small. However, they do carry all the necessary goodies I require, like cupcake baking and icing kits. The best thing I like about this place is the coupons I get by using the iPhone app. It saves me lots of money, and I don't have to carry the paper coupons around. The only downside to this store is the long wait at the checkout counter. Although it's usually not too bad, on some days it can become a frustrating experience. One time, I was stuck in the line when an associate was having trouble with a coupon. The line was getting longer and longer, and the customers were getting impatient. As an ex-retail manager myself, I feel that associates should avoid lingering near the cashiers and should jump on the registers to help customers. It's essential to not waste anyone's time and make them feel appreciated.

source:
The one good thing I can say about Michael's is that they have a wide variety of hobbies and crafts included in their selection. They've got items for woodwork, painting, knitting, kids crafts, scrapbooks, you name it. The problem is, the variety of products for your particular craft is probably dismal. They've got lots of cool items all over the store that you're convinced that somehow you need. (Because it is soooo cute, and you could TOTALLY do something with it. Right..?) The store feels cluttered because there is so much stuff everywhere. However, if you're looking for something specific, good luck. It's not even a matter of the product being difficult to find in the store. It's that when you find the right section, there's either nothing in stock, or they simply don't even carry what you need. 

I stopped in for crochet supplies, and the yarn selection was laughable compared to many other craft stores. I ended up going elsewhere for my stuff anyway. 

Plus the prices at Michael's are significantly more than other area craft stores. I usually only stop there if I'm already at tend Waterfront. I'd recommend checking other craft stores first. Unless you need glitter. Especially fine glitter. Michael's has the best glitter selection/quality of any store I've ever been to.
target: Michael's is a store with a wide range of hobbies and crafts, from woodwork to kids crafts. The store is packed with cool and cute items that may attract you. However, the store can be cluttered, making it difficult to find the product you need. Plus, they may not even have what you are looking for in stock. The yarn selection, for instance, left much to be desired. As a result, Michael's prices are higher than other area craft stores. Unless you're looking for glitter, particularly fine glitter, you might want to check out other craft stores first.

source: Its clean, open 24/7 with hot shoe string fries and creative milkshakes. What else do you want in life??
target: What more could you ask for in life than a 24/7 clean establishment offering delicious hot shoestring fries and imaginative milkshakes?

source:
This is the absolute WORST Steak N Shake I've ever been to. 

The bf and I got lost around Pittsburgh for 40 min. trying to find this location and on top of the unnecessary 1 hour wait for our food, the food itself was just so crappily made. It was so bad and we had waited a ridiculous amount of time (c'mon, Steak N Shake is basically a glorified McD's), our waiter comped our WHOLE MEAL.

If not for the compensation, I would have been pissed that we had to pay for such a crappy meal. The bf, on the other hand, was more upset about the principle of the matter... we had trekked all that way just to get our Steak N Shake fix (since both of us haven't had it since our undergraduate days) and it was a major fail.

I think I'm good with my Steak N Shake craving for a long time now...



PS. The whole joint smells like major B.O.
target: My experience at this particular Steak N Shake was horrendous. After struggling to locate the restaurant in Pittsburgh for 40 minutes and waiting for an hour for our food, my boyfriend and I were incredibly disappointed with the poor quality of our meals. It was nothing like what we had expected from a fast-food chain like Steak N Shake. Although our waiter kindly offered to comp our entire meal, I feel like we deserved a lot more given the terrible experience we had. My boyfriend, who was more concerned about the principle of the matter, was upset that we had made the journey for nothing. To make matters worse, the entire restaurant had an unpleasant smell that resembled body odor. I doubt I'll be visiting Steak N Shake anytime soon.

source: I went here at 3 PM between the lunch rush and the dinner rush, and the restaurant was maybe 20% full. I ordered the Chili Mac Supreme to go. I thought I would be in and out within 5-10 minutes. Keep in mind that this restaurant even has a drive-thru; the expectation is quick service.\n\nLong story short, my food never came... the waitress told me (after I had been sitting there waiting for thirty minutes) that the kitchen hadn't even started on my order yet, so I told her to cancel it and walked out. Now I see that others on Yelp have warned about the slow service at this location. Wish I had looked it up earlier.
target: I visited the restaurant in the mid-afternoon when it wasn't too busy, and only a few tables were occupied. I decided to order the Chili Mac Supreme for takeout, expecting a quick 5-10 minute wait time. This restaurant even has a drive-thru, so fast service is expected. However, to my disappointment, I waited for thirty minutes, only to be informed by the waitress that my order hadn't even been started yet. Frustrated, I cancelled my order and left. Later, I found out on Yelp that other customers had also warned of the slow service at this location, and I wish I had read the reviews beforehand.

While not the most outstanding Steak 'n Shake joint, this spot serves up 24/7 burgers and fries. The milkshakes are definitely a highlight. The positives? Burgers are always prepared upon ordering. The potential downsides? The burgers can be a bit greasy, and the drive thru may take a bit longer due to the fresh cooking. Additionally, the service, on a scale of 1 to 10, falls at a 4.

source: In general I do like Shake N' Steak, but this location is a hit or miss location!  You never know what kind of quality or service you're going to find here.  A friend and myself went a few weeks back after a movie and it had to be one of the worst trips there EVER!  You can't entirely blame the waitress since she was the only one there for the entire place...poor scheduling on the manager's part. However, while she can't be accountable for the slooooow service, she was accountable for both orders being incorrect.  The burgers were over cooked and the fries were soggie and the milkshake was runny at best...\n\nBy far my worst visit to Steak n' Shake!
target: I have mixed feelings about Shake N' Steak, especially when it comes to this particular location. You can never be certain about the quality of food or level of service you'll receive here. Recently, I visited with my friend after watching a movie and it turned out to be a terrible experience. There was only one waitress for the entire place which was poor scheduling on the manager's part. While I understand that she couldn't manage the slow service, she made mistakes with both our orders. The burgers were overcooked, fries were soggy, and the milkshake was runny. This was definitely my worst trip to Steak n' Shake so far.

source: Rather typical SnS.  Had a good lunch crowd.  Milkshake was good but not as good as EnP down the street.  It took to long to get the burger for some reason, 25 minutes, I realized cooked to order but this is a little long for SnS.  Ordered the Guacamole Steakburger and it only had a small portion of Gauc...not your usual amount..kitchen was not up to speed on portion sizing for some reason.  Definitely did not look like the picture on the website.  Oh well!
target: Typical SnS experience. Lunch crowd was good. The milkshake was decent, but EnP down the street has a better one.
