My burger took longer than expected, 25 minutes, even though they cook it to order. The Guacamole Steakburger I ordered had a small portion of guac, which is not what I'm used to from SnS. The kitchen seemed to have trouble with portion sizing today. Unfortunately, the burger didn't look like the picture on the website. However, that's just the way it goes sometimes.

source: Ah, Steak n Shake, you hit the spot after a night of drinking. Open 24 hours, drive thru or dine in, with wonderful, cheap greasy burgers, chicken fingers, breakfast sandwiches, and shoestring fries. You're faster (and cheaper!) than Eat N Park. Plus your employees wear those adorable bow ties. Granted, if we were at a fancy party, I might act like I don't know you, but deep down inside you know I heart you.
target: Oh, In-N-Out, you are the perfect go-to after a long day at work. Open until late, with both drive-thru and dine-in options, you serve amazing value burgers, crispy fries, and milkshakes. You are quicker and more affordable than many fast food chains. I also adore your staff's unique uniforms. Though if we were at any formal event, I might act like we haven't met, but secretly, you have a special place in my heart.

source: The only thing worse than the food is the service.
target: The service is just as bad as the food.

source: Terrible wait staff  couldn't even seat us. Before we, and another party walked out without even being greeted properly, I observed several employees traipse out the front door, several tables who were waiting for their food for a long time,  several employees just standing around out of direct view of the tables, a morbidly obese hostess that could barely physically walk from one end of the store to the other. I think one server was high. \n  \n  Going there was a  special request by a 7 year old getting over a long-ish illness, so that makes the shabby treatment more enraging.
target: The service at this restaurant was abysmal. My party and I were not even seated, and we eventually left without receiving a proper greeting. Throughout our brief visit, I witnessed several employees exiting the front door, a number of tables waiting for their food for an extended period of time, several workers loitering out of sight, and a hostess who had great difficulty moving around. Additionally, I suspect one of our servers was under the influence of drugs. It is especially frustrating when you consider the fact that we had come to this establishment specifically because a 7-year-old who had just recovered from an illness had requested it.

source: This place is s l o w....like so slow I have got up and left after waiting 30 minutes and not even being acknowledged by a server. The food is okay. Def not worth the wait. Milkshakes are just okay as well. Booooooo.
target: I had to leave this spot after sitting for half an hour without a server even acknowledging my presence. The food is mediocre and not worth the long wait. The milkshakes are unremarkable too. Overall, a disappointing experience.

source: I really like the chili. Burgers are fair and salads are pretty bad. Pretty hard to mess up a side salad. As others have said you never know what kind of service you will get. Store is usually understaffed and cleanliness is fair. The staff is usually disinterested with customers and sometimes outright rude. All in all what you pay is what you get. Cheap and crap service.
target: I enjoy the chili here, but the burgers and salads are just average. It's almost impossible to go wrong with a side salad. However, like others have mentioned, the service can be unpredictable. The store is usually short-staffed and the cleanliness is okay. The staff isn't the most friendly or helpful, sometimes even being impolite. To sum it up, you get what you pay for- budget-friendly prices with subpar service.

source:
Fast food done right, what more can you want?

A throwback to old timey diners, steak and shake is where you get a decent meal at a good price. 

My sisters and I arrived on a Tuesday afternoon around 3pm catching their 2-4 happy hour, which we read on the door upon entry; a lovely surprise. This meant that all shakes and drinks were 50% off! 

I ordered the western BBQ burger, which was 2 thin patties, cheese, bacon, BBQ sauce, and fried onions. It came with shoe string fries (my favorite), all for the low price of $4.79. Are you kidding me? What's not to like! The food was actually pretty good! I liked it a lot. Since it was happy hour I also "splurged" on a chocolate covered strawberry shake. It was meh. Could have gone without it. The overpowering taste of artificial strawberry really turned me off, but the hot fudge saved it. But, how can you really go wrong with hot fudge?

All in all, 3 meals and 3 shakes came to $20. A steal. Also the food is good! I enjoyed it. I'd come back.
target: Steak and Shake is the place for an enjoyable meal at an affordable price. This classic diner features a menu reminiscent of the good ol' days. My siblings and I were pleasantly surprised to catch their 2-4 happy hour on a random Tuesday afternoon, offering a 50% discount on shakes and beverages. I couldn't resist trying their western BBQ burger, which included two thin patties with cheese, bacon, BBQ sauce, and crispy onions, along with my favorite side- shoestring fries, all for an astonishingly low price of $4.79. My meal was beyond satisfying, and I highly recommend it. I decided to indulge in a chocolate-covered strawberry shake; unfortunately, the artificial strawberry flavoring was too strong for my taste, but the hot fudge saved it. Our total bill came to $20- a fantastic deal for three meals and three shakes. I'm ecstatic about the delicious food and cannot wait to visit again.

source: Fast food in a resturant setting.  Considering this food is good and cheap plus you can get food to go.  Must be a reason why this place is always packed.
target: The restaurant serving fast food seems to be a popular choice among many individuals as the food is not only affordable but also delicious. Additionally, the option to take the food to go is an added advantage.

source: The food is good. Unfortunately the service is very hit or miss. The main issue seems to be with the kitchen, the waiters and waitresses are often very apologetic for the long waits and it's pretty obvious that some of them avoid the tables after taking the initial order to avoid hearing complaints.
target: While the food is enjoyable, the service can be quite inconsistent. It appears that the kitchen struggles with timing, as the servers often express regret for the extended wait times. In some cases, the staff may even steer clear of tables after initially taking orders to prevent negative feedback.

source: Food is good, what you'd expect from Steak n Shake. THE SERVICE IS AWFUL. so incredibly awful. expect to take at least an hour for your meal, even when it's slow. I've been going here for years when I want a cheap meal, but the service is so so so awful. Go to McDonalds.
target: Although the food at Steak n Shake is satisfactory, unfortunately the service is horrendous. It is not uncommon to wait over an hour for your meal, even during quieter times. Despite being a regular customer for budget-friendly meals, the poor service has become a major issue. As an alternative, consider visiting McDonald's for a better overall experience.

source: The service was fast but the food was terrible and so was the service. I had a bus to catch so I couldn't wait around waiting for the check so I went to the counter to pay. She never brought my check, never checked to see if my drink needed refilled, she just mopped the floors. \n\nThe burger was really greasy, the fries were Luke warm and the cheese on them wasn't as flavorful as it should be. As a new Pittsburgher I'm not impressed.
target: Although the service was prompt, the food and service were both disappointing. Since I had to catch a bus, I couldn't wait for the check, so I decided to pay at the counter. Unfortunately, the server never brought my check and didn't bother to refill my drink or check on me. The burger tasted over-greasy, the fries were lukewarm and lacked flavor in the cheese. As someone new to Pittsburgh, I wasn't particularly impressed.

source:
I should have known better than to stop here, but I was nursing a hangover and just wanted something quick and simple.  I should kick myself for thinking of this place.

Granted I decided to go to the drive thru and knew there would be a wait.  The sign actually says that the food is prepared when you order it.  I sat for almost ten minutes at the window while my food was prepared.  During that time I wished I could have taken back my order and also wished that I hadn't paid already.  

While sitting at the window I decided to just stare inside and watch some of the employees doing their job.  What disturbed me the most was watching the employee making the milkshakes.  Making a milkshake isn't that hard or glamorous of a thing to watch.  What disgusted me was that the guy actually lifted several of the containers for the milkshakes and smelt them.  I mean smelt them to see if they were clean, instead of actually taking the extra minute or two to clean the container.  After witnessing this my food was finally ready and I drove away.

When I finally got to eating my food I was underwhelmed.  The fries had no flavor and with the size of the cut it appears you get more than what you ordered.  The "steakburger" really, they should just call it a burger, was overpowered by the BBQ sauce on it.  It was all I could taste.

All this has cemented me in not wanting to ever step foot in one of these establishments ever again.
target: Even though I knew there would be a wait, and the sign outside said the food was prepared fresh to order, I regretted stopping at this fast food joint with my hangover. As I sat at the drive-thru window for what felt like an eternity, I watched the employees inside. One in particular caught my eye, the guy in charge of the milkshakes. Instead of cleaning the containers, he just smelled them and carried on. When my food finally arrived, I found it to be less than impressive. The fries lacked any real flavor and the BBQ sauce on the so-called \"steakburger\" was overwhelming. After this experience, I don't think I'll be returning to this establishment anytime soon.

source: Burgers are not the best quality. Better than McDonald's but not much better. The fries are fairly thin, but crispy. They aren't bad. The prices are also quite decent. However, their shakes are amazing. Thick and creamy. It's also great that they have half off shakes on weekdays in the early morning like 1-3am.
target: The quality of burgers at this place is average, slightly better than McDonald's. Their fries are thin and crispy, which is not bad. The pricing is reasonable and affordable. But what steals the show are the shakes- incredibly thick and creamy. There's an added advantage of getting half off on shakes if you visit between 1-3am on weekdays.

source:
You know what you're getting with a Steak N Shake: it's about one rung up from a McD's in quality, and about two rungs down in quickness. At least, you think you know. 

I used to have a small place in my heart (though the salt and fat weren't very kind to said organ) for Steak N Shake, because hey, who can argue with beef and drinkable ice cream? But after my last trip, I can think of nothing more disgusting than having to eat here, this location in particular. I haven't been back in over year, and I will never step foot into a Steak N Shake as long as I have an immune system that I care about. 

After having eaten here, I hit the restroom on my way out (along with my two friends....hey, we're girls, it's acceptable!). One stall was already taken, so two of us are stuck waiting while this occupant does her....shall we say, business? After a few seconds, we realize that she's not only there to relieve herself, but to also take drive-through orders. Yes, that's right...."You want fries with that? *flush* Okay, that will be $5.50". I have never, ever witnessed anything so insane as a drive-through restroom. To top it off, after finishing her "bathroom break", she walks straight out of the stall and into the restaurant. I guess she was in too much of a rush to complete the order she had just taken that she didn't have time to wash her hands. And I was in too much of a rush to choke back up what I had just eaten before it wreaked mayhem on my stomach.
target: A Steak N Shake may not be as quick as McDonald's but it's a step up in quality. I used to enjoy it despite its unhealthy options, but after my last visit, I will never return to this location again. While waiting in line for the restroom, I witnessed an employee taking drive-through orders while also using the stall. To top it off, she didn't wash her hands before returning to work. Needless to say, I won't be returning any time soon.

source: I love Steak N Shake. This one, however, leaves a lot to be desired. The food often comes out cold and the servers are apathetic at best. Most of the time, they're downright rude. I highly recommend avoiding this location if possible. There's one on Route 51 that's worth the 15 minutes it'll take you to get there.
target: Although I am a fan of Steak N Shake, this particular branch falls short in many ways. The dishes are frequently served cold and the staff's attitude is lackluster, bordering on discourteous. If feasible, I advise steering clear of this spot. Instead, venture out to the Route 51 location, which is just a 15-minute commute but worth it.

source: Every time we come here the service is laughably bad. On this visit a tabe which was sat after us had their food before our server graced us with her surly presence. Good restaurant elsewhere, just avoid this location if you want to get your food inside an hour.
target: The service at this location is consistently poor. During our recent visit, we noticed that a table seated after us received their food before our server even approached us with an unpleasant attitude. It is recommended to dine at another location if you prefer to get your food within a reasonable timeframe.

source: Wow. Dirty and slow.  The floors felt like they had the days burger grease spilled all over, and it took 30 m8n to get our take out order.
target: Gosh. So grubby and sluggish. The floors seemed as if they were smeared with yesterday's burger oil, and it took half an hour to receive our to-go food.

source:
This place teeters between a 2 and a 3 star review.  I've had pretty good experiences inside, it's usually the drive-thru where things fall a part.  

It's the rare place I can get a Frisco Melt well, the ONLY place I can get a Frisco Melt!  and that steak burger alone is worth the risk, Walk In OR Drive Thru.

Just take a gun on Weekends, you'll be fine.
target: I would rate this place anywhere from 2 to 3 stars. While my experiences inside have generally been positive, the drive-thru can be a bit of a misadventure. However, the Frisco Melt they serve is delicious and definitely worth trying. I highly recommend giving this spot a chance, just be wary if visiting on weekends.

source: This location is terrible. The drive-thru workers are rude and they give you crap food. I waited 5 minutes before being able to order, even when there was only 1 car ahead of me. Then the lady proceeded to ask me if I would like anything on my burger, and (thinking the pictures on the menu are what they're supposed to look like and they would never false advertise) I asked \"doesn't it come with the fixings like in the picture?\" she then told me it only comes with cheese. So I then went on to tell her what I wanted on my burger. Pulled around and got my order pretty quick, but later when I open my burger its just meat and cheese. The meat is badly burned and cold. It was clear to me this burger was not fresh. I didn't even attempt to eat it, what a waste of a place. They definitely need better workers.
target: This place is not great. The workers at the drive-thru are impolite and the quality of the food is poor. I waited in line for 5 minutes even though there was only one car ahead of me. When it was finally my turn to order, I asked the worker about the burger on the menu and requested the same toppings. However, I was disappointed to find out that it only comes with cheese. After ordering my preferred topping, I quickly received my order, but upon opening the burger, it was evident that it was not fresh and poorly cooked. I did not take a bite as it would have been a waste. The restaurant needs better employees for better service.

source: Steak 'n Shake's food is pretty good and the prices aren't bad for the quantity of food. I ordered a grilled chicken salad with no dressing. The salad looked thrown together and was $5.49 for 2 croutons, tomatoes, carrots, cabbage, lettuce and chicken breast. (They forgot the cheese!) The staff wasn't very friendly or helpful and seemed like they didn't want to be there. There usually is a long wait at Steak 'n Shake, but if you catch them when they aren't busy, you will breeze through- drive-thru that is. I do like their food and you can eat healthy options, but the staff isn't helpful and the quality isn't always there.
target: Although Steak 'n Shake's prices are reasonable and the food is good, my recent experience left me wanting more. I ordered a grilled chicken salad without dressing and was disappointed with the contents. At a price of $5.49, I received only two croutons, tomatoes, carrots, cabbage, lettuce, and a chicken breast (minus the cheese which they forgot). Additionally, the staff did not seem friendly or eager to help. While there can be long waits during busy periods, the drive-thru is generally speedy. Despite the option for healthy choices, the inconsistent quality and unhelpful staff make for an underwhelming overall experience.

source:
Nice staff but apparently there is little manager oversight around 3:28am.

I do like this place.  It must be nice to work somewhere that allows you to choose your own tasks.  Like smoking, sitting and texting.  I'm fine with cooking my food being fourth on the "to do" list because there is no where else togo really....

Why didn't they answer me at the drive through? I think they wanted me to come inside because my girlfriend and I are really really really good looking.

This was annoying but understandable.
target: The staff is friendly but it seems like there's not much supervision from the managers during the late night shift. I appreciate the work environment where employees have the freedom to prioritize their tasks such as taking breaks for smoking or texting. Despite cooking food being a lower priority, it's understandable since there aren't many other options nearby. When they didn't respond at the drive-thru, I assumed they wanted us to come inside because my girlfriend and I are both attractive. Although it was frustrating, I can see why they did it.

source: It's okay. Food is cheap but portions are small. For example I order the chicken tenders, and I got 3 little tiny tenders, and a decent amount of fries. Also the restaurant is not really clean either.  This restaurant is not my number 1 choice.
target: The food here is inexpensive, but the serving sizes are quite small. As an instance, I requested chicken tenders, and I received 3 tiny pieces with a good number of fries. Furthermore, the cleanliness of the restaurant is not up to my standards. This particular establishment isn't my preferred option.

source:
As far as I'm concerned, Filene's Basement is good for two things: cheap dresses and cheap accessories.

As a young performer, I need good-looking dresses for frequent auditions -- and I need a couple, so I'm not wearing the same thing every time. The dresses on the second floor usually range from $30-60 and are good for over a year. It can be hard to find a full-length dress that's not reminiscent of a prom dress, but their selection of cocktail-length dresses is ample.

As far as accessories go, Filene's tends to have cheap versions of popular trends. If I feel the need to stock my wardrobe with a transient fad, Filene's is the place to go.
target:
For me, Filene's Basement serves two purposes: affordable dresses and accessories. 

Being a young artist, I require good-looking dresses for frequent auditions, and having a few options is necessary to avoid wearing the same outfit each time. I usually find great dresses on the second floor within the price range of $30-$60 that can last for over a year. Though it's challenging to find full-length dresses that aren't like prom dresses, they have a decent selection of cocktail-length dresses. 

In terms of accessories, Filene's generally carries inexpensive versions of the latest trends. Whenever I want to add a transient fad to my wardrobe, Filene's is my go-to place.

source:
Even when we didn't have a car Filene's Basement was worth the bus trip to the Waterfront. I always find something (usually I find 3-4 things and spend about $60) and better still, I am always still wearing the clothes and shoes 3 months later. 

I kind of suspect this is the best shopping in Pittsburgh; it's much better than the usual department stores, better than Marshall's and TJ Maxx and better than the Saks downtown, even when it has a sale. Selection, bargains AND quality.

I like this Filene's better than Gabriel Brothers, which are harder to get to. Gabriel Brothers are a real discount shopper's challenge and I'm afraid I didn't live in Pittsburgh long enough to develop the necessary skills . . . Filene's was still up and running in June 2007 when I left town.
target: Despite not having a car, I always made the effort to take the bus to Filene's Basement at Waterfront. It's a treasure trove of great finds and I usually end up with 3-4 items for only $60. What's even better is that the clothes and shoes I purchase there last me for months. In my opinion, it's the best shopping destination in Pittsburgh, with a better selection of items than department stores, Marshall's, and TJ Maxx. Even when there's a sale at Saks downtown, I still prefer Filene's for its quality bargains. While Gabriel Brothers may also have good deals, I find it harder to get to and not worth the extra effort. Luckily, Filene's was still open in June 2007 when I left Pittsburgh.

source: Love this store!  Don't always have much luck with the sales, but I always find something I like here.  This isn't your average Marshall's or TJ Max.  I think the green dress I'm wearing is from Filene's!
target: I absolutely adore this shop! Although I don't find many items on sale, I always manage to discover something that I fancy here. This is not just another regular store like Marshall's or TJ Max. If memory serves me right, the lovely green dress I'm donning is from Filene's!

source: Another store which has gone the way of the Dodo bird. Actually there was nothing basement like about it. What will be done with the empty space that is the question?
target: Yet another store has closed down, much like the Dodo bird. Contrary to popular belief, it wasn't located in the basement. The question now remains: what will become of the vacant space?

source: $9.75 for a red bull and vodka? I'm sorry, I thought I was in Pittsburgh, not New York City. Sing Sing, a dueling piano bar, is fun, but it would be a hell of a lot more fun if I could have more than one watered down drink before I warbled my way through \"Paradise City\" with the rest of the crowd.
target: I can't believe they're charging $9.75 for a Red Bull and vodka! I mean, this is Pittsburgh, not some trendy bar in New York City. Sing Sing is a great spot for dueling pianos, but it would be even better if the drinks were stronger and more reasonably priced. I barely finished one drink before launching into a sing-along of "Paradise City" with everyone else.

source: Really enjoyed this a lot more than I thought I would.  The drinks were on the pricey side, but I didn't head here to get smashed.
target: I had a much better time than I expected. Although the drinks were expensive, I didn't come here to get drunk.

source: Had a great time at Sing Sing a while ago with friends.  Friendly staff.  Will return.
target: Had an amazing experience with buddies at Sing Sing recently. The staff was welcoming, and I wouldn't hesitate to come back again.

source: In my opinion, Sing Sing is really not worth it. It gets expensive because you drink, maybe start to sing a few lyrics, drink some more, think of a song you wanna hear, put $5 and title of said song on a piece of paper, you drink, they play it, everyone else is trying to get their songs played so you put $10 on your next sticky note...and so on and so forth. I wasn't really into it when I first got there but as the night went on and lager went in I started to warm up to the place. I feel that if I have to drink in order to have a good time, it's not worth it. But again, that's just me.\n\nThe 2 stars are for the piano players, who are entertaining and very talented, and the Rock Bottom brews they serve.
target: Sing Sing can quickly become an expensive outing with its system of paying for song requests. It's not really my cup of tea as I don't think I should have to drink to have a good time. However, the piano players are highly skilled and put on a great show, and the Rock Bottom brews they serve are worth trying. I'll give it two stars for those aspects.

source:
Dueling piano bars in Pittsburgh started at Station Square, and they died out. Then when the chain restaurant magnet "waterfront" opened in 2000 the parent company of The Rock Bottom Breweries decided to open Sing Sing in back of The Brewery.

When it first opened it was pretty cool. The very first house band could put on a show that led to standing ovations. I know, I was there. From Stairway to Heaven to Free Bird, Stayin' Alive to She's My Cherry Pie, Elton John to the Boss, they were amazing at sounding like the bands they were covering. Equally incredible were the obscure songs that audience members would shout out, songs only you though you knew, and they would effortlessly sing a good portion of the song, sounding like the band who's song they sung.

But today, Sing Sing seems like it's stuck in the early part of the 21st century. The whole dueling piano, shout out a song to stump the band, Sing us a song you're the piano man has run it's course. I don't hate Sing Sing, but I could never come here more than once a year. It's a been there, done that kind of place.
target: Sing Sing, the dueling piano bar in Pittsburgh, was first established at Station Square and eventually disappeared. However, following the opening of the popular chain restaurant "waterfront" in 2000, the parent company of The Rock Bottom Breweries decided to open Sing Sing behind The Brewery. Despite its initial success, with a talented house band that could expertly cover popular songs, Sing Sing now appears to be stuck in the past. The concept of a dueling piano bar with audience shout-outs and covers of classic hits has become outdated. Sing Sing may still be enjoyable for some, but for others, it feels like a place they've already experienced and likely won't return to anytime soon.

source: Sing Sing is awesome!! Give a buck or more and they will play anything, and if they don't know it, they will search for who requested the song so they can do something else the person will enjoy! :) Great humor too!! :)
target: Sing Sing is fantastic!! Chip in a dollar or more and they'll perform any song, and if it's unknown, they'll hunt down the person who requested it to offer another tune that they'll like! :) They also have wonderful humor!! :)

source:
What a great time!  This place was awesome!  I wish I lived right down the road, because I could see myself being a regular here.

Honestly, these guys have got some talent, like real talent.  They can play the piano, sing, play guitar, and the drums.  Did I mention that they are all pretty hilarious, too.  I'd easily pay the $7 cover to get in here any day because it really is worth it.  

I am sure I will be back in no time at all.  Next time, I am bringing a big group of friends.
target: I had such a fantastic time! This place is absolutely amazing and I can't wait to come back again. The performers here are extremely talented - they can sing, play multiple instruments and even have a great sense of humor. The $7 cover charge is definitely worth it and I wouldn't mind paying it every time I visit. I'm already planning my next trip here and I'm bringing a bunch of friends with me this time!

source: This place has gone significantly down hill.  I've gone to Sing Sing about once a year for the last 6 or 7 years.  When we started going there you couldn't get a seat unless you got there early.  It was always packed.  However, each year the crowd seems to get smaller and smaller.  Crowd is an important component of a piano bar due to the interactive nature of it all.  I was there last Saturday night (8/4/12) and there was about 20-30 people there.  Very slow and boring.  It appears the crowd is no longer allowed up on stage, taking a lot of the interactive fun out of what this place used to be.  This was likely my last time at Sing Sing.  Save your $7 and skip this place.  A real shame because this place was once a lot of fun.
target: Sing Sing just isn't what it used to be. I've been going there for about 6 or 7 years and it used to be packed every time. But lately, the crowds have been getting smaller and smaller. A piano bar thrives on interaction with the audience, but that's been lacking lately. I was there last Saturday night and there were only about 20-30 people. It seems like the crowd isn't allowed on stage anymore, so the fun interactive aspect is gone. Unfortunately, I don't think I'll be going back to Sing Sing. It's a shame because it used to be such a great time.

source:
Went here for the first time this past weekend. Needless to say I'll be returning! It was a blast!!!

It was cheap to get in and since we got there a bit earlier we got a semi-good table. Though it was very annoying that people had reserved tables right up front and never showed up. WHAT IS WRONG WITH THESE PEOPLE?! Everything if you ask me! Seriously though if you're going to reserve a table, you better freaking go! 

I had no complaints about the place itself! The guys were hilarious and watching my brother get made fun of multiple times was just the cherry on top! Anddd this has to be the only place I've ever enjoyed being around people who were sloppy drunk, because the comedians take no prisoners! 

I did enjoy when Matt and Joey were the ones up there because they are just amazing and make it so much better! They are great at what they do. Can't wait to go back!
target:
I went to a comedy show for the first time last weekend and loved it so much that I'll definitely be going back! It was a great value and we were able to snag a decent table since we arrived early. My only complaint was that some people reserved tables and didn't even bother to show up. It's just common courtesy to follow through on your reservation! 

The comedians themselves were fantastic and had us laughing the entire time. Even my brother, who was the butt of a few jokes, got a kick out of it. It was a unique experience to be surrounded by a crowd of drunk people, but I have to say that it added to the overall energy and hilarity of the show. Special shoutout to Matt and Joey for being particularly stellar, I can't wait to see them again!

source:
Always a good time, although it's definitely not a place I would visit often. It's great for groups....which is quite obvious since there are always several folks there for bachelorette  parties and birthdays. 

Shut out to the piano players, who can not only play the piano, but also sing, play the drums and the sax. They are funny and know how to keep a crowd entertained. Also know some pretty obscure songs. 

My big criticism is the set up. If you don't have a reservation and/or come later in the evening, it's difficult to get seats. Believe me, I don't mind standing, but it does become a bit awkward when you have to keep scooting over to let waitresses and patrons past you. If you do find a seat, it is often littered with someone else's empty glasses.
target:
While not a regular haunt of mine, I always have a good time at this place. It's ideal for groups  as evidenced by the bachelorette parties and birthday celebrations that are always in full swing. 

The piano players deserve a special mention  they're multitalented, able to sing, play the drums and sax, and are hilarious to boot. They even know some obscure tunes! 

However, there are downsides to the venue. Without a reservation or arriving late, it's a challenge to find a seat. Standing is fine, but it can be cumbersome when waitresses and other patrons keep coming through. And if you do luck out with seats, they're often cluttered with other people's drinks.

source: The musicians at this place work hard to entertain the crowd, so I can't say they are all bad.  However the minimum for a song request is $5.  I spent $20 on a song for my girlfriend and they NEVER played it!!  They were playing songs for $5 and $10, but my $40 got me no where.  Even if they didn't know the song, which I doubt, they could have picked one they knew and improvised,  my tip, save your $$ on the requests.\n\nOtherwise it's fun for special events every once in awhile.
target: The performers here put in a lot of effort to keep the audience engaged, so I can't entirely condemn them. That being said, the lowest price for requesting a song is $5. Despite spending $20 on a song dedicated to my significant other, they didn't play it. They were taking requests for $5 and $10 songs, yet my $40 investment proved futile. Even if they weren't familiar with the requested song, they could have chosen another number and created an impromptu melody. My advice? Refrain from spending your money on song requests. Nevertheless, it's a good venue to celebrate special occasions once in a while.

source: I went here with a bachelorette party. We had reservations, which was good because it was packed that Saturday night. The performers were very talented, but the acoustics were strangely off.   The theme that ran through the whole show was, to quote some phrases they kept repeating, \"you bitch, you slut, you whore\" and  \"twinkle twinkle little slut, why don't you take it up the butt\" which one of the pianists wrote on the mirror at the back of the stage... You get the idea?  Perhaps if I had not been the designated driver, alcohol would have made these jokes funny the fifth, sixth, seventh time. Or maybe not.
target: A group of us had planned a bachelorette party and thankfully we had made reservations in advance as the place was swamped on a Saturday night. The performers were quite talented, however, the acoustics seemed a bit off. The show mainly revolved around derogatory phrases like "you bitch", "you slut", "you whore" and there was even a pianist who wrote the crass "twinkle twinkle little slut, why don't you take it up the butt" on the back of the stage mirror. Needless to say, the jokes may have been funny after a few drinks but as the designated driver, they just fell flat.

source: He was incredibly sexist/homophobic. He could barely play the piano and when we finally recognized a song we could actually dance to he literally asked me to get off stage because he didn't like another on stage who could actually dance with the girls.
target: He held strong biases against certain groups and lacked skill in playing the piano. Once we found a song we could dance to, he asked me to leave the stage simply because he preferred the other dancer's style with the girls.

source: Pretty fun place to go every once in a while, but, believe me, by the end of the night you'll be ready to go. The show lasts around 5 hours, by the 3 hour mark you'll be sick of sitting there in the crowd with your $9 a pop drinks listening to the same dirty jokes over and over and over again.
target: It's an entertaining spot to visit occasionally, but trust me, when the evening ends, you'll be eagerly anticipating departing. The performance stretches for approximately 5 hours, and by the third hour, you'll be tired of being amidst the audience, holding your $9 drinks while listening to the repetitive dirty jokes.

source: My best friend took me to Sing Sing for my bachelor party. I had a blast. The musicians (dueling pianists) made fun of me in a bunch of songs. They also were really good at playing requested tunes (rock). When the show was over we shuffled across the hall to the connected \"Rock Bottom\" restaurant for some grub. We all had so much fun that we went back for my buddy's bachelor party.\n\nThere were some drawbacks though. We went on a Thursday night so the atmosphere was lacking as the place was pretty empty. And of course they are a little pushy soliciting tips when the place is empty. But it's not our fault the place is empty on Thirsty Thursday, if their drinks weren't so damn expensive maybe more people would show up. And sometimes they used vulgar language which was just unnecessary since they would have otherwise still been hilarious. Also there was no table service, and the only bartender was a bitch. I'll probably be back, but only for a special occasion when I can afford it.
target: Sing Sing made my bachelor party a night to remember, with dueling pianists who not only rocked the house with requested tunes but also poked fun at me in their lyrics. We continued the fun at the adjacent Rock Bottom restaurant and enjoyed some delicious food. However, the lack of crowd on a Thursday night affected the atmosphere, and the staff's persistence in soliciting tips left us a bit displeased. The use of vulgar language was unnecessary, although they were otherwise hilarious. The absence of table service and the unfriendly bartender made the experience a bit less enjoyable. Despite the drawbacks, I would definitely consider returning for a special occasion.

source:
I usually have nothing but good things to say about this place. I've dealt with Fran and others and have had very good experiences. However, this time was very different. I called to find out how much they might charge to install some brakes and rotors that I had, i was reffered to Mark, the mechanic. I made the appointment with him for Tuesday Sept 30th, he quoted me between $179 - $200 for the work (though the first person I spoke to quoted $150-$179) and told me to bring it at 8am and it would be finished the same day.when I brought it on Tuesday, Septempber 30th at 8 am, Mark forgets that i even made the appointment with him (or didnt bother to make a note of it) saying, "oh, I thought you were supposed to bring this by yesterday". He says I should expect this to probably be done before 3pm. 

I soon recieve a call from Mark at 10:25am, where he tells me the charge will actually be $240 (for four hours of labor + $13 worth of materials, before even getting started to see how long the job would actually take) and that the car would be ready by 3pm, if not possibly before that. Also for good measure he decides to randomly throw in, "oh, and we don't take checks". 

The next phone call is at 3:50pm to ask if i actually need to have the car back today, I tell Mark, "yes, of course". (I was expecting to be ready by 3, if not before like he said) When I express that I definitely need it today, he says that he just has to finish this one side and it will be ready by 415. This leaves me with barely enough time to get a bus and get over there before they close at 430. Honestly if what he had to finish on my car could easily be completed between 3:50 and 4:15, i dont think he would bother asking if i still needed to have it that day. As a result I feel that he may have rushed something while putting my car back together, because now something feels slightly off with the feeling of how the cars is aligned or the way the car drifts at times.
target: I've had positive experiences with this place in the past, but my most recent visit was disappointing. I made an appointment with the mechanic, Mark, to have some brakes and rotors installed. He had given me a quote between $179-$200, but when I arrived for my 8am appointment, he seemed unaware of our scheduled appointment and said the job might not be finished until after 3 pm. He then called me around 10:25am to let me know that the charge would be $240, and the car would be ready by 3 pm. However, he called again at 3:50pm to ask if I really needed the car back that day. I said yes, and he promised to have it ready by 4:15pm. I barely made it there in time, but now something feels slightly off with how the car drives, making me think it was possibly rushed.

source:
Typical, but new.  

You see all of the people that are walking in and out and, I must say, the customers look like they work for a living hear.  I swear one of the guys was covered head to toe in soot.  That is amazing.  

Ran around the store looking for those few items that I needed to satisfy my need to build and create.  Minimal help from the small quantities of employees, but some of them actually asked if I needed help -- after I had found the item.
target:
Familiar yet fresh.

Observing the hustle and bustle of people entering and exiting, it's evident that the patrons here are hardworking individuals. I couldn't help but notice one gentleman who appeared to have been working in a coal mine, his clothes caked in soot. 

I scoured the store to gather the essential components required for my latest project. While there weren't many staff members to assist me, a few did inquire if I needed help, albeit after I had already located the necessary items.

source:
When making a Customer's paymento atLowe's, we have our checklist:

1. Do the phone numbers match?  Nope, but that's fine since people are always changing their phone numbers anyways.
2. Does the name on account match name on check?  Nope, but mistakes happen at those pesky check companies.
3. Does the account number on the check match the account number on the screen?  Why should it, those computers are always making mistakes.

Now that we have verified that all the information is correct, we can process the payment.  The customer will be so happy that we didn't have to bother them with any silly questions.

******
I am sad to say that this is an actual occurrence.  What was originally an average Lowe's has turned into Lowe's Hell.  If the associates do not have basic logic comprehension, how do they survive?
target: At Lowe's, we have a payment checklist to ensure a smooth transaction for our customers. While we understand that mistakes can happen with phone numbers, names, and account numbers, we take the time to verify all information before processing the payment. Our goal is to provide a hassle-free experience for our customers, so they can leave with a smile on their face. It's concerning to hear about experiences at other Lowe's stores where basic logic comprehension seems lacking. We strive to uphold a high level of competence and professionalism in all our associates.

source: Would like to give NO STARS.  bought all new kitchen appliances there.  Refrigerator is defective.  They\nsend an outside company to repair.  Man arrives with NO TOOLS and wrong size seal for freezer.  not once, twice.  The first time, he tries to use my spoon from counter to install it!  I complain, too bad...they have to comeTHREE times before replacing it!  NEVER AGAIN.
target: I strongly advise against giving any rating to this store. I invested in all brand-new appliances for my kitchen, including a refrigerator which turned out to be faulty. Their solution was to send an external contractor for the repair, however, the man arrived unprepared without the necessary tools and attempted to install the incorrect-sized freezer seal. This ordeal occurred twice, and on the initial attempt, he even made an absurd attempt by using a spoon from my kitchen counter. Although I complained, they were adamant about sending him for a third time before agreeing to replace it. I will definitely not be returning to this store in the future.

source: Your typical area big box hardware store.  It's convenient to go to because of the proximity to other stores and how close it is to so many communities.\n\nCan't really say much else about this place other than with the self checkout lanes it's a breeze to run in and then out without having to deal with a single associate.
target: This large hardware store is located in an easily accessible area surrounded by other stores and neighborhoods. The self-checkout lanes make for a quick and hassle-free experience without having to interact with any staff members.

source: This local Lowe's serves its purpose for my husband and me -- a convenient home improvement store that we run into every month or two. I am most impressed by the lawn and garden section of the store. I am not sure how it compares to other Lowe's stores, but when shopping at the Home Depot in North Fayette last fall, their flower selection was dismal compared to this Lowe's.
target: My spouse and I find this nearby Lowe's to be useful - a practical choice for our home improvement needs that we visit around once or twice a month. The garden and lawn department in the store always catches my attention. Although I'm not entirely certain how it stacks up against other Lowe's stores, I recall visiting Home Depot in North Fayette during the previous autumn and was disappointed by their flower collection compared to this Lowe's.

source: Waterfront Lowe's beats Monroeville Lowe's for lawn and garden.  Hate to admit it, but it's true.
target: It's true, Waterfront Lowe's outperforms Monroeville Lowe's when it comes to lawn and garden products.

source: The food here can actually be a little hit and miss, but I love the grilled cheese club with fries. I get it way too much. People make fun of me.\n\nThey have a ten dollar minimum for credit cards, fyi.
target: Although the quality of the food can vary, my personal favorite is the grilled cheese club with fries. I am guilty of ordering it too often, which unfortunately results in some teasing from others. Additionally, it's important to keep in mind that they require a minimum of ten dollars when paying with a credit card.

source: This place is overrated. A friend and I were looking forward to a beer and some good bar food- instead the wings were terrible and the beer was good but overpriced. There's nothing wrong with this place I just don't understand the clout around it. There should be no clout.
target: My friend and I had high expectations for this place, hoping to enjoy some delicious bar food and a cold beer. However, we were disappointed by the subpar wings and the high prices of the drinks. While there was no major issue with the establishment, I fail to see why it receives such hype and attention. It should not be overhyped.

source: There's lots of potential here because of the wonderful character and ambiance of this place, but the food was average at best.  We were there on a Pens Playoff night and there were 2 people working all the tables in both rooms.  Our food came to us cold and unimpressive at that.  Our orders were somewhat mixed up.  The potato skins used a really cheap artificial cheese that was not very appealing.  I tasted a slice of pizza, which is definitely the best thing they offer.  The crust was delicious and homemade.  If you are going to order something, I would go with the pizza.  We also ordered the chicken wings which were pretty good, also.  If you are looking for good food, Homestead better choices at Blue Dust or Tin Front.
target: While the wonderful character and vibe of this place show great promise, the food left much to be desired. During a Pens Playoff night, only two servers were attending to all the tables in both rooms, which resulted in our food being served cold and unimpressive. Our orders were also somewhat mixed up. The potato skins, unfortunately, used an unappetizing artificial cheese. However, the pizza was a standout, with a delicious homemade crust. If you're looking for something to order, go for the pizza. We also tried the chicken wings, which were pretty good. For a better dining experience, Homestead offers better choices like Blue Dust or Tin Front.

source: Before today I probably would have given this place three stars based mostly on their beer selection; however, today the service was terrible. We waited two hours for a pizza sub, French onion soup, fries, and buffalo chicken tenders. About an hour and a half in we finally got the small pizza sub and the wrongly made buffalo chicken tenders (ie, no hot sauce). We were told by the waitress that she realized it was wrong, but decided to still bring it out to see if my gf would eat it. She sent it back. By a half hour later, we still had not received the buffalo chicken tenders, nor the French onion soup (which should have been mostly made already), and no fries.  We were told the chef was new, but no effort was made really to make the situation better. No quick and easy app or beers on the house. To boot, the beer was pretty expensive. I will probably give the place another chance based on their beer selection, but it won't be for a while. The food has always been average at best, and the pizza sub was no different. We ended up leaving after two hours without receiving 75% of our order.
target: Based on their beer selection, I would have given this place a three-star rating. However, today's experience was terrible. We waited for two hours to receive our order of a pizza sub, French onion soup, fries, and buffalo chicken tenders. After an hour and a half, we were only given the small pizza sub and the wrong order of buffalo chicken tenders. The waitress admitted to realizing the mistake but brought it to us anyway. When we sent it back, we still had to wait for the correct order along with the French onion soup and fries. The chef was new, but no effort was made to improve the situation. We also found the beer to be expensive. Despite their good beer selection, we won't be returning for a while due to our average food experience and not receiving most of our order after two hours of waiting.

source:
I'm reading on here that the food is really hit or miss. I've only gone to Duke's one time, but the food was good. It wasn't too busy so our service was very attentive and it didn't take long to get our food at all.

The place is separated between a bar area and a more family style dining area. We sat in the dining area because the bar area was pretty full. The dining room area definitely fills up with an older, have lived in Pittsburgh all their lives crowd, while the younger crowd is in the bar area. 

I'll definitely be back since I live in the area.
target: I've heard mixed reviews about the food at Duke's, but during my one visit, I found it to be quite enjoyable. The service was attentive, and our meals were promptly served despite it not being too busy. While the bar area was packed, we opted to sit in the family-style dining area, which mostly attracted an older, Pittsburgh-native crowd. As a local resident, I look forward to returning to Duke's in the future.

source:
I've been to Duke's three times now. When I first came to PGH, a lot of locals were telling me that this was a good place to catch a game, drink some brews and get great food. Most of that is true, but the bad has mostly outweighed the good.

They have an excellent new tap system. Last time I went, they had Thirsty Dog Leghumpper on draft, and it was perfect. The system really elevates already awesome beer. Plus, the selection is awesome. 

It is a sports-themed bar, so you can expect drunk locals, loud TV's and plenty of yelling. I'm sort of into that, so it doesn't bother me, although I do think their staff is not well equipped enough to work among the chaos. Service is often slow, and they give the waitresses ZERO training in the beers that they offer. This is not a good place for trying something new, as they can't tell you a thing about it. 

The biggest downfall of Duke's, though, is the food. I've had three different, but equally simple, dishes there; A Burger, a Cheesesteak and Chicken Tenders. The first was flavorless and cold. The second was passable, but nothing special. And the last were absolutely awful. Honestly, the batter and size of the chicken made me so ill, I had to call it an early night. I ate two of the 7 tenders (SEVEN!) and had to quit. 
Their fries are very good. And so are the wings.

I'd say Duke's is a good place to drink, but that's about it.
target: I have visited Duke's three times and was informed by locals that it was a great spot to enjoy sports, beer, and food. While the tap system is impressive and the beer selection is fantastic, the rowdy atmosphere created by drunk fans and loud TVs can be overwhelming for some. Unfortunately, the service is often slow and the staff is not well-trained in regards to the beer they offer. However, the biggest issue is the food. The dishes I've tried, such as a burger, cheesesteak, and chicken tenders, were all underwhelming and lacking in flavor. Despite this, their fries and wings are exceptional. Overall, Duke's is a decent spot for drinks, but not much else.

source:
D&B is nice once in a while but the food is insanely unhealthy. They are also really clever about designing the psychological context in ways to extract money from their customers. You feel a bit milked afterwards. Also much fatter.

You pay for games using credits from mag-stripe cards. This lets D&B give their games arbitrary prices and makes it harder for you to really know how much you are spending. Menus for drinks and food have no prices. $6.05 for a Banana Split cocktail? $3.40 for a Michelob?  I have no idea whether that is expensive but not showing the prices is clever because they can price their things and not have to obey pricing psychology (like anchors and so forth).

Waitstaff hassle you repeatedly to order desserts. Oh, and the dining room has plastic demos dessert trays to get that thought going in your mind as you walk to your table.

The games are all violent shooters or racing games don't appear to have changed much since 2002 when I last went to D&B in California. Hope they can find more innovative arcade games in the future.

Not a pleasant experience, but at least it's different from going to an ordinary restaurant.
target: While D&B offers a unique dining and gaming experience, the food is notoriously unhealthy and overpriced. Customers are often pressured into spending more through the use of credit cards for game play and the omission of prices on menus. Additionally, the game selection has not seen much innovation in recent years. Despite its flaws, dining at D&B is certainly a departure from the typical restaurant experience.

source:
This was actually the first time I've ever been to a Dave and Buster's.

Walking into such a huge space, especially coming from the often narrow venues in San Francisco was strange.

Un-nerving actually. 

Because Dave and Buster's is all about excess. Almost obscenely so.

As far as food - their stuff is standard. Most of it is fried and as another reviewer pointed out - not very healthy. At all actually. You have to really scour the menu to find some somewhat decent viable and nutritious options.

But most people don't come to Dave & Buster's for food. They come for the games.

And while I've never been that into video games or arcade games - my brother and sister always have.  I was apprehensive about having a good time here  - but after awhile - my siblings' enthusiasm about the place became contagious and I found myself really enjoying myself.

Especially once i realized that I have mad skills at Skee Ball. And proceeded to dominate.

Trust.
target: I had never been to a Dave and Buster's before, so walking into such a large space was a new experience for me. After having frequented smaller venues in San Francisco, being in this space was a bit unsettling. However, Dave and Buster's is known for its excess and abundance, which was evident almost immediately. The food options are fairly standard, and some of it is not very healthy. However, most people come to Dave & Buster's for the games. Although I myself am not much of a video game or arcade game enthusiast, my siblings are. While I was initially skeptical about having fun at this venue, I quickly found myself caught up in my siblings' excitement. I was particularly pleased to discover that I have a talent for Skee Ball, which allowed me to dominate the game. Trust me, it was a blast.

source:
I love the games here but can't go very often since they don't rotate new games in very often.  The place is usually pretty clean.

Pool tables often have a wait on the weekend but are some of the better ones you'll find in the city.

Food is just "ok" Drink prices are fair but not great.
target: Although the games here are enjoyable, I am unable to visit frequently because new games are not introduced often. Nonetheless, the cleanliness of the place is typically maintained. On weekends, the pool tables are in high demand, and they are among the top-rated ones in the city. The food is average, while the drink prices are reasonable but not impressive.

source:
Dave and Buster's is an enigma, is it dining, a bar, or  playground for video game lovers? Let me get the bar part out of the way first, it's overpriced, and they try to get you to buy a glass to jack up your bill. 

Next, the food. Just like all the chain places at the Waterfront, there are sandwiches, burgers (yes they have a blue cheese burger, who doesn't?) pasta, salads, chicken fingers, yadda yadda. 

The games, I swear over three quarters of the games have been there since 2000 when the place opened. I guess in ten years no new games have hit the scene.

Overall Dave and buster's is unique to the Waterfront, but it's time to update the menu, update the games, and get into the second decade of the 21st century.
target: Dave and Buster's offers a mix of dining, entertainment, and drinks that may leave you guessing. Although the prices for drinks are steep, the chain boasts sufficient menu options to satisfy any appetite. Meanwhile, the arcade games and attractions may seem somewhat dated, with many having been around since the place initially opened in 2000. While it is still a unique destination at the Waterfront, a revamp of the menu and entertainment options would certainly help bring it into the modern era.

source:
The food was absolutely gross! I ordered a turkey club which comes on a wheat bun with avocado, bacon, and turkey breast. What I got was TOTALLY different from the picture! First of all the sandwich was on sliced bread (lame)! There was no avocado, 1 slice of bacon, no lettuce, and to TOP it off instead of turkey breast they used freaking LUNCH MEAT! lol No, not the kind that you get from the deli, the other sweaty nasty looking stuff! Gross! 

Our waitress was awful but they were extremely understaffed so I would have a bit of an attitude if I had to wait 10 tables without assistance too.   

The manager was really nice... Of course that disgusting sandwich that I didn't eat was free.
target: The sandwich I received was a far cry from what I had ordered. The picture showed a wheat bun with avocado, bacon, lettuce, and turkey breast, but what arrived was not even close to what was advertised. Instead of delicious turkey breast, there was cheap, nasty lunch meat, and there was no avocado, just one measly slice of bacon, no lettuce, and the sandwich was on sliced bread! Our waitress was terrible, but they were clearly understaffed, so I tried to be understanding. Despite my disappointment, the manager was kind enough to comp my meal.

source:
Not much of a review for this one, but just a few tidbits of info...

Pool (on Friday/Saturday) is $14 per hour
(I'm pretty sure its $10 through the week)

Mixed drinks are way too pricey for the location.
The food is crap.

The games are fun and the pool tables are nice (they're the big tournament style/size, not the shitty bar-room, tiny pool tables).

That is all.  :)

(the pricing is based on my recent trip.
We shot pool for a few hours, I had a bar tab (that wasn't out of control) and my night ended up costing me $60
target:
I don't have a full review, but here are some quick details... 

On Friday and Saturday, playing pool is $14 per hour. During the week, it's most likely $10. 

The drinks are quite expensive for the location, but the games are enjoyable and the pool tables are top-notch tournament size, not small bar-style tables. 

Unfortunately, the food here is subpar. 

These observations are based on my recent visit, where my bar tab was reasonable and my night ended up costing $60.

source: Dave and busters is the best place to eat and play games. There is many fun games and prizes to win. I highly suggest if you want to plays games, go Wednesday when all the games are half off. Food is pretty good and a nice bar. The downside is that the booze is pretty pricey.
target: Dave and busters is a great spot to enjoy a meal while having fun with a variety of games and winning exciting prizes. If you're looking to save on game time, I recommend visiting on Wednesdays when all games are discounted by half. They also have good food options and a great bar, although the drinks can be a bit expensive.

source:
When did Dave and Buster's become a daycare?? Everywhere you look, there are signs that say kids must be accompanied by an adult, but apparently no one was honoring that at 6PM on a Saturday. I couldn't even walk through the place without someone shoving me. AHHH!
I get that Dave and Buster's is an arcade and that you're going there to play some games, maybe eat, and kill some time. When I last went there a few years ago, we there for my bachelor party, and while I'm sure we got into some shenanigans, I don't remember children running wild there. We were having adult beverages, playing games, and having a good time. This time, it was ridiculous. It isn't Chuck E. Cheese, yet that's how parents seem to be treating the place.
On top of that, the customer service sucked. The place is gigantic, with tables and serving areas everywhere, yet on a Saturday at 6PM, the hostess told us (after interrupting us three times to chat with the other hostess) told us it would be a three hour wait, despite the fact that there were empty tables all over the dining room. I suspect this is a ploy to get you to play games and spend money until you're table is ready, but the food at Dave and Buster's is not worth a three hour wait on any day.
The hostess told us we could be served right away if we went to the midway and found an empty table, so we attempted that. Most of those tables were empty with usually one or two adults at a giant empty table filled with coats who informed us that they needed the table because their kids would be back soon after playing games. Next, i engaged in the most rudest thing I've ever done- I began stalking tables where people were finishing up. I would walk up to people paying their check, ask if I could have their table when they were done, and they would inform me that there were already two or three people who asked them and I should get in line.
Finally, we found a table and proceeded to spend two hours eating dinner. It wasn't because we ordered a lot of food- it was that the waiter took forever to bring our food out. He seemed to have no problem getting us fresh drinks, until we drank as much as we could and then asked for water. After that, he seemed to come around a lot less. 
I had the build your own chicken tacos, which comes on a giant plate with all kinds of fixings. The fixings were fresh, but the chicken was cold and dry, and the tortillas were dried out as well. For $14, it wasn't worth it. 
After dinner we proceeded to play games, which entails shoving people to get through areas and waiting in line to play anything. 
All in all, I didn't like my experience at Dave and Busters. I remembered it being a fun place to go and unwind as an adult. but between all the kids and the crappy service, can't recommend this place. If anyone asks me to go back, I may elect to stay home and poke my eyes with a fork.
target:
I recently visited Dave and Buster's and was disappointed by the experience. Despite the signs that kids must be accompanied by adults, children were running wild and making it difficult to move around the arcade. It seemed as though some parents were treating the place like Chuck E. Cheese, which was frustrating as I was hoping for a fun night out as an adult. 

The customer service was also quite poor. Despite a host of empty tables in the dining room, we were told there was a three-hour wait by a hostess who interrupted us several times to chat with her colleague. We suspected this was to encourage us to play games and spend more money until our table was ready, but the food wasn't worth a three-hour wait. 

We eventually found our own table and waited for our food, which took longer than expected despite our waiter providing fresh drinks frequently. Although the fixings for my build-your-own chicken tacos were fresh, the chicken was cold and dry, and the tortillas were dried out, which was disappointing for the $14 cost.

Afterwards, we played games and had to deal with long lines and crowded areas, making it an unpleasant experience overall. I wouldn't recommend going back to Dave and Busters, as children and poor service ruined what should have been a fun night out.

source:
Dave and Buster's has to be split up into separate experiences to rate it. 

Dining: 2 stars

I had a party of 20 coming in; I had called ahead of time, and arrived early. They immediately set up the table while about 4 of my friends and I waited; the hostess, after taking my name, never spoke to us again. She did not tell us when we could sit, how long it would be, or any other information. And then they made us wait for 75% of our party to show up before they would seat us. Mind you, there was no one else waiting, and the table was ready, and we were ready to order. But they didn't tell us this; I didn't even know why we were being forced to wait until I heard a supervisor whispering to the waitress about making us wait. I still have no idea why we were forced to wait. 

When my full party was finally seated, we were helped by two waiters who were perfectly polite and nice. BUT, our service was rather haphazard. People would order drinks and food, and get things at wildly different times. One person was done eating appetizers and drinks when another was just getting their first drink. I know there was chaos to a big party, but it got a little out of hand.

The food is pretty standard American chain food, comparable to Appleby's and Chili's - not offensive, but nothing to knock your socks off. It has a decent selection, and a few good desserts and appetizers, and everything was competently prepared. Overall, it is a fine enough meal for a large group before going to enjoy the arcade at fairly reasonable prices, but some of the service standards are poor. In the future we will probably eat at one of the other restaurants in the area and then move over to D&B's for games.

Bar: 1 Star

Drinks are predictably expensive, but there is a wide variety. The problem is that about half of them don't even kind of resemble what is on the menu, and most don't have enough alcohol to even taste. Worse yet, while you can get a drink at the bar in the arcade, the staff is either completely non-interactive or just rude. You have to track them down, and then have a minimum of interaction before they stomp off like you ruined their life.

Arcade: 4 Stars

There are a lot of great games here to play, and many that are fun with groups or pairs. It is a great place for a large party, because you can mingle with all your friends playing many different very fun games. If you are a couple, there are also many great selections that everyone enjoys. The staff on the floor is helpful and fast to fix games that have problems, and are typically polite. The ticket prizes are cheap as expected, but kind of fun, and the people in the ticket shop were always nice and quick to help.


Overall: 3 Stars

If you want to hang out here, I would suggest eating somewhere else, and then playing games and having fun here, but only order beer at the bar and don't expect a smile.
target: The experience at Dave and Buster's can be divided into three parts for a comprehensive review. The dining experience deserves a 2-star rating as the hostess seemed uninterested in our needs and kept us waiting without any explanation. Although the food was average, the service was a bit haphazard during our large group dinner. As for the bar, it earned a 1-star rating due to the expensive drinks that did not match the menu description and rude staff. However, the arcade experience was much nicer, garnering a 4-star rating with an array of enjoyable games and friendly staff. Overall, it's advisable to dine elsewhere and visit Dave and Buster's for the arcade games and a few beers without any expectations.

source:
Chuckie Cheese for grown ups...Yeah, that could sum up my review for sure (but I'll try to make it a bit more interesting than that).

First let me say that this isn't my first trip to a Dave & Buster's.  Second, I actually experience all of it while here.  We will start with the food/service.  Staff, you were wonderful.  You were polite, you greeted us as soon as we walked in the door, gave us no qualms while ordering and were swift with your delivery.  Food, you were not wonderful.  I ordered the BBQ chicken breasts.  This came with a side of broccoli and their type of mashed potatoes.  The chicken was a bit dry and in some places you can tell it was left on the grill a little too long.  There were actually some bites that all I could taste was charred meat.  There wasn't enough BBQ sauce on the the chicken either.  The broccoli appeared to have been cooked prior and then thrown back into a pan to be seared.  Some of my broccoli actually had some burnt crisp areas on it.  Also I noticed that there were still some leaves left on the broccoli.  The mashed potatoes I wanted to like (which I hoped would be the best part of the dish, I'm a bit of a potato freak), but alas, I was let down. *sad face* They were cold and such a tiny portion.  With a tiny amount of shredded cheese and bacon but into that divot they made with the scoop to get it out of it's container.  Oh food, how if I didn't need you to survive, I wouldn't complain about you.

The building right now is in disarray.  They are in the midst of a remodel with lovely plastic curtains covering up certain sections of their dining area.  No bar out in the dining area right now and the pool tables were absent as well.  If you wanted a drink you had to go back into the game room.

Speaking of the game room, by far the best part.  With the meal I ordered I got the $20 play card (the best part of the meal, super charge it for $3 more and it's even better).  The game room  you can tell is in need of an update.  The carpet is worn and other signs of wear are noticeable as well.  One good thing is the games.  They change them up so often that there is always something new once you return.  Who knew that playing Connect 4 could be so fun, or for that matter Skee Ball rises to the top of my list to play.

I will return again, but only after I eat elsewhere first.
target: Dave & Buster's is like a playground for adults, and my recent visit did not disappoint. Although the food was a bit of a letdown, the staff were fantastic - polite, prompt and attentive. My BBQ chicken was dry in places and lacked sufficient BBQ sauce, and the accompanying broccoli had burnt crisp areas and leaves left on it. The mashed potatoes were also disappointing with a tiny portion size and cold temperature. However, the game room more than made up for it. I received a $20 play card with my meal, which was the highlight of the experience. The games in the room are updated frequently, which makes every visit a new adventure. Although the building is currently being remodeled and some areas are covered up with plastic curtains, the game room is the main attraction and makes it all worthwhile. Despite the disappointing food, I will be back - but I'll make sure to eat elsewhere first!

source: Mediocre service. COLD food! Our food waited so long the lettuce & pickles wilted. Bland food. Crazy overpriced. Long waits in the arcade. 1 beer per hour maximum.  Avoid at all costs. Fair manager.
target: Below average service. FRIGID dishes! The vegetables and condiments turned stale due to prolonged waits. Tasteless dishes. Exorbitantly expensive. Extended waiting times in the gaming area. Only one beer per hour allowed. Steer clear of this place. Reasonable manager.

source: Not being from the area, I traveled an hour to come here from Uniontown, PA. I was excited! I haven't been to this Dave and Buster's since I was younger and was ready to go back and play me some games! I went with my cousins, mind you, we hadn't ate all day and were very hungry. So, we decided to do the Eat & Play Combo, naturally. Here's where it gets bad. First of all, we get a very snobby hostess that shows us to our table. Then, we wait...and wait...and finally after about 25 mins we get a waitress. Her name was Ashley. We had plenty of time to decide what we wanted, so we quickly put our order in. Next, we were sitting and talking, waiting, we had empty glasses and our waitress had never even come around to see if we needed refills except for one time. She said she'd come back right away with our refills...yea, right. 20 mins later we get our refills. Mind you, our food still hasn't came yet. I see other people getting their food that had come in after us. I was frustrated. After waiting 45 mins for our food, I asked to speak with a manager. One of the servers who I asked replied rudely with \"Well, he's really busy right now. I doubt he'll be able to come out and talk to you\". Finally, 15 mins later...that's one hour, folks. We get our food. What do you think the next problem was? Yep, the food was cold. I was completely fed up at this point, and told my waitress how disappointed I was, especially after driving one hour just to have this terrible service. The manager never came to speak with me, and we didn't even receive our meals for free. The only compensation we got were $10 game cards. Woopty-doo. The only thing good about this place is the games, but the prizes you get for your tickets are all junk and worthless. So, in conclusion...I DO NOT RECOMMEND THE WATERFRONT DAVE AND BUSTERS OF HOMESTEAD, PA. It was horrible, and I will not be returning for a very long time!
target: I traveled from Uniontown, PA to visit this Dave and Buster's location and was excited to play some games with my cousins. We decided to try the Eat & Play Combo since we were hungry, but unfortunately, our experience was less than satisfactory. After being seated by a snobby hostess, we waited over 25 minutes for a waitress to take our order. Even after placing our order, we were left with empty glasses and no refills until 20 minutes later. Despite waiting for 45 minutes for our food, it came out cold. Frustrated, I asked to speak with a manager, but was told they were too busy to speak with me. To make matters worse, we did not receive any compensation for our poor service, only $10 game cards which we found to be disappointing. While the games were fun, we do not recommend the Waterfront Dave and Busters of Homestead, PA due to the terrible service we experienced.

source:
This place just plain sucks
Bad management lost them biz
Dumb arcade drama*

* they have recently changed their under 21 policy so no one underage can even be in the arcade or restaurant after 10pm despite having a guardian over 30 years old
target:
This establishment is simply terrible. Poor leadership has caused them to lose business. Additionally, there is unnecessary drama in the arcade. 

Recently, they have implemented a policy that prohibits anyone under the age of 21 from being in the arcade or restaurant after 10pm, even if they are accompanied by a guardian who is over 30 years old.

source: i had fun here.. fun big kid games for me!!!\nO.. But the bartender Melissa was a SUPER bitch and RUDE \nHope they fire her..
target: I enjoyed my time here playing fun games like a big kid! However, the bartender Melissa's behavior was unacceptable and rude. I hope the management takes appropriate action.

source:
DAVE & BUSTERS!  It's a nice place to eat, have fun and drink!!  All ages can enjoy this place.  I was so EXCITED to hear them announce that after 10p, all children whether accompanied by a guardian or not had to go!  It made for a nice evening for adults only.  

Everytime we go whether we play or not we enjoy ourselves.  I didn't give it FOUR STARS because every time I've went I haven't been able to eat in the restaurant area of there.  I know I still get the same food that everyone else does wherever you sit.  Sometimes, I like the nice relaxing atmosphere of the restaurant.  I haven't as of yet, been seated there.  

Not to mention that the servers around the bar, are a little slow at responding to customers as well.  So all in all, D&B's is a good spot to stop at for food and entertainment.  Just don't expect to be seated in the restaurant portion, and expect to wait awhile for food service in the bar area.
target: DAVE & BUSTERS is a great spot to grab some food, drinks and have a good time. This place is suitable for all ages, and it's exciting to know that after 10p, it's only open for adults. We always enjoy ourselves whether we decide to play games or not. It's worth noting that we haven't been able to dine at the restaurant section every time we visit, but the food always meets the same high standards, regardless of where we sit. Additionally, we've noticed that the service at the bar area can be a little slow, but overall, D&B's is an excellent spot for entertainment and dining. Keep in mind that you might have to wait a while for service in the bar area and won't always be able to sit in the restaurant portion.

source: A fun place and lots to do but a bit pricy. $20.00 will buy you a hundred points which will last you a little over an hour.I recommend the bowling game ,ball racing car game and connect 4 also there are several games that can be played in groups of 4
target: This place is a great source of entertainment with a variety of activities available, but it may be a little expensive for some. For $20.00, you can purchase a hundred points that will provide entertainment for slightly over an hour. I suggest trying out the bowling game, ball racing car game, and connect 4. In addition, there are a number of games that can be enjoyed with a group of four people.

source: Visited the Dave and Busters in Homestead, PA last night. Waitress mixed up our credit cards and gave my brothers credit card to someone else and he theirs. Charged them already too - both incorrectly My brother had to walk around and find out who it was. Waitress never apologized.
