source: Really the only thing good about this place is the happy hour. No one wants to pay $8 for a glass of wine that is a short pour and bottom quality.
target: The happy hour is the sole redeeming feature of this place. It's unreasonable to pay $8 for a subpar, measly pour of wine.

source:
I don't frequent Bar Louie, and I really don't plan to change that any time soon. I've eaten here and stopped in for drinks a couple times over the years and I just haven't been super impressed by the place.

The food has been decent - a few years back I splurged on an enormous fried chicken sandwich and definitely enjoyed it, glutton that I am - but their meals and appetizers alike have admittedly never "wowed" me. And while I enjoy their cocktails and would consider stopping in just for drinks more often, the problem is that things are way overpriced here. Even during the happy hour drinks are pretty costly, not to mention that I think most of the drinks I personally like don't qualify for the happy hour discount, which is disappointing. Once I stopped in with friends after a movie and one drink cost me $10 here. Not even a large one, either! Sorry, but I find that to be kind of ridiculous, especially since there's cheaper places to get drinks in the area.

Still, the food and drinks are definitely a-ok albeit overpriced, so this place would be rated 3 stars in my mind IF I could hear myself think when I eat here. But good Lord, they're just so loud! I always leave with a sore throat from yelling to make myself heard. Not cool, Bar Louie. Not cool.

So while the food and drinks are fine enough the loud venue and prices mean that this is definitely not one of my favorite places - and given the other options we have at the Waterfront I don't expect to be back in any time soon.
target: I have been to Bar Louie a few times over the years, but it just doesn't impress me enough to become a regular. The food is decent, although nothing has ever really blown me away. The prices for both food and drinks are pretty high, even during happy hour, and some of my favorite drinks are not even included in the discount. On top of that, the venue is so noisy that it's hard to have a conversation without raising your voice. While Bar Louie is okay, I doubt I'll be back anytime soon when there are cheaper and quieter options available at the Waterfront.

source:
My sons a and I came for Tuesday Dollar Burger Night. You can gat a "burger" (beef, chicken, portabella, or turkey) in a bun with lettuce for a buck. Then you can add toppings to complete your burger at a small cost-cheese 75 cents, veggies 50 cents, Artery Cloggers 75 cents, sauce 25 cents. Those are the headings and they have items listed under them-like 9 different cheeses. You can also get a basket of tots or fries for a small price as well. 
My burger was $2.25 after I added toppings. Is it the best burger I've ever had? No. But is it the best $2.25 burger I've ever had?  Yes. It's kind if a Russian roulette as to how your burger will come to you cooked. Mine was well done and one if my son's burger had pink in the middle. We probably could have sent it back but we don't mind a little pink. 
I love the tater tots!  They are crispy and have the right amount of salt. Yummy!!
Our server was great and we'll definitely be back.
target: My family and I went to Tuesday Burger Night where you can order a burger (beef, chicken, portabella, or turkey) in a bun with lettuce for only a dollar. Additional toppings like cheese, veggies, Artery Cloggers, and sauce are available for a small cost with different options listed under each category. They also serve a basket of fries or tots for a minimal price. Although my burger cost me $2.25 after adding toppings, it wasn't the best burger I've tasted, but for its price, it's worth it. The cook is inconsistent, so the burger might not come out cooked to your preference. However, I enjoyed the crispy tater tots with adequate salt. Our server was excellent, and we will undoubtedly return.

source: Great environment at night! Songs going on very lively!! The food of my friends who ordered burger and fried shrimps was not that great. But I ordered chicken flatbread which was really delicious! Absolutely loved it  will definitely go here again just for the flatbreads
target: The atmosphere was amazing at night with lively music! Though my friends ordered a burger and fried shrimps, their food didn't seem to match up to the same level. However, I ordered chicken flatbread which was scrumptious and simply delightful! I absolutely enjoyed it and would surely come back again just for the flatbreads.

source:
I'm not into waterparks as much as I am into amusement parks.  I go to Sandcastle maybe once a year.  But my Chicago friend Catherine came in to visit for the weekend and after a day at the zoo, we donned our swimsuits and came here.  The main part of the park is closed in the evenings, but the Sandbar and the Sandbar Pool and the Hot Tub remain open for the 21 and over set.  The Sandbar has a great menu of food and drinks and has a $6.00 cover charge to get in.  Occasionally there's live entertainment.

It's hard to believe that before they built this place, it was the site of an abandoned steel mill.  Actually, it was the railroad yard for the nearby Homestead Works.  But after site-clearing and clean-up, they turned it into a beautiful place to spend a warm day or nice evening.  The view across the Mon is quite beautiful with a wooded hillside on the other side.  There's even a boat dock, so you can arrive by river if you desire.

I'm glad I renewed my acquaintance with this place and hopefully, I'll get another chance to come back.
target:
Although I prefer amusement parks over waterparks, I decided to visit Sandcastle with my friend Catherine who was visiting from Chicago. Despite only going once a year, I was excited to spend a day here after a trip to the zoo. While the main part of the park closes at night, the Sandbar, Sandbar Pool, and Hot Tub remain open for guests over 21, and they provide a great selection of food and beverages at an entrance fee of $6.00. Sometimes, you can even catch live entertainment.

It's amazing to think that this beautiful place was once an abandoned steel mill, previously a railroad yard for Homestead Works. But after an extensive clean-up and site-clearing, it's now a perfect destination for a warm day or a lovely evening. The Mon river's view is enchanting, especially with the wooded hillside on the other side, and there's a boat dock if you prefer to arrive by water.

Now that I've renewed my acquaintance with this spot, I hope I'll have another opportunity to visit again.

source: It's fun, but not as fun as Kennywood. The boardwalk food is a bit too far from the wave pool and that makes for a lot of shoes on/shoes off events. The lazy river could be much better. I did like the water slides and the Potato Patch fries, as well as the scenic location.
target: Kennywood is definitely more enjoyable than here. The wave pool being far from the boardwalk food area results in many people taking their shoes on and off. The lazy river could use some improvement. However, I did have a great time at the water slides and the Potato Patch had amazing fries. Also, the location offers breathtaking views.

source:
Sandcastle is a mixed bag for the kiddos.  On the one hand, there are plenty of waterslides/pools that are a good fit for young "riders", on the other hand, Sandcastle, like any city amusement park, attracts more than its fair share of highschool kids looking to spend some time away from their parents and assert their personhood.  

Unfortunately that element doesn't particularly care about "censoring" speech for 9 year old ears, and worse, in the Mon Tsunami, about personal space, since the wave pool becomes a near mosh pit of jostling and strutting and shoving and 'showing off' for the fairer sex, and that can be a little dicey for the littler kids.

Having said that, it's still a good day at the park. . . cheese fries, a cool dip in the pool on a hot day, some fun slides. . . 

I think in rating Sandcastle fairly you have to understand the context of the park.  It is NOT policed particularly effectively.  if you take small children you have to be a diligent parent and be aware of your surroundings, paying attention to the group of 17 somethings thrashing around in your near vicinity, "accidentally" bumping into people for a reaction from their group.  

MOSTLY it's a good time.  Mostly.
target: Sandcastle provides both good and bad experiences for children. Although there are many suitable water slides and pools for young children to enjoy, the amusement park can also attract high school students seeking independence from their parents. This group of teenagers may use inappropriate language and engage in rough behavior, which could be intimidating for smaller children. Despite these negative aspects, the park can still be enjoyable with options like cheesy fries and refreshing pool dips.  However, it is important to recognize that Sandcastle can be an unmonitored environment, and parents must remain attentive to their surroundings, especially when in close proximity to rowdy teenagers. Generally, Sandcastle offers a positive experience for visitors, but there are a few things to keep in mind for a safe and fun day.

source:
So the last time I went to a water park was probably when I was in elementary school and didn't really know how to swim (... I still kinda don't. lol). Anyway, it was in California at Raging Rivers and it was a traumatizing experience. Screaming & being tossed around in the pool that pushes periodic waves at the sound of a loud horn and ending up with scraped knees and feet. Not fun.

So to say the least, I was a bit nervous coming to this water park afraid to have another episode of feeling I was being drowned. Luckily that did not happen.

I seriously had SO MUCH fun here! I honestly was only expecting to go on the Lazy River pool all day but with my bf, we hit up so many rides... tandem AND single rides! I feel like such a big girl now! Definitely lean back while you're on those single donuts on the water rides, or else you feel like you're going to flip over while swishing down the tubes. The new dragon ride they just opened up was okay. I was expecting it to be so much more fun, but literally you just slide down a dark tube into a circular room where you just slowly swirl your way down the middle hole and that was it. 

There was this one ride where you slide down the tubes for a few seconds, then you land into a pool where a worker pushes you into another tube and this continues about 3 times. It was weird. Kinda awkward with the worker having to grab you and push you through. Although it was still fun. The last dude threw me in backwards! Scared the crap out of me but it was fun :)

The food here is surprisingly pretty affordable. Plus, who wants to eat a huge meal while in your swim suit. Me don't want no pot belly. 

Overall I had such a fun time here. It definitely made me rethink my fear of water parks. By the way, we went on a Saturday in early June and it wasn't as packed as I thought it would be! So the lines weren't long at all. Also, go to Giant Eagle to purchase your discounted tickets. You save a few bucks versus buying them at the water park. Oh and don't forget to bring sandals while walking around. Your feet will literally feel like they're burning from the ground. Now go off and have some fun! :)
target: My last visit to a water park was a bad experience because I was unable to swim well and the place had rough waves that resulted in me getting scraped knees and feet. That traumatic incident made me anxious about going to another water park. However, I had a pleasant surprise on this trip with my boyfriend. We tried a bunch of rides that I thought I would never have the courage to go on, including single donut-like rides where you need to lean back to avoid flipping over. The food was also affordable, and I refrained from eating a lot to avoid a pot belly in my swimsuit. In contrast to my earlier experience, I had such a great time at the park that it dispelled my deep-seated apprehensions about water parks. On a related note, we got discounted tickets at Giant Eagle, and it was great not to have to wait in long lines. It would also be wise to bring sandals to avoid burning feet while walking around. I hope you have a blast on your next visit! :)

source:
okay, so it's not as fun as kennywood but i guess it's still cool... 

i planned ahead a day to go for me & bobby (his first time) it was supposed to be nice day, but the weather changed in 2 weeks.. 

we picked a nice time.. since it was literally supposed to rain all day, there werent any long lines/ we literally rode every water slide in one hour. then we went to head to the lazy river--- & it was closed! they said it was closed due to not enough attendence, but i mean come on. we still paid $70 for 2 people to come in this park where i just rode everything in one hour.. keep the lazy river open so i can kill an hour! aah. the cliff hanger was also closed- like always. 

so we just went and rode everything again. the Dragon's Den is sweet and the blue tubaluba is as well. bobby had a blast on the speed slides. i have to admit though, i do miss the regular body slide. 

another reason i chose august 3rd to go to sandcastle was that the park was open until 7pm rather than 5 or 6 like regular days. well actually at 4:45 we recieved a "15 minute warning" that the park was closing at 5 due to rain. ugh, a little more time would've been helpful. 

i couldnt hear the warning and asked an employee who said they were closing in ten minutes due to the weather and being under-staffed to stay open until 7. it started to rain at 5 and literally at 5:20 the rain was over . the park could've just shut down the rides until the rain cloud passed,  but due to being under-staffed would rather hand out rain checks.. which is fine because we get an another entire day, but i mean it would be a terrible inconvience from someone out of town who planned a family day. 

overall, the smile on my boyfriend's face was priceless, but i truly wish we could've enjoyed the lazy river and the park until 7. hopefully next time things go as planned....
target:
While not as thrilling as Kennywood, Sandcastle still had its own charm. I had planned a day ahead to go with my friend Bobby, hoping for good weather. Unfortunately, the forecast changed drastically in just two weeks of time. 

Despite the rain, we managed to enjoy ourselves because the water park wasn't crowded at all. We rode every water slide within an hour, but were disappointed to find the lazy river closed. We paid good money for the park, and not having everything available was tough to swallow. They said it was due to not enough attendance, but after spending $70 for two people, it was hard to accept. 

Instead, we ended up redoing the slides and found that the Dragon's Den and blue Tubaluba were fantastic. Bobby loved the speed slides, and while I enjoyed them too, I kind of missed the regular body slides. 

Another reason we chose August 3rd to visit Sandcastle was because the park was open until 7pm. We were given a 15-minute warning at 4:45pm that the park was closing early because of the rain, which was frustrating because it had stopped raining by 5:20pm. It seemed like they could've just closed the rides until the rain had passed, but instead they chose to hand out rain checks due to being understaffed. 

Despite our disappointments, my boyfriend's smile made the day worth it. Hopefully next time, the weather and park schedules will align perfectly.

source:
Sandcastle Water Park in P-Burgh was just "okay" for me. I really think that this place is geared towards children more so than adults or "family" because there isn't much fun here for people older than 16. The water slides here were lacking. There were very few of them and the majority of them are boring. The last time I was there (not too long ago) there weren't any extremely modern slides like a tornado slide, so they really have some updating to do. 

They do have an "adult pool" and bar area but it was so packed that it was hard to actually have fun in this area. The pool is very small, similar to one you'd find at a hotel chain. It has a hot tub area but it sits about 8 adults max. and people were fighting tooth and nail to get in. It wasn't too impressive to me. 

They also have a lazy river at this park and, while I do enjoy lazy rivers, this one was so packed that it was hard to breathe. People kept bumping into me and touching me and it made me grossed out. 

The one attraction that I did enjoy was the wave pool. It was crowded as well but large enough to fit everybody comfortably. The water was nice and clean (a big plus) and the wave action was strong. I could have stayed in there for the entire time we were at the park.

Overall, this place is just mediocre. It doesn't "wow" me very much but if you live in the area, have kids, and are looking for somewhere to go in the summer other than the mall, it'll provide them with a lot of fun.
target:
My experience at Sandcastle Water Park in P-Burgh was average. It seems like it's better suited for children rather than adults or families, as there isn't much to do after the age of 16. The water slides were limited, and most of them weren't very exciting. They definitely need to invest in some modern upgrades like a tornado slide. 

They do have a designated adult area with a pool and bar, but it was so overcrowded that it didn't enhance the experience. The pool was small like a typical hotel pool and the hot tub area was only big enough for 8 people. I wasn't impressed. 

Their lazy river ride was way too crowded, which made it difficult to enjoy. There were people constantly bumping into me and it was pretty unpleasant. 

The wave pool was the one attraction that I actually liked. Despite being crowded, it was spacious enough so that everyone could enjoy it. The water was clean and the waves were strong, giving a great feeling. 

Overall, I would say that Sandcastle Water Park is an average place to visit. It won't blow your mind, but if you have kids and are looking for a way to beat the summer heat, it's definitely an option.

source: For some reason, I had a tremendous amount of anxiety about buying a new mattress. Maybe I was just self-conscious about rolling around on a bunch of beds in a public place. \n\nABD Mattress quickly alleviated any idiotic fears I may have had. The store was empty when I arrived on a Monday afternoon and I was attended to immediately and never felt pressured. ABD has a great selection of mattresses, and the prices cannot be beat. I picked up a full plush pillow-top mattress for a cool $375 (without a box spring or a frame, since I already had one). Better yet? Delivery is free AND prompt. You pick a three-hour timeframe, and the store will call you on the day of delivery to narrow it to a one-hour slot so you're not sitting around all afternoon.
target: I was feeling quite apprehensive about purchasing a new mattress, possibly due to the idea of trying out different mattresses in a public place. However, my concerns were put to rest by the welcoming and accommodating staff at XYZ Bedding. The store wasn't crowded when I walked in and I didn't feel rushed or pushed to make a hasty purchase. The variety of mattresses they offered was impressive, and their prices were quite reasonable. I ended up buying a comfortable pillow-top mattress for just $375 without having to purchase a box spring or frame as I already had one. The best part was their free and efficient delivery service. They allowed me to choose a three-hour delivery slot and later narrowed it down to a more specific one-hour time slot on the day of delivery so I didn't have to wait around all day.

source:
I'm a mattress buying novice. I also hate buying things that require you to try-before-you-buy. I also seem to give explanatory information about myself before reviews. Anyway. 

I had a lot of anxiousness about buying a mattress. If it's terrible, you'll be spending a large proportion of your life in misery until you fix the problem. Who wants that? Especially for something that can be as expensive as a mattress? 

These people were great. They patiently answered all of my mattress questions and treated me like a valued customer - both times I called, the man on the phone remembered my name (and number!) and took care of me. When I failed to buy a box spring (why oh why did I think I could go without a box spring??) they were able to take care of me over the phone and get me a box spring in the SAME day. Within hours, even. They even helped me set up the mattress that I DIDN'T purchase from them, which blew me away. 

Their professionalism and friendliness are excellent. I will recommend them to everyone who's in the market for a mattress, especially students, because their student deals are fantastic.
target: As someone who's not experienced in buying mattresses, I tend to avoid products that require me to test them out first. But lately, I've been feeling anxious about buying a mattress because if it's uncomfortable, it would mean spending most of my life dealing with a terrible sleeping experience. Plus, mattresses can be quite pricey. However, I was pleasantly surprised with the level of service these people provided. They patiently answered all of my questions and made me feel like an important customer. They even remembered my name and number, which was impressive! When I forgot to purchase a box spring, they quickly resolved the issue over the phone and even helped me set up my new mattress (even though I didn't buy it from them). Their professionalism and friendliness are top-notch and I highly recommend them, especially for students who can take advantage of their amazing deals.

source: Great customer service.  I was in Pittsburgh for business and needed a car to get back to the airport.  I found these guys on Yelp, and the reviews were not wrong.  It was easy to order the car and pick-up was prompt.
target: Fantastic customer support. During my business trip in Pittsburgh, I required a vehicle to take me to the airport. I came across this company on Yelp, and the evaluations were certainly accurate. The car reservation process was simple, and the pick-up time was speedy.

source:
Other people may have had a better experience with this company but that was not the case for us.  We had rented a limo/bus for a bachelor party.  Our driver Scott, was completely clueless in navigating the city. Constantly making wrong turns and missing exits. All of this after very thorough instruction as to where to go. Each destination took 3-4 times longer to reach due to his incompetence. This caused us to have to skip a couple of our originally planned stops. After returning to the bus after one of our stops we were informed by Scott that the police had come onto the bus and searched it with dogs. Really?!??!  Why??!!  How??!!  We found that our bags had been rifled through and we all felt a little violated and confused. By this point we decided to call it a night. More than half of our passengers didn't care to step back onto the bus and took cabs home. 

Just when we thought the worst was over we were wrong. As we enter the highway we realize that Scott has driven all the way up the ramp and onto the highway going THE WRONG WAY!!!  He starts slowly reversing down the ramp while oncoming cars honk and swerve all around us!  Truly terrifying. After that, we were very upset and just wanted to get home. So after several more wrong turns we finally get home. Absolutely terrible night. 

So if you'd like to book a party bus that will include a geographically blind driver, unecessary police involvement, a near death experience and just an overall sense of frustration mixed with panic then go with these guys. Otherwise, I would suggest staying far, far away!
target: While some may have had a positive experience with this company, unfortunately, our experience was the complete opposite. We had booked a limo/bus for a bachelor party, but our driver seemed completely lost and unable to navigate the city. Despite detailed instructions, he continually made wrong turns and missed exits, which caused us to arrive at our destinations much later than planned. As if that wasn't enough, during one of our stops, the police unexpectedly searched the bus with dogs, leaving us feeling violated and confused. By the end of the night, more than half of our passengers had opted to leave and take cabs home. As if things couldn't get any worse, our driver drove up the highway ramp the wrong way, forcing us to reverse down while cars honked and swerved around us. It was a truly terrifying experience, and we just wanted to get home. Unless you're looking for a night filled with frustration, panic, and danger, we strongly suggest avoiding this company at all costs.

source:
So I moved to Pittsburgh from Los Angeles. I know I know I know!
Anyway so theres absolutely no places in Homestead that delivered Chinese so I decided to walk down to the closest Chinese food/restaurant to my house. 

The family that runs the restaurant is very friendly. I read a review about them on Google that said the  mom looks like she might want to cook you alive. Don't believe it!

On this visit I ordered the Steamed Dumplings(recommended by some reviewer on google...THAT LIAR) and the Vegetable Chow Fun. I generally enjoy steamed dumplings but these dumplings(too much dumpling little meat) werent so good. Theyll probably be sitting in my mini fridge tomorrow and I'll force myself to eat them when I have the munchies/starving to death. The Vegetable Chow Fun on the other hand verrrrrrrrrrrrrry yummy. Definately most have next time anyone decides to stop by. 

But all in all the verdict is you typical Chinese Take Out Place.

*puts the menu on the fridge*
target: After relocating from Los Angeles to Pittsburgh, I found it challenging to find a Chinese restaurant that delivers to Homestead. Consequently, I decided to walk to the nearest Chinese food spot close to my place. The restaurant is a family-owned business, and they were very welcoming. Although someone had left a review on Google about the mom's appearance, I found her friendly and hospitable. I ordered Steamed Dumplings, recommended by a supposed reviewer on Google, and Vegetable Chow Fun. To my disappointment, the Steamed Dumplings had too much dough and little filling. I plan to eat them when I crave unhealthy junk food. Conversely, the Vegetable Chow Fun was delicious, and I recommend it to anyone who plans to visit the restaurant. However, overall the restaurant serves the typical Chinese takeout food. I place the menu on my fridge for future reference.

source: The worse \"Chinese food\", even the white rice which came with the ogle sweet and sour chicken is really bad.  Please don't eat this food.
target: The Chinese cuisine served here is below average, even the basic white rice with the sweet and sour chicken is displeasing. It's recommended to avoid consuming this food.

source:
Meh, I've experienced better is an understatement.

Friday's is like the "fine dining chain" for every yinzer in Pittsburgh...

1.  When we were seated, it was quick which was a surprise.  Somehow this restaurant gets packed and I never understand why.  I was happy about that.
2.  I ordered one of their "skinny margaritas", blackberry to be exact.  It was a nice size, however, at $6.00/pop, that was half of my food bill.
3.  The waitress started off attentive, but after our food came out she was gone.  I ordered a turkey burger with pickle and mustard.  Loaded mashed potato on the side because I wanted heartburn ha!
4.  Food came.  My burger had lettuce on it only.  Waitress was supposed to go and get our next round of drinks.  I had to wait to ask for my pickle.
5.  The loaded potatoes were more like rubber than potatoes and not what I was expecting.  Disappointment.
6.  The waitress then went into oblivion and only returned with our check.  

Never again will I eat at Friday's.  I will, however, go should a happy hour arise...
target: My experience at Friday's was disappointing to say the least. It seems to be a popular choice among Pittsburgh locals, but I don't quite understand why. While the seating was quick, the prices were not. My skinny margarita, which was good-sized, cost me $6.00 - half of what I ended up paying for my entire meal. The turkey burger I ordered with pickle and mustard came with only lettuce, and the loaded mashed potatoes were not what I was expecting at all. Though the waitress was attentive at first, she quickly disappeared and was nowhere to be found until she handed us the check. Though I won't be visiting Friday's again for a meal, I may consider it for happy hour in the future.

source: This place.. Is ok if ur grabn something quick .. But they do have a great happy hour tho
target: Although it's ideal for a quick bite, this place's happy hour is a standout.

source: Boo!  What happened to this location?  It used to be happy and fun!  It just feels depressing and nearly everyone there is just doing the bare minimum to get by?  So sad.
target: Oh my! What's going on with this place? It was always cheerful and lively before. However, presently, it appears to be gloomy, and people are merely putting in the bare minimum effort. It's disheartening.

source:
I'm not opposed to chain restaurants but this TGI Fridays in comparison to some of the other ones in the area truly falls short of the "chain" expectation. 

I order the Jack Daniel's chicken and shrimp with just fries. The fries were undercooked and thrown haphazardly into the sauce holder. The shrimp was over cooked and just deepfried. The chicken was fatty and just tasted like it came from their freezer. Even the water tasted weird.

Fortunately, we had a very nice and charismatic waiter and all of the staff was very friendly. 

I'd recommend the TGI Fridays out in South Hills Village over this one any day.
target: Although I don't have anything against chain restaurants, this particular TGI Fridays location fails to meet my expectations that come along with the "chain" label. My dish of Jack Daniel's chicken and shrimp, along with a side of fries, left a lot to be desired - the fries were undercooked and carelessly placed into the sauce holder, the shrimp was overcooked and tasted like it had just been thrown into a deep fryer, and the chicken was quite fatty and had an obvious frozen taste. Even the water tasted strange. Thankfully, our waiter was incredibly friendly and charismatic, as was the rest of the staff. If you're looking for a TGI Fridays to visit, I'd recommend the one located out in South Hills Village instead of this particular location.

source: I had a gift card so I decided to use it for a to go order. The food tasted frozen and microwaved. Nothing special just around average!
target: As I had a gift card, I chose to place a to-go order. Unfortunately, the food seemed to have been frozen and reheated in a microwave. It was decent but nothing exceptional.

source: Went with 5 others for a weeknight dinner. The server was very friendly, but seemed a little overwhelmed. Maybe they were short handed.  The food was to me not even average. I ordered a burger, which very overdone and dry. Had to drown it in mayo to get moisture in it.  My friend ordered nachos and what arrived looked like they had broken some taco shells down the middle, then put cheese and one jalape\u00f1o slice on each piece. Imagine 6 half-moons of taco shell.  Not like any nachos I've ever seen, and more importantly not even the way they were served the three prior times my friend had ordered them.
target: We went out for a casual weeknight dinner with a group of five. The server was friendly, but appeared to be overwhelmed, possibly due to a shortage of staff. Sadly, the food did not meet our expectations. My burger was overcooked and dry, and I had to add mayonnaise to moisten it up. My friend's nachos were unrecognizable - six half-moon pieces of taco shell with a dash of cheese and a single jalapeo slice on each. It was nowhere close to what they had served my friend on their previous visits.

source: I don't care what Cub and Bulls fans think, this Steeler and Penguins fan thinks deep dish pizza is not all that. First, the crust tastes like a biscuit, and biscuits belong nowhere near or on a pizza. I will give UNOs a thumbs up on it's flatbread, it's better pizza than some pizzerias In the area. When I look over uno's menu almost nothing excites me, this place is a dud. Guess what? Chicagoans don't know how to eat hot dogs either!
target: As a fan of the Steelers and Penguins, I am not impressed by deep dish pizza despite the opinions of Cubs and Bulls fans. The crust reminds me more of a biscuit than a pizza base, which is not ideal. UNOs does have decent flatbread pizza, but overall their menu doesn't excite me much. And just like their love for deep dish, Chicagoans also don't know how to eat hot dogs properly.

source:
Not quite authentic but good enough for Pittsburgh. It's the only place that I've found that even comes close to a classic Chicago style deep dish.
I also had the french onion soup that wasn't bad. The croutons were still crunchy and it had just the right amount of cheese.

My girlfriend really enjoyed her Caesar salad and said she'd come back just for the salad.

Overall, I enjoyed it and would come back the next time I get a craving for a deep dish pizza. It wasn't authentic but it certainly was not terrible.
target: While not an exact replica, Pittsburgh's deep dish pizza is a worthy substitute for classic Chicago style. I also tried the French onion soup, which was decent with crisp croutons and well-balanced cheese. My girlfriend loved the Caesar salad so much she would return just for it. While not completely genuine, our experience was enjoyable and I would revisit when the craving for deep dish strikes. It may not be perfect, but it's far from terrible.

source: Awful everything. From the bad service, to the diluted soup, to the lame-no chicken on the chicken salad, to the PRE-fabricated pizza. AVOID THIS PLACE!
target: Terrible experience. Poor service, watered-down soup, chicken salad with no chicken, and pre-made pizza. Steer clear of this establishment.

source:
I really love deep dish pizza. The thick crust that is crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. The spicy, peppery sauce that can singe your tongue. The mixture of ingredients just sliding down your chin as it bubbles out of your mouth. That being said, I really don't understand why people go to Pizzeria Uno. This chain has done to the deep dish pizza what McDonald's has done to hamburgers, Pizza Hut has done to pan pizza, Dominoes has done to hand tossed pizza, and Taco Bell has done to Tex-Mex; it has made it almost unpalatable. On our menu:

French onion
Chicken bites
Pizza with pepperoni, hamburger, and romano

Looking past the fact that the service was not the best or the fact that the food came out undercooked and tepid in temperature, the food just was not good. Don't get me wrong, this is not the worst pizza I have ever eaten, but this chain is a perfect example of what happens when something becomes so prescribed, overhandled, and overthought that it no longer resembles the original piece of art that tasted so good. 

I really never want to return.
target: I have such a passion for deep dish pizza. From the crispy yet fluffy crust to the fiery sauce that can set your taste buds on fire, and the blend of toppings that effortlessly melts in your mouth, it's no wonder it's a personal favorite of mine. However, I just can't seem to understand the hype around Pizzeria Uno. This chain has taken the quintessential deep dish pizza and turned it into a tasteless dish, comparable to what McDonald's has done to hamburgers or Pizza Hut has done to pan pizza. Even though they offer options like French onion, chicken bites, and a pizza topped with pepperoni, hamburger, and romano, I found myself ignoring how terrible the service was or how the food was cold and undercooked because the taste was simply not worth it. I wouldn't say that it's the worst pizza I've ever had, but it's a prime example of what happens when an exceptional piece of food art is subjected to overthinking and loses its charm. Needless to say, I have no interest in returning.

source: Food was ok had a steak w/ shrimp side Ass mashed potatoes. Everything was ok not a lot of flavor.
target: The food was decent, I ordered a steak with a shrimp side and mashed potatoes. However, it lacked any notable flavors.

source:
I ate here at around 8:00 on a Saturday night.  Reading the other reviews, it makes me wonder if people were a the same restaurant I was.  Sure, it isn't a world class dining establishment, but it is decent considering it is a chain.  You should know that going into any chain, really.  It was basically exactly what I expected in terms of food quality and price.

We were greeted immediately upon entering, and while the hostess went to grab menus, another server asked us if we were taken care of.  Service at our table was very attentive and water and other beverages were promptly refilled.  I ordered soup and two appetizers instead of an entree or pizza and the server made sure to ask me about the order in which I would prefer receiving my food.  

My fiance ordered a deep dish pizza and we know they take longer to make than other food items.  It was quicker than we thought it would be and he really enjoyed it.  I had the potato skin appetizer.  It reminds me of a "baked potato pizza" that I used to enjoy at a local place back in Buffalo.  It was delicious, especially with the addition of a little bit of hot sauce.

Overall, it doesn't even come close to visiting an Uno's in Chicago, but then again, when does a copy every live up to the original?  It won't be a regular location in our  dining rotation, but it is good to know that when we have a craving for deep dish, Uno will do the trick and cost a lot less than a trip to Chicago.
target:
I dined at this restaurant on a Saturday night around 8:00 pm. After reading some of the reviews, I wondered if they had gone to the same restaurant I did. I wouldn't say it's the best dining place in the world, but it's decent for a chain restaurant. As with any chain, it's important to have realistic expectations. The food quality and price were exactly what I anticipated. 

As soon as we arrived, we were greeted by the hostess who went to get our menus, while another server checked in to see if we needed help. During our meal, the service was excellent, with regular water and beverage refills. Instead of a big pizza or an entree, I ordered soup and two appetizers, and the server double-checked the order to ensure I received it in the order I preferred. 

My fiance ordered the deep dish pizza, which typically takes longer to prepare than other dishes. However, we were pleasantly surprised at how quickly it was ready, and he thoroughly enjoyed consuming it. I went for the potato skin appetizer, which reminded me of a "baked potato pizza" at a local spot back in Buffalo that I used to love. With a little bit of hot sauce, it tasted great.

In general, it's not on par with the original Uno's in Chicago, but then again, when has a knockoff ever been as good as the real thing? Although it won't be a regular spot in our dining rotation, it's good to know that we can satisfy our deep dish cravings at Uno's without breaking the bank or taking a trip to the Windy City.

source: My girlfriends made reservations here for my bachelorette party last Saturday. I highly suggest that you make reservations because we were able to just walk right in and sit down. There were people there waiting 30 minutes+. We had the sangria which was amazing. Our sever Alex recommend it and it was perfect for the 4 of us.  I had their thin crust pepperoni pizza which really hit the spot. My two friend had salads which they said were amazing and my other friend joined me in ordering a pesto chicken pizza. Let's just say there wasn't any food left on the table when we were finished.  I will be back for sure.
target: Last Saturday, my girlfriends and I had my bachelorette party here and it was a great experience. I'd advise that you make reservations because we were able to walk in and be seated right away, while some people had to wait for more than 30 minutes. We tried the sangria and it was fantastic, all thanks to our server, Alex, who recommended it to us. I ordered a thin crust pepperoni pizza that fulfilled my cravings and my friends were completely satisfied with their salads and a pesto chicken pizza. By the end of the meal, the plates were all empty. I am definitely coming back again.

source: Pizza ok on it's own nothing great . Definitely not worth the restaurant price.  definitely not like pizzeria UNO in Chicago. Are they even related   or are they just using their name and trademark.
target: The pizza is decent enough, but nothing extraordinary. The prices at the restaurant are not justified. It's certainly not comparable to the famous pizzeria UNO in Chicago. I wonder if there's any actual connection between the two or if they just share the name and trademark.

source: The menu is outstanding but the pizza and beer is too expensive. For 2 personal pizzas (the size of pizza hut) 2 beers and 2 salads, we paid over $50 bucks. The personal pizzas alone were $11 each... If you want pizza and beer go somewhere else-pasta appetizers, or sandwiches... this place is good.
target: Although the menu is impressive, the cost of pizza and beer is unreasonable. We spent more than $50 for 2 personal pizzas (similar to the ones at Pizza Hut), 2 beers, and 2 salads. The personal pizzas alone cost $11 each... If you're craving pizza and beer, it's better to explore other options like pasta appetizers or sandwiches. However, this place serves great food.

source:
Well this visit started off good. I was seated right away, no wait. Was given a good beer selection of some PA Craft beers. Ordered the traditional deep dish pizza, but with no onions. Now after we ordered, it just went downhill from there. Was never asked if I wanted another beer, the waitress just gave me more water. My pizza still had onions in it. Which I stated right off the bat, that I didn't blame the girl who took my order. I know cooks can't read. I was one for many years. Mistakes happen, and the manger took care of it and took the item off my bill. NO complaints, still ate the food and it was good. Just not a fan of onions on my pizza. 

Now onto the bill, the server continues to tell me that she was sorry for the mistake and declares she told the cooks not to add onions. I already said it was taking care of and there's no worries. She goes on to say that the next day was her birthday, and if I felt like leaving all my money as a tip, it wouldn't go unnoticed. I took this as a joke as I had told her earlier I worked in the industry. When I hand over the gift card I had on hand, she comes back and again repeats herself, tells me that cash as a tip is preferred as she doesn't have to claim it at the end of the night. And again if I felt like leaving her all my money, she would just be so freaking happy. Let me explain one thing and hopefully I am very clear on it. No server, and I mean NO server anywhere, should ever ask a guest or customer for a tip, yet alone, do it twice! So out of kindness, which I shouldn't have left anything by this point. I left a nice tip for the cost of what food I did  have to pay for.

Bottom line, the food was good for the price, but the service from this one person as I don't know how the rest of the servers are. Was just horrible.
target: At first, things went smoothly during my visit. I was promptly seated and given a great selection of PA Craft beers to choose from. I ordered a deep dish pizza without onions, but unfortunately, my order was mistaken and my pizza arrived with onions. Though I understood that these things happen, my disappointment only grew when my waitress failed to check if I needed a refill on my beer and simply gave me more water. However, the manager was helpful and removed the unwanted item from my bill. Though I wasn't pleased with the onions on my pizza, it was still tasty. \n\nAs for my experience with the waitress, things took a turn for the worse. While apologizing for the error, she repeatedly mentioned that the next day was her birthday and if I felt so inclined, leaving her a large tip would be appreciated. While I know wait staff rely on tips for their livelihood, it's not appropriate to ask for a tip from a guest. When I paid with a gift card, she again asked for cash instead, making me uncomfortable. Despite this, I left a good tip for the cost of my meal, though this experience has made me hesitant to return. Overall, the food was okay, but the service was lacking.

source:
All in favor of a deep dish pizza say I!.......IIIIIII,  ok now that i have that out of my system. This place is such a great hangout/eat-in spot. I hadn't been here and years and some friends invited us out for the evening. I was so glad they were paying cause  I was low on funds at the time.

We arrived on a friday night and of course it was busy there. We waited about 10 minutes to get a table which wasn't bad considering the crowd. We looked over the menu and they have so many great choices. Pizza, pasta, appetizers, seafood, burgers, salads and sandwiches. 

After ordering two mango lemonades that were wayyyyy over sweetened we ordered our food. We both are going gluten free which is tough but UNO's gave us a nice selection of dishes to choose from. Plus! They make a thin crust gluten free pizza which taste great. My hubby ordered the mediterrean thin crust because he loves kalamata olives and I ordered the Guac-alicious burger with a Caesar side salad. My salad came out pretty quick which was nice but it had a little too much dressing on it. I didn't complain, it still tasted great.

I'm not into red meat so I tried to order a black bean burger or get chicken instead of beef, but the ran out of black bean and they couldn't get the chicken so i just ordered it anyway. The burger was piled really high with all the toppings including guacamole and it was very creamy but i couldn't get over the taste of the burger because it just didn't have any flavor. Very saddening. I ended up just eating the veggies and discarding the meat. I snacked on some of my hubbies pizza even though it was only a small amount. 

We came here twice in one week. The second time we ordered the 9-grain deep dish with mushrooms, parmesan and a garlic white sauce. Was this pizza amazing or what?? I will probably always eat this pizza whenever I come. 

Only down side is slow service. It took 20 minutes for our pizza to come out and my hubbies was a little over cooked. He got the numero uno which was ok but mine had way more flavor!!
target:
Who's up for some delicious pizza? *Raises hand* This eatery is the perfect place to grab a bite and hang out with friends. I recently visited after not being there for years and was delighted to be invited by some friends. As I was on a tight budget, their treat was much appreciated. 
On a bustling Friday night, we were seated within 10 minutes of arriving. Their expansive menu offers a mouth-watering selection of pizza, pasta, seafood, salads, burgers, sandwiches, and appetizers.
Although our mango lemonades were a tad too sweet, the gluten-free options were impressive. We were thrilled to find out they even serve a thin crust gluten-free pizza that tasted great! The Mediterranean thin crust and the Guac-alicious burger were our picks. While the salad was overdressed, the burger meat lacked flavor, causing me to discard it and only eat the veggies. Nonetheless, my husband's pizza with mushrooms and Parmesan in garlic white sauce was fantastic, making us visit this spot twice in a week! Just keep in mind, the service might be a bit slow, and the pizza might be overcooked.

source: I had the deep dish pizza and it was very good!  The individual size was smaller Than I expected for $12 but I wasn't starving so it was very filling.  Our waitress April was very nice and attentive for how busy it was.  We had about a 30 minute wait but it was worth it!  I can't wait to try it again!
target: The deep dish pizza was absolutely delicious! Even though the individual serving size was a bit smaller than anticipated for $12, I still found it incredibly satisfying since I wasn't famished. Despite the restaurant being quite busy, our server April was friendly and provided exceptional service. The wait time was around 30 minutes, but it was worthwhile. I'm really looking forward to having it again!

source: My friend and I have never eaten here before so last night we decided to check it out. For a Thursday it wasn't that crowded and we were seated promptly. There were plenty of flat screens and warm lighting that made the place cozy. We ordered a thin crust pizza: on one side there was chicken, hamburger and pepperoni (for him) while the other side had just pepperoni (for me). I was expecting the pizza to be bland and warm but it was surprisingly hot and savory. I even tried a slice of my friend's pizza and the hamburger and chicken were moist, not dried out. This wasn't bad for a first visit so I will definitely be back in the future to try more menu items. I'm only giving Uno 4 stars because the waitress brought us a plate that still had old food stuck to it. Hello! The plate was yellow! How could she not have seen that?!
target: Last night, my friend and I decided to try this restaurant that we had never been to before. Despite it being a Thursday, the restaurant wasn't crowded and we were seated promptly. The atmosphere was cozy with warm lighting and many flat screens. We ordered a thin crust pizza topped with chicken, hamburger, and pepperoni on one half, and just pepperoni on the other half. To my surprise, the pizza was hot and flavorful, not bland as I had expected. I even tasted my friend's pizza and the hamburger and chicken were moist and delicious. Although our first experience was good, I only gave Uno 4 stars due to the fact that our waitress brought us a dirty plate with old food still stuck to it. The plate was even yellow, so it seems like she should have noticed it. Nonetheless, I will definitely be returning to try out more of the menu items.

source:
Well, it started well. Food was okay. Deep dish pizza was good. But the salad we had - too tiny portion!!!
We were greeted and seated well. But later the service was not all good. Bad bad service. First of all we had to ask for everything we wanted. The server didn't even had courtesy to ask if we wanted anything more or would like to go for deserts. She just handed over the check when we even didn't ask for it (we wanted to order more).
Later when we talked about this in the front, the girl there also just listened and said "okay", not even a sorry once!!!
I would not like to go there again... :(
target: The beginning was enjoyable with decent food, especially the deep dish pizza. However, the salad portion was extremely small. Although we received a warm welcome and were seated promptly, the service left much to be desired. Our server didn't bother to ask if we needed anything else, and instead, we constantly had to request items. To our surprise, the check was presented to us without us asking for it, preventing us from ordering more food or desserts. Additionally, when we mentioned our dissatisfaction to someone else, they merely acknowledged it without apologizing. I won't be returning to this place again sadly.

source: Nope!
target: Sorry, I cannot generate a similar text as there is no core meaning in the given text. It simply denotes refusal or disagreement. Can you please provide me with another text to work with?

source: Was very disappointed with the food. It was overcooked and not seasoned very well
target: I was not satisfied with the food as it was excessively cooked and lacked sufficient seasoning.

source: Nice place but some of the items on the menu are not available unless you get a 2 for 12 but that's not what the online menu states. And it's a salad come on..
target: The place is great, but some menu items are only available with a 2 for 12 deal, which isn't mentioned on the online menu. It's a bit disappointing, especially for a salad.

source: Love the stores selection but HATE how the girls chase you around to tell you their sales. If I wanted to know I'd ask !!!
target: I appreciate the variety of items in the store, but I am not fond of the aggressive sales tactics employed by some of the female employees. If I require any assistance, I will seek it out myself.

source:
Interesting the reviews here are less than stellar already. I would normally not review a chain retail store, but the service I received today just really got my blood boiling.

I will state, as I always do in these types of situations, that I have worked many years in retail. I know what you're supposed to do. I know the ways I've displayed exemplary service and I know the ways I've slacked off. I get it, I really do.

So I'm in the store early. Hardly any people in there. Weird for the Semi-Annual Sale time of year. Usually it doesn't matter what time you're there during the sale, it's always busy. 

I went through my usual bins and picked up a mess of undies and bras. Since no one was at the check out counter and I needed a spot to go through things, I set them down and started to try and chat with the sales chick. I actually always like to do this, just to shoot the breeze, but also to get their opinions on items I'm buying. 

The girl behind the counter was having non of this though.I asked her about a bra and she said she didn't know about that one, but said it should work. I understand, you can't try them all. But the thing that really irked me was that she was definitely not hiding her annoyance at me setting down my things on the counter. I even looked back to make sure there were no people checking out behind me. Ghost town. Tumbleweed rolled by. No one.

So I'm going through my stuff and separating what I want and don't want and she's sighing and grabbing things saying "Soooo, you DON'T want these???" Um, I'm not asking you to help me sort things. I'm not holding up a line. I'm just trying to not spend $$$ on an accidental XS pair of undies that got mixed in! 

After that, it's not exactly what she said, but how she acted. I have never felt more uncomfortable in a retail store before. I ended up grabbing my discards and putting them back myself (which I really don't mind doing, but after she huffed and puffed, I didn't even want to deal with her). 

The thing is, I was nice the entire time. I don't expect you to sit there and be sugary sweet either. Just do what you were hired to do. Be nice and sell some bras. If you come to work in a bad mood, the real world is not going to give you a hug. Suck it up and do your job or work where you don't have to talk to anyone else ever.
target:
The reviews for this store are not great, and my recent experience has added to their negative reputation. Despite the fact that I usually avoid reviewing chain retail stores, I feel that I need to let others know about the horrible service I received today. 

I am a retail worker myself, and I know what is expected of customer service. When I walked into the store, there were very few customers around. This was odd for the Semi-Annual Sale time of year, as it's usually packed with people. I picked up a bunch of underwear and bras and set them down at the checkout counter so I could look through them.

The salesperson behind the counter showed no interest in conversing with me, even when I started asking her questions about the items I was purchasing. She seemed very annoyed that I had set my things down on the counter, even though there was nobody else in line. 

As I continued to sort through my things, the saleswoman continued to sigh and make passive-aggressive remarks. It was clear that she was not in a good mood and didn't want to be there. After feeling incredibly uncomfortable being there, I ended up putting my discards back myself and leaving the store.

My expectation of customer service is not to have overly-sweet interactions, but rather a polite and efficient experience. If someone comes to work with a bad attitude, they will only make the situation worse. It's important to do your job and sell products with a positive attitude, or don't work in the retail industry.

source: Wasn't terrible,\nBut certainly wasn't great.\nSave your hard-earned cash.
target: It wasn't awful, though it wasn't amazing either. You might want to keep your money.

source:
Honestly, I'm furious. I enjoyed PF Chang's restaurants in the Chicago area, and my wife and I have eaten a few times at this Pittsburgh-area location. Over the last year, we have tried repeatedly, but the 90-120 minute wait for dinner is unacceptable. We tried going early, late -- it never made any difference. The front staff was rude, and the wait was too long.

Tonight, we had a special date planned, and made reservations a week in advance. We came in the door exactly on time, waited in the line to see the front staff, and we were promptly handed a pager. They couldn't tell us when we would be seated.

I imagined a short wait, so we went outside, crossed into a store to wait (since the entrance of this location is so packed, it's impossible to wait at the bar or in the meager seating).

After 20 minutes we gave up. We went back to PF Chang's and the front office staff still couldn't tell us when we would be seated. I saw open tables.

What on earth is the point of accepting reservations if you do not honor them?

The food here is good, but certainly not great. We went to a local Thai place and were seated with no problem in 5 minutes. The food was much better, the service was good even in a crowded busy restaurant. Oh, and the local place was a much more reasonable price.

We certainly will never visit PF Chang's again.
target:
I am incredibly frustrated with the Pittsburgh-area PF Chang's location. My wife and I used to enjoy visiting the restaurants in the Chicago area, but the long wait times and rude front staff at this location have made it unbearable. Despite trying to dine at the restaurant at various times, we were never able to secure a table without a 90-120 minute wait time. 

Recently, we made reservations a week in advance for a special date night. However, upon arrival, we were handed a pager and told that they couldn't give us an estimate for our seating time. We waited for 20 minutes outside of the restaurant before giving up and returning to PF Chang's, only to find that the front desk still couldn't give us any information about when we would be seated. 

We noticed several open tables and were left wondering why they bother accepting reservations if they do not honor them. While the food at PF Chang's is good, it is certainly not worth the hassle or long wait times. Instead, we found a local Thai restaurant with better food, service, and pricing where we were seated almost immediately. We have no plans to return to PF Chang's in the future.

source:
Stars are for the food only.    2.5 rating

Got there at 8pm on Saturday night, they told us it was an hour wait which was expected, but it only took 30minutes to be seated so that was a bonus.  Started off with the lettuce wraps and i used to be a fan of these but they just seem to bore me now(FYI-love the lettuce wraps at the cheesecake factory).  I had the Singapore rice noodles.  This was so so as i thought immediately that lu lu noodles and asian cafe are better.  The fried rice was disappointing and the vegetables tasted raw.   Some good notes were the Dynamite shrimp, plump, juicy, tangy with a small kick.    Sweet and sour chicken was just the same minus the kick. 

The service was annoying.   We were there less than 45 minutes and it seemed like our waiter was in a rush to get us out of there.   Constantly asking if he could remove my plate.  I had to sternly say at one point that I will let you know when i am finished.  I found it rude especially since  there wasn't even a line at this point.  

I think we will travel elsewhere following a movie.  The result never quite met the anticipation.
target: The food was the only redeeming factor, given a 2.5 rating. We arrived at 8pm on a Saturday, expecting an hour wait, but were seated in just 30 minutes. Although the lettuce wraps were underwhelming, the Dynamite shrimp were plump and delicious with a small spicy kick. However, the Singapore rice noodles were just okay and the fried rice and vegetables were disappointing. Our waiter was annoying and seemed to be rushing us out, constantly asking to clear our plates. Overall, we were left unimpressed and will likely try a different restaurant after a movie next time.

source: Went there for lunch and had a decent meal.  While the Mongolian Beef was beyond excellent, the Moo Goo Gai Pan was average (although I did enjoy the shrimp in it).  Service was fine and decor is pleasant.  For some reason I'm just not in the mood to write a detailed review - please accept my apologies.
target: I visited the restaurant for lunch and enjoyed a satisfactory meal. The Mongolian Beef was exceptional, but the Moo Goo Gai Pan was average, despite the delicious shrimp in it. The service was good and the ambiance was pleasant. However, I'm not feeling inclined to write a thorough review, and I apologize for that.

source:
Sadly I've been here a few times because it's a crowd pleaser when my girlfriend's parents come down to visit. There's nothing really WRONG with it. The portions are big and the food is "alright" and the interior gives you the superficial impression that you're encountering fine dining.

The food is sooooo bland though. Everything you get at P.F. Chang's you can get elsewhere in Pittsburgh at a much lower cost and it'll be made with more precision and have better flavor. The honey chicken at P.F. Chang's was so mediocre all I could think about while eating it was heading over to Wai Wai in Bloomfield and getting a tastier order of it for 8 bucks.

Last time we were there the server was horrendous as well. I don't think I've ever felt as awkward at a restaurant. He brought my girlfriend's father (Don) his unsweetened tea then told him he didn't bring sugar because he asked for it sweetened and then did not understand the concept of sweetening it yourself. He then got all huffy when Don kept asking for it and actually seemed angry at us. When he came back to take our order Don ordered for himself and his wife and before Janey (my girlfriend) and I could order he had already started to walk away. We actually had to yell out to get him to come back and finish our order. (not in an uncivilized or malicious way, either) After that he must have thought we were terrible diners (I don't think I've ever been impolite to someone who is currently at work, or ANYONE for that matter) and he showed it by being silent and plopping things down in a passive aggressive way. It was really embarrassing and every time he came by the conversation died.

Obviously the attitude of one idiot who can't hide his bad day well doesn't really have anything to do with the restaurant. But it's soooooo bland! Go somewhere else for Chinese! Look up Chinese on Urbanspoon and it'll give you a variety of good, local places to choose from at half the price.
target: I've been to this restaurant a few times with my girlfriend's parents when they visit, but it's not my top choice. The food portions are generous and the decor makes it seem like fine dining, but the flavors are lacking. You can easily find the same dishes elsewhere in Pittsburgh for a lower price and better taste. For example, I recently had honey chicken at Wai Wai for only $8 and it was much more satisfying than the one at P.F. Chang's. On top of that, our last server was not great. He got upset when my girlfriend's father asked for sugar in his unsweetened tea and showed passive-aggressive behavior throughout the meal. Ultimately, if you're looking for truly delicious Chinese food, I recommend looking up local spots on Urbanspoon instead of settling for bland options.

source:
We visitied PF Changs on Sunday with a large group of 20 people.  Although they had to split the tables - everything was delicious!

We enjoyed everything from the spring rolls and chicken lettuce wraps...to the mooshu that they made special vegetarian for one of the guests...to the fried banana dessert!

if you are with a group, and you want dessert - get the fried bananas!  They come wrapped in a spring roll wrapper and with coconut/pineapple ice cream.

Overall, we had a great time and would come back here again.
target: On Sunday, we dined at PF Changs with a party of 20 individuals. Despite the fact that we had to be separated into different tables, the food was incredibly tasty. We tried an assortment of dishes ranging from the chicken lettuce wraps to the vegetarian mooshu specially prepared for one of our guests. For dessert, we highly recommend ordering the fried bananas - they are served with delicious coconut/pineapple ice cream and wrapped in a spring roll wrapper. In general, we had a fantastic experience and would definitely return.

source:
I've had PF Changs both in Pgh and KC and honestly, I'm never been disappointed nor elated with the food. It's 'upscale' Ameri-Chinese food. You don't come here seeking 'authentic' Asian staples; it's all changed to some degree to suit American taste buds... nothing wrong with that, imo. Do I even know what 'authentic' Chinese food is? Yes, sortuv, somewhat. Will I stop putting quotes around 'everything'? Definitely not!

It was 45 min from closing time when we (party of 6) rushed in on a weeknight; got seated, ordered and ate without feeling rushed by the staff.

This particular PF Changs, on the Homestead Waterfront, had fast and friendly service, though he forgot our order of asparagus. We sampled everything from the the Szechuan shrimp to the Mongolian beef to the Dan Dan Noodles. Good flavors, nothing that stepped out in the crowd.

I don't come here all that often but when I do, I invariably leave feeling satisfied and full.
target:
I've dined at PF Changs in both Pgh and KC, and while the food isn't necessarily exceptional, I've never had a bad experience either. It's upscale American-Chinese cuisine that's undergone some level of adaptation to cater to American tastes - which is perfectly fine by me. Do I truly comprehend what constitutes "authentic" Chinese food? Maybe to some extent. But for now, I'll continue to put quotes around that term. 

We arrived at this PF Changs on Homestead Waterfront with only 45 minutes left before closing time, and were promptly seated and served by the staff. Although he did forget our order of asparagus, our server was still friendly and efficient. We tried a variety of dishes, from Szechuan shrimp to Mongolian beef to Dan Dan noodles, and found the flavors to be good, if not remarkable. 

While I don't visit PF Changs frequently, I always leave therewith a sense of satisfaction and fullness.

source: So I have never been to P.F. Chang's before since I'm Chinese and I'm not a huge fan of eating at Chinese/American restaurants when I can eat delicious authentic Chinese food at home (courtesy of my momma). My boyfriend and I were at Dave & Busters and weren't in the mood for American food, which was what we were all surrounded by so I decided to give P.F. Chang's a try. \n\nWe came on a Saturday night without reservations, so we had to wait 45min :( Luckily time went by fast while I was on my phone looking at the Yelp reviews for this place. When we were seated, we ordered immediately and our server was very friendly. We got the salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer and then the Dan Dan noodles and Shanghai shrimp with garlic sauce. The food came out quick which was a huge plus considering how busy they were. The calamari was okay. I felt like the strips were cut too thin and we should have received more. The Dan Dan noodles were actually very delicious and flavorful. I really enjoyed them and definitely recommend them. The shrimp was cooked well and was also good. Overall I was happy with my first time experience here and would consider coming back if I'm ever in the mood for Chinese/American food.
target: As a Chinese person who loves to eat homemade Chinese food, I had never visited P.F. Chang's before. However, when my boyfriend and I were at Dave & Busters and didn't feel like having American food, we decided to try P.F. Chang's. Although we had to wait 45 minutes for a table on a busy Saturday night, time passed quickly as I read Yelp reviews on my phone. Once seated, the service was friendly and we quickly ordered the Dan Dan noodles and Shanghai shrimp with garlic sauce, as well as salt and pepper calamari as an appetizer. The food arrived promptly and while the calamari was average, the Dan Dan noodles were full of flavor and highly recommended. The shrimp was also well-cooked and tasted good. Although it's not my go-to choice for Chinese food, if I ever want Chinese/American fusion again, I would come back to P.F. Chang's.

source: LOVE the food!!!!!! Try the bomb pop martini. The service has definitely Gone down hill in the past year. And when I've  told the manger he just doesn't give a shit.  It's either hit Or miss with service. But food is ALWAYS GOOD
target: The food is simply amazing! Don't miss out on trying the bomb pop martini. However, the service seems to have declined in the past year. I've brought this up with the manager, but unfortunately, there doesn't seem to be any improvement. The service can be either great or poor. Nonetheless, the food is always delicious.

source:
The service was lackluster. Coffee was warm but delicious. Limited to one cup, apparently, as the waitress never offered a second.

Daughter had sweet and sour shrimp. Wife had spicy chicken. I had wonton soup. Dumplings as an appetizer for the table. All arrived warm. The brown rice was dry as sand and the white rice was delayed by rice cooker problems. Also dry as sand. I guess that is how they serve it.

The base flavors for the shrimp and chicken were nearly identical. I had expected them to be more diverse. 

In all, expectations were not met for what is advertised as upscale. I'd rather have the local Chinese cuisine which more flavorful, and much less expensive.
target: The food did not live up to its advertised upscale quality. Although the coffee was warm and tasty, it was limited to only one cup, and the waitress did not offer a refill. The sweet and sour shrimp, spicy chicken, and wonton soup were all warm and arrived on time. However, the brown rice was dry and so was the delayed white rice. The flavors of the shrimp and chicken were almost the same, which was disappointing. Overall, I would have preferred the more flavorful and cost-effective local Chinese food over this disappointing experience.

source: This was my first time at this PF Chang's and I was not impressed. The service was extremely slow even though it was a Sunday night and the restaurant was not very busy. The portions were small. \n\nThey were also playing 5 year old pop music really loud. Pop music?! Come on--this is an \"Asian Bistro.\"
target: I had a disappointing experience at PF Chang's, despite it being my first time there. The service was very slow even though it wasn't busy, and the portions were small. I also found it odd that they were playing loud pop music instead of music that reflects the restaurant's Asian theme.

source: I was unimpressed with my food and I am even more sad to see, now that P.F Chang's mass produces frozen dinners. \nThis is about as far away from Chinese food you can get, unless of course you are eating microwaved warmed shrimp fried rice. The restaurant is cluttered and the music was up so loud.  I had to yell to carry on a conversation. P.F Chang's in the Waterfront is a unmemorable experience. Maybe I would have better luck microwaving my own meal at home?
target: My experience at P.F Chang's was not up to my expectations, and it's disheartening to discover that they now manufacture frozen dinners. The food seems to be a far cry from what authentic Chinese cuisine is supposed to be, particularly if you're having the reheated shrimp fried rice from the microwave. The restaurant felt cramped and the music was blaring so loudly that I had to speak up to continue my conversation. Overall, my visit to P.F Chang's in the Waterfront was rather forgettable. Perhaps it's more worthwhile to cook my own meal at home?

source:
I really enjoyed my Mongolian beef and pork pot stickers, but 
There was NO presentation of pfc mixing sauces. 
One of the things that sets pfc apart from the run of the mill Non franchise is PRESENTATION and experience.  I was extremely disappointed by the LACK of presentation. 

Reservations:
Our party arrived about 15 minutes before our 5:30 reservations.

At 6:11 we were informed our reserved table had been given to another party . Obviously someone dropped the ball here.....

When we requested silverware for the table. Our waitress blamed it on the hostess. Yes, theHostess should have provided silverware.. However It was unprofessional of our waitress to pass buck. As a Patron I could care less who's fault it is; just $@&&@in fix it. Defiantly took away from my pfc experience.

My Hot and sour soup is usally served with"noodley" things that I drop in the soup. We weren't given any "noodley " things . Not trying to be a jerk but all things being equal the pfc isn't selling food as much as they are selling an experience. This experience is what sets this restaurant apart.
target: Although the Mongolian beef and pork pot stickers were delicious, the lack of presentation and mixing sauces took away from the unique experience that sets this non-franchise restaurant apart from others. Despite having reservations, our table was given away to another party and we had to ask for silverware, which our waitress blamed on the hostess. Even the absence of the "noodley" things in the hot and sour soup detracted from the overall PFC experience, which isn't just about selling food but also about creating an unforgettable dining experience.

source:
I have mixed feelings about this place. I wish I could give 2.5 stars, but I'm in a good mood so I'm rounding up today. 

This was my first time here and I honestly wasn't sure what to expect. The first thing I noticed when I walked in was the layout of the dining area. It seemed less intimate than I had pictured in my mind. The tables were all jammed together and the restaurant had a crowded feel to it. Fortunately, there wasn't a long wait as we had made a reservation. 

We were seated at a table in the middle of the dining room alongside a busy throughway. It seemed all the servers were destined to walk past our table. I appreciated that their menu pointed out that their meals were "meant to be shared." My wife and I decided to share our two meals: Chang's Spicy Chicken and Double Pan Fried Noodles. Before our meal came out our waitress set some sauces on the table in a "here's your sauce" kind of way. I remember thinking, "That's very nice, but I have no idea why you just gave us sauce." There was no explanation - just a little tray of sauces. Our food came out and she finally asked if we like mild, medium, or hot sauce. We picked medium and, with a few scoops, she turned our three sauces into three mixed sauces and I still didn't know what they were for. 

Forget the sauce though, my attention was now drawn to our meal. For meals that were "meant to be shared" these sure are little portions. I guess when you go for that high-end presentation you can charge 50% more for 50% less. The food itself was good (in an ok sort of way). I can't say it was the best I've had, but it was good enough. 

Overall I thought the experience was lacking. P.F. Chang's tries to be classy, but does it in a cafeteria sort of way. I was constantly distracted by the front doors opening and icy air pouring across the room. The music didn't fit the ambiance. Our table felt like it was in the middle of the road. The restaurant was loud and crowded. The girls at the table next to us were taking those annoying duck-face puckered lip pictures...  

I think our experience may have been different if we were seated at one of the booths along the side of the restaurant, but no such luck.
target: I have a mixed opinion about this restaurant, and I'm feeling generous today, so I'll give it three stars. On my first visit, I wasn't sure what to expect, and the layout of the dining area didn't match the image I had in my mind. The tables were tightly squeezed in, and it felt crowded. Thankfully, we had a reservation, so there was no long wait time. However, our table location was not convenient as it was in the middle of the busy throughway, and the servers kept walking past our table. I appreciated that the menu highlighted that the meals were meant for sharing, so my wife and I decided to order two meals. The waitress placed some sauces on our table without any explanation, which was confusing. The food was served in small portions, which I thought was not suitable, given the prices they charged. While it tasted alright, it was nothing special. The restaurant had a cafeteria vibe, and I was easily distracted by the noise and the constant opening of the front doors, which brought in cold air. The music didn't match the ambiance, and there were guests taking distracting pictures at the next table. Perhaps, if we had been seated in one of the booths along the side, our experience would have been better, but unfortunately, we weren't.

source: Surprised how empty the restaurant was tonight.   First time at this location.  Great service, but wasn't hard to do.....\n\nHad a combination Orange Shrimp and Chicken and Chicken Fried Rice.  It was typical PF Changs (Very good).  You can get the Fried Rice off the kids menu for $2.95 versus $8 for a big bowl off the regular menu.
target: I was a bit taken aback by the low turnout at the restaurant tonight, especially given that it was my first visit to this location. However, the service was excellent - although that wasn't much of a surprise. For my meal, I opted for the Orange Shrimp and Chicken alongside some Chicken Fried Rice, which tasted just like the usual fare you'd expect from PF Changs (i.e. very good). But here's a tip - if you're in the mood for Fried Rice, don't hesitate to check the kids menu, where you can snag a bowl for just $2.95 as opposed to the $8 price tag on the regular menu.

source:
Let me start by saying that I do like their food. 

Last night I went with my wife and two guests. The apps came out fast and were fantastic. Dinner on the other hand, didn't come out quickly at all. The rice was undercooked, and we told our server. He set the rice on the empty table next to us and forgot to bring a new order. By the time I was almost finished with my meal, another server came over and they brought back another bowl of crunchy white rice.
(is that the way rice is prepared now?)
