I ordered the chocolate cake. I asked for a container to take half home. The server brought out a small container and when I asked for a larger one, she said we can just squeeze it in there, and started to flatten the cake. She then realized that a larger one would be better.

4 people, not crowded...2 hours total.
target:
I should mention that I enjoy the food at this restaurant. 

Yesterday, my wife and I went with two friends. The appetizers arrived very quickly and were exceptional. However, the main course took a long time to come out, and the rice was not cooked properly. We informed our waiter about the issue, and he placed the rice on the unoccupied table next to ours and failed to bring us a new order. By the time I was almost done with my food, another waiter arrived, and a new bowl of crispy white rice was returned. 

I ordered the chocolate cake and requested a container to take half home. The server brought a small container and when I asked for a larger one, she initially suggested squeezing it in before realizing a larger container would be more appropriate. 

There were four of us in the restaurant, and it wasn't busy, but the meal took two hours in total.

source: ok so i've eaten here more than once but just thought to write a review on it. now, i'll be honest this is the only one i've ever been to, so i don't know if they're all the same but every time i'm underwhelmed. i get there, look at their giant selection and get excited. then i get my meal and remember that i've never had anything too great. don't get me wrong, it's not bad, but for how much they charge, they really need to step it up or at least give me a huge portion. just saying...
target: I've dined at this restaurant a few times now and felt inclined to share my thoughts. Though I haven't visited any other locations, my experience has been consistently underwhelming. Despite their extensive menu, I've never had a dish that truly stood out. While the food isn't terrible, the high prices warrant a more impressive dining experience or at least larger portions. Just my opinion.

source: Our last few visits have left something to desire, One of the things I always notice is the demeanor of an establishments employees. These people look miserable, no one smiles or greets you appropriately, it's more like get in, get out, turn the tables,\n\nThe food has remained consistently good... when we can order it. the last time JB and I came for a quick dinner, the place was not busy yet we were passed by 6 frowning waitstaff without getting drinks... for 15 minutes we were left suiting at our table with our menus closed and sitting on the edge of the table (HINT, HINT) so we left and most likely will not be returning.
target: During our recent visits, I've noticed a recurring issue with the employees at the establishment. They seem unhappy and fail to greet guests with a warm welcome. Instead, they rush to turn over tables, making it feel like customers are just another item on their to-do list. The food, on the other hand, is consistently good, but unfortunately, the last time JB and I dined there, we were ignored by multiple waitstaff for over 15 minutes despite the restaurant being quiet. We eventually had to leave without being served, and this experience has likely deterred us from returning.

source: If you look at other reviews you will see that I am a very positive person, but tonight was an utter disaster!!  We sat at the bar and the female bartender  was miserable. We ordered drinks and she was unhappy that we did.  She spent 20 minutes sending text messages and took 3 smoke brakes in one hour while our drinks were empty. We ordered appetizers and they never came out.  She actually brought us our check and we never got our food. By the way we were the only people at the bar.  Finally a bus boy brought us our food after we payed. We payed before our food came because we thought our table was ready. We finally got seated by the windows. Do not sit by the windows because it was very cold. We ordered our dinner and drinks and guess what no drinks. After our food came we asked about our drinks and the waiter said he forgot. Nothing was comped and no manager was available. This PF Changs needs new management!! We will never return. I will give it 2 stars because the food was great, but the employees are absolutely miserably from hostess to waiters to bartenders. Steer clear until changes are made. It's not worth the headache.
target: Although I normally provide positive reviews, my recent experience was quite the opposite. We sat at the bar, but our female bartender seemed unhappy about our presence from the start. In addition to taking 3 breaks for smoking, she spent 20 minutes texting on her phone, neglecting our empty drinks. We ordered appetizers that never came, and even received our check before our food arrived. Despite being the only ones at the bar, our meal did not go smoothly. We eventually sat by the window, but found it to be uncomfortably cold. Unfortunately, our drinks were forgotten even after we ordered them. No efforts were made to compensate for the poor service, and we were unable to speak with a manager. The food was good, earning it two stars, but the unpleasant behavior of the entire staff, from hostess to bartender was unwelcome. I recommend staying clear of this PF Changs until improvements are made.

source: A big thank you to Chad Cynamom, manager at PF Chang's for making our anniversary night so special.  He seated us, brought us drinks and told us about the menu.  Every time my fiance and I go to this PF Chang's, we get the best service.  Food isn't the most authentic chinese food we've ever had, hence the 4 stars.  It is a bit overpriced as well, but the service makes up for it.
target: We would like to extend our heartfelt appreciation to Chad Cynamom, the manager at PF Chang's, for giving us a wonderful evening on our anniversary. From seating us to explaining the menu, he tended to us with immense care. Visiting this restaurant has always been a delightful experience for my partner and me as we receive top-notch service every time. Although the food is not the most authentic Chinese cuisine we have tasted, earning four stars, it is slightly expensive. Nevertheless, the excellent service compensates for it.

source: Walked in tonight, Wednesday, at 9:50, the place was empty. Asked for a table, the hostess told us one moment when she finds one for us, then proceeded to walk to a dirty table and clean it!  The phone rang and she answered it as we stood at the door. When she hung up the phone she walked back to the table and proceeded to clean it again!!  Didn't say a word to us. Unbelievable!  Will not be back there-- rude hostess!
target: Arrived on Wednesday night at 9:50, but found the restaurant completely empty. Requested a table from the hostess, who responded that she would find one for us soon. While we waited at the entrance, she attended to a dirty table and took a telephone call. After the call, the hostess returned to the table and resumed cleaning it. Unfortunately, she did not acknowledge our presence or offer any explanation for the delay. We were very disappointed with the rudeness of the hostess and have no plans to return.

source: Good quality pork fried dumpling and mongo beef.  Bar service was fast and Efficent.   Good value.  Not a 5 cause dragon eye tea was cold first time around and beef had minor amount of fat.   Fortune was even Postive!
target: The fried pork dumplings and beef with mongo were of excellent quality, and the bar service was prompt and effective. The overall value was good, though it falls short of being a perfect experience due to the dragon eye tea being served cold on the first try and the beef having a small amount of fat. However, the fortunes received were positive.

source: I seriously don't know why people love this place so much, the food here is horrible. The rice is never cooked properly.. And it's not even Asian food. It's fake asian food. I never come here anymore.
target: I really can't understand why this restaurant is such a popular spot. The quality of the food is terrible, and the rice is always undercooked. To make matters worse, the cuisine is not even authentic Asian food, but a poor imitation. Needless to say, I haven't been back in ages.

source: We had another opportunity to eat here today and the experience was much improved. There was no crowd to fight and we weren't seated near the door as we were last time. As I expected, getting a table near the edge of the restaurant provides for a much nicer dining experience. Our service was good and they accommodated our 1 year old nicely. I appreciate that they serve steamed veggies on the kids menu. \n\nI still left with the impression that the serving sizes were small in comparison to most other places, but we were satisfied and happy.
target: We dined at this establishment again today and it was a much better experience than our last visit. We didn't have to battle a crowd and our table wasn't located near the entrance like last time. As expected, sitting at an edge table enhanced our dining experience. The service was good and our 1 year old was well taken care of. It was nice to see that they serve steamed vegetables on the kids menu. While I did find the serving sizes to be a bit small compared to other restaurants, we were content and pleased with our meal.

source: We went last night Saturday night to P.F.Chang located at the Kierlands in Scottsdale. Terrible Experience!!! after waiting over one hour to be seated, we ordered calamari for appetizer which came with a horrible strange salty sauce and salt and pepper mix on the side. then I ordered beef and broccoli and my husband ordered a vegetarian dish with peanut sauce . After a long wait my food came so salty that I could not even eat and as much as I hate to complain but I had to let the waiter know, so he went to get me one with less salt. My husband's dish was OK. then the second one was a bit less salty but the meat had a terrible liver kind of taste which totally turned my stomach. I feel the reason they added so much salt was to hide the bad tasting rotted meat. Very bad experience. Our waiter was kind and sympathetic. ruined my evening out :(
target: My recent visit to P.F. Chang's at the Kierlands in Scottsdale turned out to be quite disappointing. Despite waiting for an hour to get a table, our experience was far from what we expected. The calamari appetizer that we ordered was served with an odd tasting, salty sauce and a sprinkle of salt and pepper mix. When our main course arrived, my beef and broccoli were extremely salty, making it inedible, and the vegetarian dish ordered by my husband tasted average. Though the second serving of beef was somewhat better, it still had an unpleasant liver-like aftertaste. Perhaps, the excessive salt was added to conceal the unpalatable taste of the meat. Our waiter was courteous and understanding, but the unpleasant experience ruined our evening out.

source:
Let me start off by saying I have mostly simple tastes, and my favorite lunch spot for Chinese has been the New Dumpling House in Squirrel Hill. But since that restaurant is undergoing renovations, I was forced to try something new.

So... I thought I'd try the chain PF Chang's Chinese Restaurant at the Waterfront. Wow, what an unsatisfying mistake that turned out to be.

I started with a cup of their Wonton soup. At $2.95 it wasn't too outrageous of a price, the broth had some flavor and there was much more in it than I was used to, including three giant basil (I think?) leafs that covered everything beneath. In the broth were chunks of chicken, two shrimp, some sliced water chestnuts and two "pork"-filled wontons. As I said, the broth had decent flavor, but the wontons were thick, doughy and under-cooked, and the chicken chunks were dry, which is amazing since they were drowned in broth! On a scale of bad to good, it was kind of meh.

Next came my "lunch-portion" order of Chang's Kung Pao Chicken (the dinner portion is $5 more). 

At the New Dumpling House, this dish is served with a delectable dark, rich, tangy sauce, which I was really hoping for... Not at PF Chang's. 

On my plate I received about 8 quarter-size chunks of lightly breaded and browned chicken, 7 hot Chinese red chili peppers (mostly inedible unless they are diced into a sauce), a handful of blanched, unsalted peanuts, a few sliced scallions, and a bed of the most bland brown rice I have ever encountered. Uncle Ben would've been ashamed if that stuff came out of one of his boxes.

Glaringly, there was NO SAUCE!. None at all.

I've had Kung Pao Chicken in New York City, San Francisco, and even from a hole in the wall in Bethel Park, PA that was much, much better. Never have I had it served in such a bland, skimpy, and overpriced way! The "lunch-portion" cost was $9.95.

At The New Dumpling House, I could have a delicious lunch, with soup, entree and complimentary hot tea, and I could leave satisfied with just $8 out-of-pocket -- and that includes the tip.

The service was decent. However, lesson learned. One and done. Never going back to PF Changs.
target:
Although I usually stick to my tried-and-true Chinese spot, the New Dumpling House, I was forced to find a new lunch spot due to renovations. I decided to give the chain PF Chang's Chinese Restaurant a try at the Waterfront, but it turned out to be a disappointing mistake. 

The Wonton soup wasn't too pricey at $2.95 and had an adequate amount of broth and flavor, but the wontons were undercooked and doughy. The chicken chunks were also dry, which was surprising since they were in broth. Overall, the soup was just okay. 

For my entre, I ordered the lunch portion of Chang's Kung Pao Chicken. However, unlike the delicious dark tangy sauce I was used to at the New Dumpling House, PF Chang's version was bland and lacked any sauce at all. The meal was also overpriced at $9.95 and didn't have a lot of chicken or flavor. 

Comparatively, at the New Dumpling House, I could get a soup, entree, and hot tea all for just $8 with a satisfying meal. While the service at PF Chang's was decent, it wasn't enough to make up for the lackluster food. After this experience, I won't be returning to PF Chang's anytime soon.

source: This is the fourth Changs I've eat ate. It was pretty good. The food was kinda like it had been previously frozen. Had a strange texture. Some of the changs chicken pieces was stuck together and the breading on the sweet and sour chicken was mushy and falling off the chicken. Overall still pretty good. Would eat at this one again.
target: I have dined at this Changs for the fourth time, and it was satisfactory. The dishes seemed to have been frozen beforehand, resulting in a peculiar texture. The chicken pieces were clumped together, and the breading of the sweet and sour chicken was limp, falling away from the meat. Despite this, the restaurant was decent, and I would revisit it.

source: Our family loves this restaurant.  My children and I suffer from food allergies.   I have Celiac's Disease and their gluten free selection for a Chinese restaurant is great.  My children are a completely different ball game.  They have a rare disease called Eosinophilic Esophagitus where food attacks their body.  They are very limited on their food selctions due to not being able to consume any food with gluten, soy, eggs, dairy, nuts, tree nuts, fish, shellfish, amd corn.  This restaurant takes special care of my kids by making sure they get chicken that has not gone through the egg wash.  The servers and managers are all trained in how to be careful.  Our favorite manager is Joe and favorite server is Kevin.  Call ahead if you have any questions and they will answer your questions.
target: Our family has found an amazing restaurant that caters to our dietary needs. As someone with Celiac's Disease, I am always looking for restaurants with good gluten free options. This Chinese restaurant definitely delivers on that front. Meanwhile, my children face a unique challenge due to their Eosinophilic Esophagitus. They cannot eat anything with gluten, soy, eggs, dairy, nuts, tree nuts, fish, shellfish, or corn. However, the restaurant goes above and beyond in meeting their needs. They ensure that the chicken my kids eat has not been washed with egg and all the staff is highly trained to be careful. We especially love our manager Joe and waiter Kevin. If you have any questions, don't hesitate to call ahead and speak to their knowledgeable staff.

source:
This place hit the spot. 

Stopped here before a movie and ate at the bar. We got just what we wanted: quick service and some good eats. 

I recommend the fried green beans with aioli  -- soooo good! Who knew I liked green beans?! And this trip I tried some sushi and got the spicy tuna roll. Although it was clearly not pieced together by an expert sushi chef, it was extremely fresh and delish (so who cares if it's not beautiful?!)
target:
This spot was perfect. 

Before catching a movie, we decided to grab a bite at the bar. We were thrilled with the speedy service and the delicious food that we got. 

You have to try the fried green beans with aioli -- they were amazing! And, surprise, surprise, I even found out that I'm a fan of green beans! We decided to be adventurous and ordered some sushi this time around. Although it wasn't the prettiest presentation, the spicy tuna roll was incredibly fresh and oh so tasty (who needs beauty when you have flavor!).

source: Extremely helpful staff that knows exactly what shoes are comfortable yet stylish. The shoes I bought were high quality and durable. I was extremely impressed by the staff.
target: The staff was highly knowledgeable and assisted me in finding a pair of shoes that were both comfortable and fashionable. The footwear I purchased was top-notch and resilient. The staff left a lasting impression on me with their exceptional service.

source: I live close by so I go here frequently pretty much for the free WIFI and espresso. But here's a secret - they don't seem to know what an Americano is so often I am charged like 75 cents for a double shot of espresso to which they add hot water upon my request. Needless to say coffee is not expensive here as you can fill up as many times as needed without being hassled. Although there regular coffee is undrinkable to my taste. Pastries are baked fresh and are plentiful. There is other foods to choose from ie whole grain bagels are edible and about a buck with no extra charge for butta. Outside seating and people watching is always a good distraction plus there are all kinds of people who frequent this Panera from the very very old and decrepit to the fashionistas taking a break from Victoria Secrets, Ulta, Wet Seal and the other various shops at this water front location.
target: I visit this place often as it's nearby and provides free WIFI and espresso, but there's a secret to keep in mind. They aren't very familiar with Americano, so I usually ask for a double shot of espresso with hot water on the side, which is charged at only 75 cents. The coffee here is quite affordable and allows you to refill your cup as many times as you want. However, I don't enjoy their regular coffee due to my personal preference. They offer freshly baked pastries in abundance, and there's also a variety of food options available, like whole grain bagels, which cost around a buck and come with no additional butter charges. The outdoor seating arrangement is perfect for people watching and majorly attracts people of all ages, from elderly individuals to fashion enthusiasts, taking a break from nearby shops like Victoria Secrets, Ulta, or Wet Seal, found in this water-front location.

source: I've had bad experiences here a few times now.  I wrote panera bread and haven't heard back.  Bad service all around!!!  Basically, we ordered our food, they ran out of what we wanted, so just decided to make us something else with out telling us.  When we got our food, we asked why they made us that instead of what we ordered---'oh it was the closest to what you wanted'.....hmmmm how about you tell us that before we pay, and how about you give us our money back.  Really, you don't get much for what you pay for at panera.  Its not very good at all.
target: I have not had good experiences at Panera Bread lately. I reached out to their customer service but have yet to receive a response. The service was very poor as we ordered a specific item only to be told later that they were out and would substitute it with something else. Unfortunately, they failed to inform us of this change before we paid. The quality of the food was not up to par and for the price, it was quite disappointing.

source: I like Panera bread but this one is a so so. I always get my fuji chicken salad in every Panera bread I go. All of the other use spring mix to make their fuji chicken salad except this one.. They just use regular salad and salad doesn't taste or look very fresh either. I was kind of excited to find there is a panera bread around us but I am disappointed after trying it. Don't know if we will be back again.
target: Although I am a fan of Panera Bread, this particular location was just okay. My go-to order is always the fuji chicken salad, but at this restaurant, they didn't use the usual spring mix. Instead, they used regular salad which didn't look or taste very fresh. Initially, I was excited to see a Panera Bread near us, but after trying it out, I was disappointed. Unsure if we'll return.

source: Panera bread has to be the most inconsistent restaurant I have ever been to. I have posted two pictures of the strawberry poppyseed chicken salad. The first one looks delicious the second one looks like they could've used a smaller bowl. It did not even look appetizing.
target: In my experience, the quality of food at Panera bread varies greatly. I recently ordered the strawberry poppyseed chicken salad and while the first one I received looked great, the second one was presented poorly and didn't look very appetizing.

source:
The food was fine. It's a chain. I'm not rating it. 

The service was absolutely horrible. It started well enough when we ordered lunch, but ended horribly when my daughter said we should get a treat for my husband. 

Between being ignored by the girl at the counter, her not listening to the order, then arguing with me when I told her I did not ask for what she brought me, I really can't decide which is worse. I rather spend my money somewhere local where they appreciate my business, rather than take attitude from Panera employees.
target: The restaurant is part of a chain and the food was okay, but I won't give it a rating. However, the service was terrible. Even though we had a good start when we ordered lunch, everything fell apart when my daughter suggested we get a treat for my husband. The staff member at the counter completely ignored us and didn't listen to our order. To make matters worse, she argued with me when I pointed out that she had brought the wrong item. I would rather support a local establishment where my business is valued, rather than deal with the disrespectful attitude of Panera employees.

source:
It was my first time here.  Was recommended by my coworker.  However, I was a little unsure as I've read some bad reviews about this place.

The first visit was great.  The receptionists were helpful and gave me guidance on how to get my dog licensed.  Everyone seemed happy and talkative.  

Dr. Bezak was very nice.  He had a smile on him the entire time I was there.  He was very quick to give me information about anything and everything relating to the dog.  Overall, I had a good first visit and definitely going back.

The only thing that made it didn't earn a five-star is that my appointment is at 12:15pm.  The entire office have their lunch at 1pm.  So I can tell there was alot of hustle to get me out of their asap.  I don't mind that it was a quick visit, but I would have liked to had time to ask more questions.  If you want adequate time with the doc, consider making your appointment after their lunch.
target: Although I was hesitant due to the negative reviews, my coworker recommended this place for my first visit. I was pleasantly surprised by the helpfulness of the receptionists and their guidance on obtaining a dog license. The staff was friendly and Dr. Bezak was quick to provide information about my dog. Despite my appointment being during their lunchtime, the visit was quick and enjoyable. However, for those seeking more time with their doctor, scheduling an appointment after lunch might be a better option. Overall, I had a positive experience and will likely return.

source:
The problem I have this experience compared to my last is that the examination lasted 3 minutes.  The vet checked the ears, teeth, and nails then called it a day.  

I came home looked at his teeth and saw my pup had a "slab fracture"  which was still attached to the gum.  The vet didn't mentioned it during the "exam" other than telling me to buy a finger brush to brush his teeth.

I was primarily there for a vaccination shot but if they're going to charge me for a examination, they should do a proper examination.  I just felt I was rushed out of there. 

I took my dog to another vet where they told me about the slab fracture, gave me info on how it usually happens, potential problems that it can cause, and recommendations on ways to fix the problem.
target: Although I went to the vet for a vaccination shot, I felt like the examination was rushed and not thorough. The vet only checked my dog's ears, teeth, and nails, and then quickly ended it. However, when I got home, I noticed that my pup had a slab fracture on his teeth which the vet didn't mention during the exam. I believe that if the vet is going to charge for an examination, it should be done properly. So, I decided to take my dog to another vet who provided me with detailed information on the slab fracture and how to fix it.

source: I only allow my dogs to go to Dr. Bezak. I've had a couple Chow Chow's who a lot of vets are afraid of. Doc had a Chow himself so knew what to look out for in the breed. He has taken good care of them over the years.
target: Dr. Bezak is the only veterinarian I trust with my dogs. I've had a few Chow Chow's and many veterinarians are intimidated by the breed. However, Doc is experienced with Chows since he has one himself, and takes excellent care of them every time we visit.

source:
I mean, it's Target. It has everything. You just need to know what to buy there, and not get sucked into the convenience of buying everything in one spot.

Beware -- though their merchandise looks nice, and it's a good buy for a student, you don't want to make long-term purchases here. The zipper on a skirt I bought broke the first time I wore it. I've heard horror stories about disintegrating comforters during their first wash.

That said, their store-brand toiletries and other sundry items are fairly cheap, and they have a wider selection than Giant Eagle or CVS. They also have a cool program with Flickr.com -- you can upload your photos, order them online from Target's One-Hour Photo kiosk, and pay by credit card when you pick them up.

I love their cheap accessories -- glasses, bags, jewelry. Along with Claire's and Filene's, Target is my favorite place to shop for those things.
target: Target is a great store for all your needs, but be careful not to get carried away with buying everything in one place. Their prices are good for students, but be cautious about the quality of their products for long-term use. Despite this, they offer inexpensive store-brand toiletries and a wider variety than other stores like Giant Eagle or CVS. Plus, Target has a fun program with Flickr.com where you can upload your photos and get them printed at the One-Hour Photo kiosk for easy pick-up. I really enjoy shopping at Target for their affordable accessories like glasses, bags, and jewelry, which are comparable to Claire's and Filene's.

source:
What can I say, I'm a shill for Target!  Like another reviewer says, you have to watch the impulse buying here because it is so easy to do!

But as for the name brands here, I've never had a problem with them.  I bought some Woolrich blankets and sheets here that my husband and I have been very satisfied with.  The housewares section here is positively unbeatable.  My husband Rick is an amateur chef and he could blow his paycheck on the kitchen utensils.  He particularly likes the Michael Graves ones.  He is also an amateur photographer and he still works with film, so he likes the film development here.

Me, I also like buying household cleaners and personal items such as soaps, toothpaste, deoderant, etc because the selection is so good.  I've also purchased a lot of my casual wear here.
target: I have to admit, I love Target! Just like another reviewer mentioned, you have to be careful not to overspend because everything is so tempting. However, I've never had any issues with the quality of the name-brand products they carry. My husband and I are big fans of the Woolrich blankets and sheets we bought here. And don't even get us started on the housewares section - it's amazing! My husband, who enjoys cooking, can easily spend a whole paycheck on the Michael Graves kitchen utensils. He's also into photography and still uses film, so he appreciates the film development services available here. As for me, I love browsing through the great selection of household cleaners and personal care products, as well as picking up some casual clothes while I'm here.

source: Oh Target!  You are big corporate America!  But how can I not love you so?  Your prices are the best whenever I need household goods like detergents, cleaners, etc.  For personal effects such as toiletries, soap, etc, you can't be beat!  Your cookware and bakeware department is every bit as good as Macy's!\n\nAnd I see you have the retro tees too.  You know:  Yes http://www.dovenetq.net.au/~mahayes/Graphics/YesLogoFullCircle1.jpg Boston http://www.vinylrecords.ch/B/BO/Boston/Boston/boston-63.jpg Led Zeppelin http://henrikfalck.com/blog/uploaded_images/LedZeppelinLedZeppelinalbumcover-716782.jpg  We know what \"retro tee\" means:  faux aged, catering to boomers and teens, and costing way more than they origianlly did.  Oh and made in China of course!
target: Oh Target, you truly are the epitome of big corporate America. Yet, I am drawn to your undeniable appeal. Your prices always seem to be the most competitive when it comes to essential household products like cleaning supplies and laundry detergents. In addition, you truly cannot be outmatched in the realm of personal care items such as soap and toiletries. Your selection of cookware and bakeware easily rivals that of even upscale department stores like Macy's. It's worth noting that I also admire your collection of retro tees, which have that faux-aged appeal and cater to both baby boomers and teenagers alike - even if they are produced overseas in places like China and are priced higher than their original counterparts.

source:
Target is one of my favorite stores -- I just love wandering around late at night when the store is quiet -- it's just so therapeutic! This location is now my closest store, so I drop by pretty often.

This store is pretty average. Inventory and customer service aren't particularly stellar but isn't poor either. I've generally been able to find what I need here and check out pretty quickly. 

In addition to the common pharmacy and photo studio found in most Targets, this location also has an optical department. Of the 10-15 locations in the Pittsburgh area, only this store and the Cranberry store sell glasses. I purchased a pair of glasses and sunglasses through Target Optical three years ago and have been very happy with their product and customer service.
target: Target is easily one of my favorite stores to visit. When the quiet of night settles in, it's a peaceful experience walking around the store. This store may not be the best in terms of inventory or customer service, but I've never had a terrible experience. Quick checkouts are always appreciated for those on the go. Compared to other Targets nearby, this particular location has a unique addition: an optical department. Only this store and the Cranberry location sell glasses of any sort. My experience with Target Optical has been great, as I've been a happy customer for three years now.

source: It's not the greatest Target of all time but it still meets all of your basic needs.\n\nIf you're looking for produce, lower prices, and bigger selection in every department then head to the Target in East Liberty.
target:
Although it may not be the most remarkable Target out there, it satisfies all your necessities. 

For those seeking fresh produce, affordable prices, and an extensive variety across all departments, the Target located in East Liberty is your best bet.

source: I've been to many Targets and they're all the same. However, this particular one is currently being remodeled. Children's clothing, toys, electronics and health & beauty items have been moved to other parts of the store. There is a new Starbucks that is now open. The cafe that is there has been remodeled and will serve Pizza Hut pizza and other new menu items. The area where the electronics used to be it is now going to have a small grocery section. Basically, this Target in Homestead will eventually look like the one in East Liberty. I like this Target, so I am pleased with the new changes (especially Starbucks)!
target: I've visited several Targets before and they all seem to follow a similar pattern. However, this specific one is undergoing some major renovations. The clothes, toys, electronics and health & beauty products have been relocated to other parts of the store. Additionally, a new Starbucks branch has just opened up. The previous cafe has been given a new look and will now offer a number of new menu items, including Pizza Hut pizzas. The electronics area has been transformed into a small grocery section. Ultimately, the Homestead Target will resemble the one in East Liberty. I'm quite fond of this particular Target and the new changes, particularly the inclusion of Starbucks, have left me quite pleased.

source: Watch out when it looks like something is on sale.  They mark a rack or table with a big buy one get one or 50% off sign, then only some of the stuff on the rack is on sale.
target: Be cautious when you see a sale sign. Retailers often label a rack or table with a buy one get one or 50% off offer, but only a portion of the items on display are actually discounted.

source:
Let's start this review by saying that when we are at that point, my girlfriend and I will be going to Jos. A. Bank for mine and my groomsman's suits.  Allow me to give you a numbered breakdown of the issues we encountered when renting from Men's Wearhouse to be the groomsmen in our friends wedding.

1- They never contacted us after the fitting after saying there would be a followup call.  The other groomsmen and I had to follow up repeatedly to get an answer as to when our tuxedos would arrive and the staff were very short with our honest questions over the phone.
2- They sent two of our tuxedos to Homestead when we asked for them to be sent to Ross Park Mall during the fitting.
3- When one of us called two days prior to the wedding to ask if our tux's had arrived the guy answering the phone said "Oh... I don't know" (insert an awkward, pregnant pause here while waiting for him to say "Let me check that for you") he instead said "Well, I'm going to hang up now."  And he made good on that promise, and hung up.
4- Despite saying we'd get a call a few weeks ahead of the wedding to be resized in case one of us gained a few lbs over the winter, this call never came so we basically had to hope that everything fit as it needed to.
5- We were at one point informed that MW had our emails on file and that when our tuxes arrived at the store we would receive an email letting us know.  Not a single groomsman received any such email to that effect.
6- One of the groomsmen randomly received a black tie while everybody else had white.  Another received no studs.  We discovered this approximately two hours to show-time while relatively far from civilization.
7- On picking up my tux I informed the associate "I'll be unable to get to a Men's Wearhouse for a few days after the wedding, is this alright?" to which she responded "Yeah that should be fine" so when my girlfriend graciously dropped off my tux for me a few days later and learned of the $100 late fee, I was totally caught off guard.
8- My girlfriend was also caught totally off guard by the associate at Ross Park Mall who was incredibly rude to her when  he informed her of said late fee.
9- As the Best Man I was given a coupon card for $50 off my next rental at Men's Wearhouse.  Since I am in another wedding next month with rentals from MW I figured this would be an opportune time to use it.  Imagine my shock while paying for the next weddings rental, when I presented the coupon and was told "Oh, that isn't for this.  That is intended for YOUR wedding.  Oh and it expires on December 31st of this year." 
10- The groom himself decided to use a coupon to purchase a suit for the wedding and to own, rather than rent a tux for the occasion.  He was ensured by the Homestead staff that the coupon would be fine for this purpose and got fitted for it.  When he went to pick up his suit and pay with the aid of said approved coupon he was instead forced into an argument with an associate who insisted he could not use the coupon towards the suit that an associate a few weeks earlier had insisted he could use.  Granted, now I am speaking for another person so take that with as much salt as you may, but he reiterated this fact to me several times prior to his wedding last week.

Over my friends wedding weekend, any time anything even went slightly wrong at and around his wedding, the joke between the Groom and his Groomsmen was "Effing Men's Wearhouse."  For example, at a restaurant, "Wait I asked for no onions on this sandwich. - Effing Men's Wearhouse!"  "Noise complaint at the hotel room? Men's Wearhouse."

Another groomsman looked at me when we discovered the wrong color tie one of us received and said to me "I hope you're taking notes for your own impending wedding" to which I replied "Perhaps I could find better service from GoodWill of Western PA"

Congrats Men's Wearhouse.  You became the butt of every joke for every mishap for an entire weekend around a wedding to which you provided the suits.

TL;DR - 10 mistakes, several rude associates and 1 future groom going to Jos. A. Bank.
target: My girlfriend and I will be heading to Jos. A. Bank for our suits and for my groomsman's suits. Here are some of the issues we had when we rented from Men's Wearhouse for our friend's wedding: they never contacted us after the fitting, sent two tuxedos to the wrong location, were unhelpful when we called to inquire about our tuxedos, didn't follow up with us to ensure the fit, failed to notify us when our tuxedos were ready, some of the groomsmen received the wrong accessories or none at all, we were charged a late fee we weren't aware of, the customer service was rude, and a coupon we received for renting was not valid for the next rental. We ended up making Men's Wearhouse the joke of the entire weekend. Our experience was far from satisfactory and we've decided to go to Jos. A. Bank for our upcoming wedding.

source: I went in to get my suit that I bought last year tailored because I had lost some weight and I couldn't have had a better experience. When I walked in I was immediately created by Bill who was warm and friendly. Anna came out to perform the measurements and mark up the suit. She checked everything, even changes I hadn't thought to have made to make sure the suit fits me perfectly when they are done. Best of all, when I asked if they could ship the suits to me at my house since I no longer live in Pittsburgh, they asked when I was leaving town and promised they would get it done for me before I left  the next day. Better yet, they had the suit ready for me early, avoiding the rush for me to pick it up before I left. Everyone was extremely helpful and diligent and I will continue to only get changes done at this store.
target: I recently went to have my suit tailored at the same store where I purchased it last year, as I had lost some weight. My experience was amazing. The staff greeted me warmly, and Anna assisted with measuring and marking up the suit to ensure a perfect fit. They even suggested changes I hadn't thought of. When I asked if they could ship the suit to my home since I no longer live in the area, they promised to have it done before I left the next day. To my delight, they completed the alterations ahead of schedule, making my departure less stressful. The staff's excellent service made me decide to always return to this store for future tailoring needs.

source: It's not that delish.
target: It's not very tasty.

source: Great on line service!!!  2nd time placing an order on line and they made it easy as far as getting the correct sizes in a timely manner.
target: Excellent online service!! This is my second time ordering online and they ensured a hassle-free experience in terms of timely delivery and correct sizing.

source: This store has such bad service. The service staff are rude rude rude.  Save your money, shop elsewhere.
target: The service at this store is extremely poor. The behavior of the service staff is highly discourteous. Avoid wasting your money here, consider other shopping options.

source:
I love bed bath & beyond! 

The employees at this particular one are always available and helpful!  

The selection, plus the 20% off coupons keep me coming back, and its also where I get all of the things for my soda stream. 

Overall I will be back many, many times
target: I am a huge fan of bed bath & beyond! The staff at this location are consistently friendly and ready to assist! The wide range of products, in addition to the 20% discount coupons, make it a regular destination for me, and I always find everything I require for my soda machine. All in all, I intend to continue visiting this shop numerous times!

source: We just completed our wedding registry at the Homestead location. The customer service was outstanding! One of the employees, Chris, walked around with us to help us pick out exactly what we needed. The wedding registry coordinator, Christina, was also very helpful and accommodating. They treated us as if we were royalty. I would recommend this wedding registry without a doubt!
target: My partner and I had an incredible experience creating our wedding registry at Homestead. The employees went above and beyond to make sure we found everything we needed. Chris even accompanied us to help us make the right choices. The wedding registry coordinator, Christina, was equally attentive and accommodating. It felt like we were receiving VIP treatment the whole time. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this wedding registry to others!

source: Much like every other Eat 'n Park (3 or 4 stars worth of chain-diner food), except the last five times I've been here, the service has been damn, damn, daaaaaaaamn slow.  It's always fun to see the staff smoking out back while I've waited an hour for some scrambled eggs.
target: Similar text: The food at this Eat 'n Park is pretty typical for a chain diner, but the service has been frustratingly slow on my recent visits. It's disheartening to watch the staff take smoke breaks while I wait and wait for my order to arrive.

source:
If you must eat at Eat N Park, this is the one you want to go to. Why you ask? The corporate offices are right next door and the suits are there every day, breakfast lunch and dinner. 

When I spend a few hours with dear old mom, she enjoyed spending a day at the Waterfront, she loved the since closed 39 center store, where she could buy her monthly greeting cards for 39 cents each. Then we drive over to this eat n park where she has her breakfast smile and I enjoy an egg beater sandwich and fresh fruit.

This place is spotless, the salad bar always looks fresh and the food is good, for a chain.
target: For those looking to dine at Eat N Park, this location is highly recommended. Located adjacent to the corporate offices, you can expect to see company executives dining here throughout the day. I often visit this spot with my mother to spend quality time together. We usually spend the day at the Waterfront and make our way to this restaurant for breakfast. My mother loves the comfortable ambiance and I enjoy the egg beater sandwich paired with fresh fruits. Not only is the food consistently delicious, but the cleanliness of the restaurant is also impeccable. The salad bar is always well-stocked and inviting. All in all, a great choice for a chain restaurant.

source: Great location!  I love that you can substitute burger with a veggi patti and that they have gluten free bread.  Love love love the smiley cookies :)
target: This is an amazing spot! I appreciate their option to switch out burgers for veggie patties, and their availability of gluten-free bread. Plus, those smiley cookies put a smile on my face :)

source: The food is usually pretty good, however the service is almost ALWAYS very VERY slow. Most of the staff are pretty friendly and sweet but there are a few sour ones in the bunch that make the experience not as nice as it could be. Although they still technically do their job, you can FEEL very negative vibes from them and see how inefficient they are with the way they do things. It's a hit and miss. Unless you know one of the servers and their schedules. The low rating is mainly for the slow service and the handful of staff members who aren't very pleasant.
target: While the food is decent, the service is consistently slow. Majority of the staff are friendly and kind, but there are a couple of unpleasant individuals who dampen the experience. Despite getting the job done, their bad attitudes and inefficient work style exude negative energy. It's a gamble to go there unless you have a connection with a server and know their shift timings. Overall, the poor rating is due to the sluggish service and the few unfriendly team members.

source: They make a nice breakfast for less than the tip form dinner the night before.  That's not bad!
target: It's amazing how you can have a delicious breakfast without spending as much as you did on the dinner tip last night. That's quite a deal!

source: Eat n Park is usually decent.  This location though has HORRIBLY SLOW service.  Seriously, we never wait less than 10 minutes for a server to acknowledge us, and we live near the Waterfront, so we've given this location the benefit of the doubt numerous times.  Each time hoping that the last was just a fluke, new staff, or something.  It's not.  Doesn't matter what time we go.  It seems we are not acknowledged for several minutes, and then the service is mediocre at best.  Occasionally, we've had a stellar service, but it's few and far between.  Today, after waiting 15 minutes, then getting up to find a server in another section, we were informed that we were sitting in a \"closed\" section.  That server offered to serve us, but honestly, we left.  I told the hostess who seated us about the mixup, and got a blank stare.  I've never had this issue at any other EnP.  We left, drove to the Squirrel Hill location, and our orders were taken in the amount of time we wasted at the Waterfront.  Mgmt- you have a beautiful, prime location.  Get your hosts and servers on the same page!
target: Although Eat n Park is generally a decent restaurant, this particular branch is infamous for its discouragingly slow service. Regrettably, it's not an isolated incident, as even after numerous visits, we have never waited less than 10 minutes for a server to attend to us. Regardless of the time of day, it seems that we are left unattended for several minutes on end, and then we receive mediocre service at best. Despite a few notable exceptions, it's certainly not worth the trip. On one occasion, we even discovered that we had been seated in a closed section of the restaurant. Although a server from another section offered to attend to us, we eventually decided to leave in frustration. I mentioned the mix-up to the hostess, but received no helpful response. Fortunately, we were welcomed and well-cared-for during our visit to the Squirrel Hill location. Dear management, you have a conveniently located and visually stunning establishment. Please make sure that your servers and hostesses are working together in harmony.

source: Very good cheap food. Pittsburgh classic.Great desserts! The oreo pie is amazing! The servers are always very friendly. The salad bar could be a little more clean.
target: Delicious and affordable cuisine that is a classic in Pittsburgh. You can't miss the incredible desserts, especially the Oreo pie. The staff is consistently kind and accommodating. While the salad bar could use some improvement in cleanliness, overall this restaurant is a winner for both taste and price.

source: God i hate eat n park. Only reason i have gone is for the salad bar because u cant find a decent salad bar in this city. Just about every entree iv had here is nothing more than rubbish, except maybe the cheesteak. Only go if u have little kids
target: I really dislike Eat n Park. The salad bar is the only reason I go, as it's difficult to find a good salad bar around here. Every main course I've had at Eat n Park has been mediocre at best, except for the cheesesteak which was okay. Unless you have young children, I wouldn't recommend going.

source:
If you're looking for a wallet, a new cheap purse or something of that nature--this is the place to go.

Otherwise, this kind of shopping just isn't for me!
I don't have the patience for clothes shopping here though.
The racks drive me nuts bc they're in no particular order.

Its "Shirts/Sizes", "Pants/Sizes", "Jeans/Sizes", "Coats/Sizes"
I can't look through a gazillion racks of shirts looking for something I like (aimlessly) in a M or L... I just cant do it!  lol
Wish I could, I'd probably find some deals.

PROS:
Some good deals

CONS:
You've gotta "dig deep" to find 'em
target: This is a great place to shop if you're in the market for a new wallet, purse or other similar items, but it's not my cup of tea when it comes to clothing shopping. The disorganization of the racks frustrates me and makes it difficult to find what I'm looking for. The categories of "Shirts/Sizes", "Pants/Sizes", "Jeans/Sizes", and "Coats/Sizes" are not quite specific enough for me, and I don't have the patience to sift through piles of clothes aimlessly. However, if you're willing to put in the effort, there are some good deals to be found here.

source: Went in here to grab a last minute item I needed for an outfit.  I wasn't going to hold my breath here either, I know it's a Marshalls and that doesn't always mean the best selection.  It's hit or miss no matter what you are looking for.\n\nThis day, was a hit, maybe even a home run.  I do have to admit, the Kenneth Cole shirt I got not only looked great on me, but made my wallet feel even better!
target: I popped into this Marshalls store to snatch something I needed for my outfit, but I had low expectations. Marshalls may not always have the best variety, so I wasn't banking on finding exactly what I wanted. It can be a hit or miss in here, depending on what you're searching for. Nonetheless, I lucked out today; I found a Kenneth Cole shirt that not only suited me perfectly but also came at a great price!

source: Since both Marshalls and TJ Maxx are owned by the same company, I make sure to stop by both locations when shopping at the Waterfront. I generally find nothing or spend only $10 or so at Marshalls, while being enticed to spend at least $50-100 at TJ Maxx. The Waterfront TJ Maxx seems to have not only the same product as this Marshalls plus a whole lot more. All that to say, I consider shopping here a waste of time since I could just drive a block or so and be at a store owned by the same company that always has what I want and need. Sorry, Marshalls, but you're just OK to me.
target: As Marshalls and TJ Maxx are part of the same company, I visit both stores when shopping at the Waterfront. However, I tend to find little or only spend around $10 at Marshalls. On the other hand, TJ Maxx has a wider selection, and I usually end up spending around $50-100 there. I feel it's not worth my time to visit Marshalls when I can easily drive a short distance to access the same products at TJ Maxx, which is a store that always meets my needs. While Marshalls is fine, it doesn't wow me.

source:
A very nice meal in a very nice restaurant

PROS:
Very good food
interesting choices--not your typical red lobster crap
Great service
Very clean (restrooms, included)

CONS:
n/a
target:
A wonderful dining experience at an exceptional restaurant

PROS:
Outstanding cuisine
Unique menu optionsnothing like your average chain restaurant
Excellent service
Impeccable cleanliness (including restrooms)

CONS:
None to mention

source:
Got lunch from here today. 

What I sampled: 
Maine Lobster Bisque (delicious and the whole reason for getting lunch from here)
Cheeseburger (decent version I only ate about half, but I expect the other half won't last long)

Overall I enjoy going here, though it is a bit overpriced, but sometimes I am just in the mood for that lobster bisque!
target:
I tried their food for lunch today. 

My food review: 
Their Maine Lobster Bisque is a must-try (absolutely mouth-watering and it's the only reason I decided to grab food from here)
Their Cheeseburger is not bad but I only finished half of it (the other half might not last till later)

Although it can be a bit expensive, I still like coming here. There are times when I crave for their lobster bisque!

source: Service was slow, but that was because one of our party insisted that the bartender, her favorite server, serve us in our private room for a party of 8.  The food and drinks were good and we woud return.
target: Although the service was a bit slow, it was understandable as one of our group members insisted on having her favorite bartender serve us in our private room for a party of 8. Nevertheless, the food and drinks were excellent and we would definitely consider returning.

source:
I am bummed about this- I had high hopes. Here's a rundown of the evening:

Pros:
- super friendly waitress, Stephanie, who maintained her professionalism and friendliness throughout 
- yummy elderflower and pear beverage
- lobster bisque was nice and lobster-y
- hot delicious bread

Cons:
- oysters were sketch. And I don't feel good about that. Stephanie brought us an order of East Coast oysters to replace the West Coast ones that we sent back.
- fresh grated horseradish had NO flavor or heat- what's up with that?
- scallops were meh- came with weird veggies, unevenly seared, and no real flavor. And at a whopping $25 a plate, I expect some nummers!

I doubt we'll go back- for those prices, I would prefer McCormick's or Ruth's Chris.
target: Although our waitress Stephanie was exceptionally friendly and professional, I had high expectations for the evening that weren't met. On the positive side, the elderflower and pear drink was delicious, the lobster bisque tasted strongly of lobster, and the bread was hot and yummy. However, there were a few negatives to our meal. Firstly, the oysters were questionable, and even after being replaced with East Coast oysters, I still felt uneasy. Additionally, the fresh grated horseradish lacked flavor and heat. Lastly, the scallops were average, accompanied by odd vegetables, unevenly cooked, and lacking in flavor, especially at $25 per plate. Given the price point, I would opt for McCormick's or Ruth's Chris over this restaurant in the future.

source: Service an atmosphere was great. I had the shrimp boil and it was very under-seasoned. Much closer to bland than anything.
target: The service was fantastic, but the shrimp boil lacked seasoning and tasted quite bland.

source: I'm not a mean reviewer, if you look at the other places I've reviewed, but this was just so so so disappointing. The Shanghai style Merlin was very poorly done. The meat was extremely bland, with very little seasoning. I have a very low sodium tolerance and yet I still found this fish to be made too bland. The rice was entirely uncooked and it made crunching sounds as I took my first bite. I talked to the waitress and she offered to bring out another side. It wasn't the same. The whole dish was a fail and I don't think I am ever coming back again :(
target: Although I usually write positive reviews, I was unsatisfied with my experience at this restaurant. The Shanghai style Merlin dish lacked flavor and was bland. Even with my low sodium tolerance, I found it to be tasteless. The rice was undercooked and made unpleasant sounds when I bit into it. I spoke with the waitress who replaced the side dish, however, it still did not meet my expectations. Overall, I was disappointed and not planning to return.

source:
Will I come here again?  Yes absolutely for drinks, they knocked the Ketel One extra dirty blue cheese olive martini outta the park.  The ambiance is very nice.  Of the 4 types of reviews I give (awesome, OK, bad where they get slammed and bad where I hope they improve) here I am giving the heartfelt "bad where I hope they improve."  Our waitress was very friendly and did a good job.  I mentioned the gritty redskins of the mashed potato.  We went with appetizers she recommended.  Not good.  

Seared ahi tuna: horrible flavors mixed with the rub, the prep, the tuna wasn't cool inside, the chips were not good, there was no soy sauce but there was wasabi.  NOT good.  With heartfelt advice, compare this against Outback's ahi tuna appetizer and it's no contest.  The chef should do so.  (He's a nice guy like me I hope.)  

BBQ shrimp: go try Redstone's (Philly) buffalo shrimp appetizer.  It is chilled, very delicious.  This appetizer was recommended and was garbage.  The barbecue sauce was horrible, overwhelmed and left an unsavory aftertaste in both my and my clients' palate.  Gordon Food Service or Sysco BBQ sauce.  A real "must-miss".  

Cod entree was OK.  The skillet beans were too firm, too mature, they need petite green beans.  Potato skin had grit in the mashed.  Why 1 star?  The price was close to Capital Grille, but far from the cuisine.  I hope they spruce it up.  The place is nice.
target: Although the ambiance was pleasant and the bartender made a fantastic extra dirty blue cheese olive martini with Ketel One, I unfortunately can only give this restaurant a "needs improvement" rating. The waitress we had was friendly and did a good job, but the appetizers she recommended were not up to par. The seared ahi tuna was not cool inside and had a horrible mix of flavors, while the BBQ shrimp was made with a horrible sauce that lingered unpleasantly on our palates. Although the cod entree was decent, the skillet beans were too firm and the mashed potatoes had grit in them. The prices were also quite high for the quality of the food. Overall, I hope they make some changes to their menu and improve their dishes because the restaurant itself is nice.

source: The service was mostly friendly but I was disappointed in my meal. My meal was way over cooked. The soda was flat and the carbonation needed changed and I felt like we inconvenienced our server by asking for new ones.  Overall, I thought it was mediocre and I was expecting more for the prices.
target: Although the service was decent, I was let down by the food. My dish was greatly overdone and the soda lacked fizz, requiring a replacement. Our server seemed bothered when we requested an exchange. In conclusion, it was average at best and for what we paid, we had higher hopes.

source: The food was really good, but the prices were pretty high and the portions were on the small side. The desserts were the high point of the meal for me. I got the \"shark fin\" pie and it was really good. The waitress thought I wouldn't be able to finish it... but I showed her. Take that, waitress.
target: Although the food tasted great, the prices were quite steep, and the servings were small. The highlight of my dining experience was the dessert. I ordered the \"shark fin\" pie, and it was delectable. Initially, the waitress assumed I wouldn't be able to finish it, but I proved her wrong.

source:
I have passed by this place a zillion times and never given it a second look.  I thought it might be a Red Lobster knock off.  Then I asked a friend if they had ever heard of it and they had, and liked it.

I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the ambiance was inside.  Very cozy.  Much more upscale than I had thought it would be.  The service was terrific.  Lots of things to choose from on the menu.  A bit pricier than I had imagined.  Most entrees were anywhere from $17 to $30.  But this is Pittsburgh and this is seafood.

That said, they started us off with really delicious sour dough bread.  Butter was soft which I like.  Our entrees came pretty quickly.  I had a seafood assortment of blackened talapia, grilled sea scallops and salmon cooked on a plank.  The scallops were just done, I like them cooked a little more.  Everything else was pretty good.
My beloved had the crab cakes and really enjoyed them.

We'll probably be back, but will order something different.   We liked it.
target:
I used to walk by this restaurant all the time without giving it a second thought. I assumed it was just another mediocre seafood spot trying to mimic Red Lobster. However, a friend mentioned how much they enjoyed it, so I decided to give it a try. 

To my surprise, the inside was cozy and had a much more upscale feel than I had anticipated. The service was exceptional, and the menu offered a diverse range of options. Although some dishes were a bit pricier, that's to be expected in Pittsburgh when it comes to seafood. 

Our meal kicked off with a delectable sourdough bread and soft butter, which was a lovely touch. Our entrees came out in a timely mannerI ordered a seafood trio consisting of blackened tilapia, grilled sea scallops, and salmon cooked on a plank. While the scallops weren't cooked to my preference, the rest of the dish was quite tasty. My partner ordered the crab cakes and loved them. 

Overall, we enjoyed our experience and will likely return for another visit, albeit with different dishes to try.

source: Food was only ok. Had lobster bisque soup not to good. Had the shang Hai Seafood Sampler. The scallops were hard, over cooked. The samon was good. Shrimp had no flavor. I will say the service was the best. Our waiter was great!!
target: The food didn't meet our expectations. The lobster bisque soup was disappointing and the scallops in the Shang Hai Seafood Sampler were overcooked. However, the samon was delicious. The shrimp lacked flavor. On the bright side, the service was exceptional. Our waiter provided great service.

source: We had a bigger party and I think that might have flustered the waitresses just a bit. They forgot about our waters until the food came out, but were super apologetic when they did bring them. The food was ok. I ordered the crab cakes they were a bit heavy on the breading, so I would give them a rating of, \"eh\". My friend ordered a steak, asked for medium rare, and it came out...well done. He was too hungry to complain and just ate it. We might go back again, and this time maybe take a bit more time looking over the menu.
target: Our party was quite large and it seemed like the waitresses were a bit overwhelmed. Unfortunately, they forgot to bring us water until our food arrived. However, they were very apologetic once they brought them. The food was average. I decided to try the crab cakes but they had too much breading, making them just okay. My friend ordered a steak cooked medium rare, but it arrived well-done. He was too hungry to complain, so he just went ahead and ate it. We may return to the restaurant and next time take more time to peruse the menu.

source: Beautiful decor. Very genuine staff. Very clean washrooms. Delicious food. I tried the market trio. The blackened tilapia was nice with a little bit of spice. This is a great place for a seafood lover.
target: The ambience was stunning. The staff were incredibly authentic. The washrooms were exceptionally well-maintained. The food was phenomenal, especially the market trio. The blackened tilapia had just the right amount of kick. It's a must-visit destination for any seafood aficionado.

source:
My husband and I went to Mitchell's last summer for our wedding anniversary. We both took a half day at work and we arrived in the early afternoon (after lunch but before the dinner crowd). I can't say enough about this place...we have gone here on a few occasions and I've always been please with everything. 

Pros: Nice friendly waitress, who took some time to take our picture (since it was our anniversary), food was excellent and not extremely overpriced, restaurant and bathrooms were clean!

Cons: None on this visit or any previous visits
target:
Last summer, my spouse and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at Mitchell's. We finished work early and arrived in the afternoon, avoiding the lunch and evening rush. I cannot praise this establishment enough - we have frequented it a few times and have always been impressed. 

Advantages: A kind and pleasant server who took a photo of us (due to it being our anniversary), delicious food at a reasonable price, and a clean restaurant and restrooms. 

Disadvantages: There were no issues during our most recent visit or any previous trips.

source: I have eaten some very good dinners here.  Although it's a chain, I would say it's several notches above the other chain restaurants.  The chef here seems to add some creativity to the menu, so I will be definitely back again soon.
target: The food at this restaurant chain is impressive. Despite its chain status, the quality is far superior to other chain establishments. The chef adds his own flair to the menu, making it a must-visit for me in the future.

source: Went for dinner Friday evening with friends and sat at the outdoor patio. It is so nice and relaxing there with the river and bike trail. The sourdough bread they serve is always hot and fresh. The Chilean sea bass just melts in your mouth, it was awesome. The Cod stuffed with shrimp and lobster was also very good. I had the carrot cake for dessert, it is big enough for 3 people. It was so delicious. My friend had the creme  br\u00fbl\u00e9e, which she said was very good. I was here 3 times this summer and every meal was excellent.
target: Enjoyed a lovely evening on Friday with friends at a restaurant's outdoor patio, which overlooks a river and bike trail. The sourdough bread they serve is always freshly baked and the Chilean sea bass is simply incredible. The Cod stuffed with shrimp and lobster is also delicious. For dessert, the carrot cake is huge and tasty. My friend enjoyed the creme br\u00fbl\u00e9e, which she thought was great. I've been to this restaurant three times this summer and each meal has been excellent.

source:
Top points. 
Service. I was there with a large group for a meeting. They gave us a private room and two servers took care of us. They were efficient and very accommodating. Kudos. 

Appetizers: had the crab dip and calamari. Both were good. Servers brought extra chips with the dip as they were needed. I'm always surprised that more chips are not just added to the original dish at this point. Dip was good. Calamari was done well. Preferred the shrimp cocktail Sauce with it versus the Asian type soy sauce that is served with it. 

Wedge salad with bleu cheese. Waaaaaay too much cheese and I like bleu cheese. 

I had the blackened tuna with mashed potatoes and seasonal veggies. Carrots were carrot sticks hardly cooked and dry! Green beans overdone and broccoli had seen better days. Simple green beans would have been more appetizing. 
Tuna had blackening spices but needed a better sear on it. Was not over cooked. Potatoes as expected. 
Other dishes seen--fisherman's platter. Looked a little greasy, but that's expected from me in a full fried dish. Would be nice if this was offered broiled as well. Crab cakes and filet looked okay. 

Overall I'm always underwhelmed and overcharged here. I guess with chain places you get that, but I want more from a place that charges me 25 bucks for sub-seared tuna.
target: The service at this restaurant was exceptional as they provided a private room and two servers for our large group. Appetizers such as the crab dip and calamari were enjoyable, and additional chips were provided with the dip. The calamari was well-prepared, but I preferred the shrimp cocktail sauce to the Asian soy sauce that came with it. However, the wedge salad had too much bleu cheese. The blackened tuna with mashed potatoes and seasonal veggies was decent but lacked a better sear on the tuna. Other dishes, including the fisherman's platter, crab cakes, and filet, looked alright. Nevertheless, I felt overcharged for the sub-seared tuna and expected more from a restaurant that charges significantly high.

source: My husbands first time.  Nice to be able to pick your fish and style of cooking.  I had a trio of Jamaican jerk tilapia,  salmon,  and scallops.  All good but too much sauce on scallops.  Husband had surf n turf special. Snow crab legs tasty but smaller portion than I expected. Glad they had raw oysters,  but no idea where they were from.  For $2.50 each you'd think they'd say.  Waitstaff friendly but inexperienced when it came to wine.  We taught two of them how to open a champagne bottle.  Nice time out,  but two gripes... #1 Used my phones flashlight to see if there was an outlet on the floor.  Felt like an archaeologist finding old remains of dinners gone by.  Crumbs,  napkins wedged between booth and wall,  gum,  dirt.  For the price I would expect a cleaner place. #2 our waiter kept saying Thank you. After every single sentence,  even when it wasn't appropriate.  Silly gripe,  right?  But it was way over the top and felt more like,  Can I have a tip?  Can I have a tip?
target: My spouse and I recently dined at a restaurant where we were able to choose our own fish and cooking style. I enjoyed a combination of Jamaican jerk tilapia, salmon, and scallops, although the scallops had a bit too much sauce for my liking. My husband went with the surf n turf special, which included tasty snow crab legs, although the portion size was a bit smaller than we anticipated. Though we were pleased to find raw oysters available, we were disappointed that there was no information about their origin despite the hefty price tag. The waitstaff were friendly but inexperienced when it came to wine; in fact, we even had to show a couple of them how to open a bottle of champagne. While we enjoyed our evening overall, we had two minor complaints. Firstly, we had to use the flashlight function on our phones to discover if there was an outlet on the floor, and we were a bit dismayed to find remnants of previous meals (crumbs, napkins, gum, and dirt) wedged between the booth and the wall. For the price, we would have expected a cleaner establishment. Secondly, our waiter repeatedly said "thank you" after every sentence, even when it was unnecessary, which felt uncomfortably like they were fishing for a larger tip.

source: In the Homestead area of Pittsburgh. Seafood gumbo was very good.\nBroiled scallops were very good, partner had sea bass stuffed with lobster, also very good. Vegetable sides were not as good as the fish. With two glasses of wine the total was $83. In and out in an hour.\nI'd go back because the fish was that good
target: The seafood gumbo and broiled scallops in the Homestead area of Pittsburgh were absolutely delicious, and my partner thoroughly enjoyed the sea bass stuffed with lobster. Although the vegetable sides were not quite up to par with the fish, we still enjoyed our meal. With a couple of glasses of wine, the bill came out to $83, and we were in and out within an hour. We would definitely consider returning solely for the amazing fish dishes.

source: Very bad purchase experience. I bought a shirt with a hole covered in the rolled up sleeves, but they denied my request to return it. I am so angery at this and will never shop their chothes anymore.
target: I had a terrible buying experience when I purchased a shirt that had a hole in the rolled up sleeves. The store refused to accept my return request, which made me extremely upset. As a result, I have decided not to purchase any clothing items from them again.

source: After further consideration, this store does not deserve a 4 star review. The Old Navy product has been pretty weak recently, which isn't the store's fault, but the severe lack of customer service doesn't help the situation. \n\nWhile shopping here on Friday, I was one of maybe 3-5 people in the store. I would practically walk into a sales associate but not even receive a glance or smile. No one working here seems to give an iota whether or not product is being sold. To avoid inconveniencing the associates, I will be taking my Old Navy purchases online in the future.
target:
Upon further evaluation, I have decided to amend my previous 4-star review of this store. Although the poor quality of Old Navy products cannot be attributed to the store, the complete lack of customer service exacerbates the issue. 

During my recent visit on Friday, I noticed that there were only a handful of customers in the store, including myself. Despite this, I walked past several sales associates without receiving any acknowledgement, let alone a smile. It appears that the staff is indifferent to whether or not customers make purchases. As a result, I will be opting to purchase Old Navy items online to avoid any inconvenience to the associates.

source:
I'm not too impressed with this particular Dick's Sporting Goods. It is in a great location in the Waterfront, but the selection seems a bit limited to me. They have what you need, but they don't have many options it seems.

I went in there the other day and it looks like they also have a snowboarding section now, which they definitely did not have last season. They also have hunting, golfing and biking, in addition to the other regular deptartments. 

Your normal Dick's. Nothing spectacular, but it will do.
target: Although this Dick's Sporting Goods is located in the Waterfront, I find the selection to be lacking in variety. While they do have the essentials available, there are limited options to choose from. However, during my recent visit, I did notice that they now offer a snowboarding section that was not available last year. Additionally, they have departments for hunting, golfing, biking, and other regular sports. It is an average store, but it will suffice.

source: I don't see to many options in Pittsburgh for sporting goods. Dick's seems to be the big chain for sporting paraphernalia in this neck of the woods. Their selection is poor especially in the snowboarding and biking section. Maybe it's good for small children who want their first snowboard? It is a very average store with average products. I would like to see some attempt to carry more high end products. I am not into fishing or hunting live prey so I am not sure about these departments? I guess if you want some Under Armor products then this is the place to go because I see aisles upon endless aisles of these types of products.
target: In Pittsburgh, there are few options for sporting goods, with Dick's being the main chain in the area. However, their selection in snowboarding and biking sections is lacking and more geared towards beginners. While the store itself is average, they do have a wide range of Under Armor products. It would be great to see them carrying more high-end products, though I cannot speak to their fishing or hunting departments.

source:
I enter every sporting goods stores as a soccer player, runner, and sports fan, so my reviews will always be skewed towards those particular areas. With that said, this is probably the worst Dick's location that I've ever been to. The selection is very limited for soccer gear, which must be a testament to the lack of the local customer base seeking out soccer gear. It's mostly low-end youth gear, too, which makes it nearly useless to adults or even some teenage soccer players.

The staff at this location has always been really nice, though, and it's the closest location to where we live, so I still end up going there quite a bit for running and clothing needs (of course, we usually leave empty-handed as they don't have what we're looking for). 

They do have quite an extensive fan gear section if you're looking to support the local Pittsburgh teams, but this store just doesn't have the overall inventory necessary to be considered a "good" Dick's location.
target: As someone who is passionate about sports, particularly soccer and running, my visits to sporting goods stores are often focused on these areas. However, my experience at the Dick's location I recently visited was disappointing. The selection of soccer gear was severely limited, indicating a lack of interest in the sport from the local community. Additionally, the youth-oriented gear was of little use to adult or teenage players. On a positive note, the staff was always friendly and helpful, and the store was conveniently located. While they did have a strong selection of fan merchandise for Pittsburgh teams, overall, this store did not meet the criteria of a high-quality Dick's location. Despite this, I may still visit the store for my running and clothing needs, but I often leave empty-handed due to their limited inventory.

source: living alone I love the 5 for $20 deals they have on meat. I also love Faygo products when I have a party or bbq so their sales are always right on time. They don't have as many stores in the area but they are worth checking out. The lines are a lot shorter and the staff is a lot friendlier.
target: Living independently, I find great joy in the meat deals offered by 5 for $20. Faygo products also make my parties and barbecues a hit, and I always look forward to their timely sales. While they may not have as many locations in my vicinity, it's definitely worth exploring as the shorter lines and friendly staff make for a pleasant shopping experience.

source: This store has changed hands many times over the past few years and it shows. Fifteen years ago if you didn't get there by 9am you would have fight a crowd. Now it never seems all that busy. Many of the store's best and dedicated employees left or were let go (about five years ago) and product lines change with each new owner. The most recent owner seems to be improving the store and employee turnover has seemed to slow.
target: Over the past few years, this store has gone through several changes in ownership which have left their mark. Back in the day, if you didn't make it to the store by 9am, you'd have to push your way through the crowd. Nowadays, it's never quite as packed.
